Von 2000 bis 2007 lebte sie in Paris und nahm dort zunächst Schauspielunterricht im Théâtre du Lucernaire, dann am Conservatoire Charles Munch. Im Théâtre du Lucernaire wirkte sie unter anderem in „Les Papotins ” und „Don Quichotte” mit. Ebenso beim Festival d’Avignon. Zudem schloss sie ein Studium der englischen Sprache und Literatur an der Sorbonne mit einer Maîtrise über Beckett ab. 2005 gründete sie zusammen mit Clément Labail das Théâtre Au fil des nuages. Außerdem arbeitete sie mehrere Jahre als Kursleiterin für Kinder- und Erwachsenentheater in Paris.

L'illustratrice : Mai-Loan Tu a fait ses premières armes à l’Ecole de recherche graphique de Bruxelles, où elle est notamment repérée lors du Festival de l’affiche politique de Mons en 2010. Elle rejoint ensuite Barcelone pour y intégrer L’EINA en 2010. Depuis, son dessin réaliste emprunt d’absurde et de poésie a conquis son monde avec pas moins de trois expositions personnelles, dont une au Venezuela, et trois expositions collectives à Barcelone. Participation à un programme d’échange transculturel Turquie-Europe. En 2012, elle remporte le prix du dessin de la Foire internationale d’art contemporain, la SWAB, de Barcelone.

http://cargocollective.com/mailoantu

Die Illustratorin : Mai-Loan Tu - erste Schritte in der Ecole de recherche graphique de Bruxelles, wo sie vor allem während des Festivals de l’affiche politique de Mons 2010 auffällt. Gleich im Anschluss nach Barcelona zur L’EINA. Seither hat ihr realistischer Stil - geprägt von absurdem und poetischem - in nicht weniger als drei individuellen Ausstellungen überzeugt, darunter eine in Venezuela, und in drei Gemeinschaftsausstellungen in Barcelona. Weiterhin: Teilnahme an einem interkulturellen Austauschprogramm Turkei-Europa. Und 2012 war sie Gewinnerin bei der internationalen zeitgenössische Fachmesse fürs Zeichnen, der SWAB, in Barcelona.


A quoi sert cet appel à souscription et aux dons ?

Wozu dient dieses Crowdfunding?

La somme que nous avons fixée comme objectif recouvre uniquement les frais d'impression du livre, ce qui est la condition sine qua non pour la parution de celui-ci, et ce, dans les meilleures conditions possibles. Le tirage de ce livre bilingue de 120 pages est prévu à 400 exemplaires, en impression offset avec deux illustrations intérieures en couleur, dans un format de 22 x 19 cm. Son prix de vente à parution s'élèvera à 18 €.

Die Zielsumme dient dazu, die Druckkosten zu decken, also, die Grundlage für die Veröffentlichung - und zwar um eine bestmögliche Qualität zu erzielen. 120 Seiten,  400 Exemplare, offset-Druck, inklusive zwei Illustrationen, im Format: 22 x 19 cm. 18 € wird das Buch danach kosten.

Si nous atteignons cet objectif, les sommes récoltées après cet appel à souscription par la vente de l'ouvrage nous permettront de pouvoir envisager un peu plus sereinement d'autres projets de livre de cette envergure et d'enrichir ainsi la catalogue des éditions A verse. Soutenir ce livre dès maintenant, c'est donc soutenir également la vie à venir de notre maison d'édition.

Wenn wir das Ziel erreichen und das Buch gut verkaufen, wird es uns weiterhin unseren Verlag und sein Weiterbestehen  unterstützen.

En revanche, si nous n'atteignons pas l'objectif fixé, nous serons contraints d'alléger le cahier des charges de la réalisation de ce livre et de proposer une facture de moindre qualité. Or, nous souhaitons vraiment pouvoir mettre en valeur le travail de l'auteur, de sa traductrice ainsi que de l'illustratrice par un livre de belle facture, ce qui contribuera aussi à faciliter sa diffusion.

Sollten wir dieses Ziel jedoch nicht erreichen, müssen muss das Buch in geringerer Zahl und in wesentlich geringerer Qualität gedruckt werden. Wir möchten jedoch die Arbeit  des Autoren, der Übersetzerin sowie der Illustratorin durch ein schönes Objekt wertschätzen.

Quoi qu'il en soit, étant donné notre statut associatif, tous les dons supérieurs au prix de souscription, soit 15 €, sont déductibles des impôts à 66 %, déduction faite du prix de souscription du livre. Dans ce cas, vous recevrez un reçu fiscal de l'association au moment de l'envoi des contreparties.

Bien entendu, tous ceux qui auront aidé à la parution du livre seront conviés à une belle soirée de lancement du livre à Paris.


D'autres façons de nous aider

Andere Möglichkeiten uns zu unterstützen

Si vous avez envie de soutenir davantage ou autrement notre projet, n'hésitez pas à relayer l'information auprès de vos contacts. Vous pouvez par exemple utiliser les outils de partage de cette page.

Par ailleurs, vous pouvez découvrir les autres réalisations des éditions A verse sur notre site : www.a-verse.org 

Enfin, si vous connaissez en France ou en Allemagne des salles susceptibles d'accueillir une représentation de la pièce par la compagnie de l'auteur, nous vous serions reconnaissants de nous le faire savoir.

Wenn Sie uns weiter bzw. auf anderen Wegen unterstützen möchten, bitte leiten Sie diese Information an ihre Konkakte weiter.

Hier können Sie weitere Ausgaben und Projekte des Verlags entdecken: www.a-verse.org

Und, wenn Sie in Frankreich und Deutschland Spielorte kennen, die für eine Aufführung durch Au fil des nuages geeignet wären, melden Sie sich bitte bei uns.


Et après ?

Und danach ?

Clément Labail et sa compagnie de théâtre Au fil des nuages prévoient une tournée franco-allemande de représentations de Manèges. Affaire à suivre, donc ! Clément Labail plant mit seinem Théâtre Au fil des nuages eine Tournee von Manèges von Deutschland nach Frankreich. Fortsetzung folgt: http://maneges2015kreise.wordpress.com

L'essentiel du projet
Kurz zusammengefasst
Pour leur deuxième livre, les éditions À verse se tournent vers le théâtre et choisissent de faire paraître Manèges de Clément Labail, une pièce originale, rythmée et poétique. Le livre paraîtra au début de 2015 sous forme bilingue (texte original en français et traduction en allemand), forme qui correspond à l'identité de cette pièce, jouée par la compagnie franco-allemande de l'auteur, tantôt dans une langue, tantôt dans l'autre.
Nous vous invitons dès maintenant à soutenir la parution de ce livre !
Das zweite Buch, das der Verlag A verse herausgeben wird, ist ein Theatertext: “Manèges” von Clément Labail. Originell, poetisch, rythmisch. Das Buch wird Anfang 2015 in einer zweisprachigen Ausgabe (Ursprungstext auf Französisch, Übersetzung auf Deutsch) veröffentlicht. Die Zweisprachigkeit passt zur Identität dieses Stückes, welches von der vom Autor gegründeten deutsch-französischen Theatergruppe Au fil des nuages in beiden Sprachen inszeniert und aufgeführt wurde.
Seien Sie dabei und unterstützen Sie schon jetzt die Veröffentlichung des Buches!

Manèges : un nouveau défi pour les éditions A verse
À verse est une association loi 1901 qui édite une revue semestrielle de poésie depuis 2008, désormais ancrée dans le paysage de la jeune poésie contemporaine et reconnue par ses pairs. À ce titre, elle est invitée et participe régulièrement à de très nombreux salons du livre et de poésie dans toute la France, et est distribuée en France et en Europe.
A verse hat sich als Association 1901 (gemeinnütziger, eingetragener Verein nach dem Gesetz des 1.Juli 1901) in Frankreich gegründet und bringt seit 2008 halbjährlich eine Literaturzeitschrift heraus. Inzwischen ist sie in der jungen zeitgenössischen Poesielandschaft anerkannt. Sie wird oft zu zahlreichen Literatur- und Poesiefachmessen eingeladen und in ganz Frankreich und Europa vertrieben. 
En 2012, forte du soutien de nombreux professionnels, poètes et universitaires, elle a décidé de créer sa propre maison d’édition avec la parution d'un premier titre, Piliers, premier recueil de poèmes d'Alena Meas.
Ermutigt durch zahlreiche Fachleute, Dichter und Doktoranten wurde aus A verse ein Verlag. Das erste Buch “Piliers”, der erste Gedichtband von Alena Meas.
Le projet de l'édition de Manèges de Clément Labail est un projet de longue date qui nous tient à cœur. La
publication de ce texte met en effet en œuvre l’objectif principal de notre
maison d’édition, à savoir soutenir la jeune création et ses
auteurs, pour lesquels il est souvent difficile de trouver une
concrétisation éditoriale, même avec des manuscrits de qualité.
Publier Manèges
est donc pour nous un moyen de permettre de faire entendre une des
nouvelles voix dramaturgiques du paysage contemporain. Forte de
l’expérience de la représentation par l’auteur – également
comédien – et sa compagnie, cette pièce trouve aujourd’hui
grâce à l’édition un chemin de renouveau servi par un texte
pleinement abouti et ainsi la possibilité d’une recréation
scénique accompagnée par une diffusion textuelle concrète.

Seit langem ist es uns ein Anliegen, das Stück “Manèges” von Clément Labail zu veröffentlichen. Wichtiger Ansatz bei unserer Arbeit ist,  junge Autoren zu unterstützen und zu fördern. Diese Veröffentlichung gibt uns die Gelegenheit, den neuen dramaturgischen Stimmen einen Platz zu geben. Mit dem Hintergrund der Inszenierung durch das Théâtre Au fil des nuages findet dieses Stück im Zuge der Veröffentlichung eine ausgereifte Form, welche von der Neuinszenierung begleitet wird.

était née dans le cœur de la compagnie de théâtre

Participation à un programme d’échange transculturel Turquie-Europe. En 2012, elle remporte le prix du dessin de la Foire internationale d’art contemporain, la SWAB, de Barcelone.

http://cargocollective.com/mailoantu

Die Illustratorin : Mai-Loan Tu - erste Schritte in der Ecole de recherche graphique de Bruxelles, wo sie vor allem während des Festivals de l’affiche politique de Mons 2010 auffällt. Gleich im Anschluss nach Barcelona zur L’EINA. Seither hat ihr realistischer Stil - geprägt von absurdem und poetischem - in nicht weniger als drei individuellen Ausstellungen überzeugt, darunter eine in Venezuela, und in drei Gemeinschaftsausstellungen in Barcelona. Weiterhin: Teilnahme an einem interkulturellen Austauschprogramm Turkei-Europa. Und 2012 war sie Gewinnerin bei der internationalen zeitgenössische Fachmesse fürs Zeichnen, der SWAB, in Barcelona.


A quoi sert cet appel à souscription et aux dons ?

Wozu dient dieses Crowdfunding?

La somme que nous avons fixée comme objectif recouvre uniquement les frais d'impression du livre, ce qui est la condition sine qua non pour la parution de celui-ci, et ce, dans les meilleures conditions possibles. Le tirage de ce livre bilingue de 120 pages est prévu à 400 exemplaires, en impression offset avec deux illustrations intérieures en couleur, dans un format de 22 x 19 cm. Son prix de vente à parution s'élèvera à 18 €.
Die Zielsumme dient dazu, die Druckkosten zu decken, also, die Grundlage für die Veröffentlichung - und zwar um eine bestmögliche Qualität zu erzielen. 120 Seiten,  400 Exemplare, offset-Druck, inklusive zwei Illustrationen, im Format: 22 x 19 cm. 18 € wird das Buch danach kosten.
Si nous atteignons cet objectif, les sommes récoltées après cet appel à souscription par la vente de l'ouvrage nous permettront de pouvoir envisager un peu plus sereinement d'autres projets de livre de cette envergure et d'enrichir ainsi la catalogue des éditions A verse. Soutenir ce livre dès maintenant, c'est donc soutenir également la vie à venir de notre maison d'édition.
Wenn wir das Ziel erreichen und das Buch gut verkaufen, wird es uns weiterhin unseren Verlag und sein Weiterbestehen  unterstützen.
En revanche, si nous n'atteignons pas l'objectif fixé, nous serons contraints d'alléger le cahier des charges de la réalisation de ce livre et de proposer une facture de moindre qualité. Or, nous souhaitons vraiment pouvoir mettre en valeur le travail de l'auteur, de sa traductrice ainsi que de l'illustratrice par un livre de belle facture, ce qui contribuera aussi à faciliter sa diffusion.

Sollten wir dieses Ziel jedoch nicht erreichen, müssen muss das Buch in geringerer Zahl und in wesentlich geringerer Qualität gedruckt werden. Wir möchten jedoch die Arbeit  des Autoren, der Übersetzerin sowie der Illustratorin durch ein schönes Objekt wertschätzen.
Quoi qu'il en soit, étant donné notre statut associatif, tous les dons supérieurs au prix de souscription, soit 15 €, sont déductibles des impôts à 66 %, déduction faite du prix de souscription du livre. Dans ce cas, vous recevrez un reçu fiscal de l'association au moment de l'envoi des contreparties.
Bien entendu, tous ceux qui auront aidé à la parution du livre seront conviés à une belle soirée de lancement du livre à Paris.



D'autres façons de nous aider

Andere Möglichkeiten uns zu unterstützen

Si vous avez envie de soutenir davantage ou autrement notre projet, n'hésitez pas à relayer l'information auprès de vos contacts. Vous pouvez par exemple utiliser les outils de partage de cette page.
Par ailleurs, vous pouvez découvrir les autres réalisations des éditions A verse sur notre site : www.a-verse.org 
Enfin, si vous connaissez en France ou en Allemagne des salles susceptibles d'accueillir une représentation de la pièce par la compagnie de l'auteur, nous vous serions reconnaissants de nous le faire savoir.

Wenn Sie uns weiter bzw. auf anderen Wegen unterstützen möchten, bitte leiten Sie diese Information an ihre Konkakte weiter.
Hier können Sie weitere Ausgaben und Projekte des Verlags entdecken: www.a-verse.org
Und, wenn Sie in Frankreich und Deutschland Spielorte kennen, die für eine Aufführung durch Au fil des nuages geeignet wären, melden Sie sich bitte bei uns.



Et après ?

Und danach ?



Clément Labail et sa compagnie de théâtre Au fil des nuages prévoient une tournée franco-allemande de représentations de Manèges. Affaire à suivre, donc ! Clément Labail plant mit seinem Théâtre Au fil des nuages eine Tournee von Manèges von Deutschland nach Frankreich. Fortsetzung folgt: http://maneges2015kreise.wordpress.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Charlie Fenton and I have always been into history. My obsession is Tudor history and Anne Boleyn. I have also always liked writing and reading books, however I found that many historical novels either showed Anne in a negative way/didn't tell the whole story. They may not have mentioned Henry Percy or Anne Boleyn's sister, Mary, who was probably the reason why Anne didn't want to become the King's mistress. This project does need funding as I cannot do it all on my own. I have paid for many books to research from and also the first part of the editing, but I need your help to finish the book. The book I am writing is called Perseverance, it starts in 1522 when Anne Boleyn arrives at the English court and plays the part of Perseverance in the Chateau Vert. She is soon caught in a love affair with Henry Percy, as well as being Thomas Wyatt's obsession, which both end badly. She also sees how the King treats her sister and so, when the King turns his attentions to her, she is wary. She tries to stay away but soon finds herself falling for him as well. However, under no circumstances will she be discarded like her sister was. 


What We Need & What You Get

I need £500 in funding for the book cover art, editing and distribution. The cover art is around £90, the editing is £300 and the distribution costs are £90.  Yes the figures don’t quite add up, leaving £10 to spare but I have already paid for some of the editing already. Also, this is more of a pre-ordering campaign, it will guarantee that you get the book and you will be helping to make it. Plus the minimum amount you can set on here is £500.

Everyone who donates will be listed as a supporter on my blog and will receive a thank you email from me. You can £5 you will get an ebook copy on release day, or if you give £10 you will get a paperback copy instead. Each one of the physical items will say how much you will have to add if you it want to ship internationally (outside the UK). As you want to give more money, you can get an ARC which is an Advance Reader's Copy. This means that you get an early copy of the book before everyone else, the cover design and edits however may not all be finished. That does though make it unique as these will not be for sale. I have also contacted TudorDynastyJewels who have allowed me to give away their Anne Boleyn Story Charm Bracelet and if you give enough you will also receive this:

Each charm represents a moment in Anne's life. There are also combined tiers as you give more money, for example you can receive an ebook copy as well as a paperback copy. Some of you can also receive a video of the author reading part of the book (which will not be shown anywhere else) as well as a completely unique video message. All of the signed books will be dedicated, so please tell me what name you want to put down (or two if you are receiving two copies of the book). 

If the project doesn't reach it's goal, you will still receive your book. I have started paying the editor a little out of my own money and, even though it will not be as polished and the cover art won't be as good if we don't reach the target, the book will be released. However, I do really need your help as I have bought a piece of artwork but need a cover designer to do the writing, spine and back cover as well. Here is my draft and as you can tell, it isn't professional:


I aim to get this book out by late autumn/winter 2014. However, if all goes well and as my editor is already onto it, it may come out sooner. I will keep everyone updated about it if there are any delays. 

    Stretch Goals

    If we manage to receive over £500, the money will go towards audiobooks as well as translations. I want as many people as possible to read this and hopefully understand and love Anne Boleyn just like I do. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't contribute please share and tell as many people as you can about this. You can share it on Facebook, Twitter, anywhere.

story:
The zine I publish monthly online and in print, 19. Keep Hoping Machine Running, will be included in DIAMOND LEAVES: Artist Books from around the World curated by Xu Bing and Booklyn's Marshall Weber. The show will run September 18 - October 28, 2012 at Central Academy of Fine Arts Museum in Beijing, China. It will bring together over 200 contemporary artists' books, including works by Marcel DuChamp, John Cage, Ed Ruscha, Roy Lichtenstein, Robert Motherwell and more. This is the first major museum exhibition of contemporary international Artist Books in China.

I am currently seeking travel funds to attend the opening ceremony on September 18, 2012 as well as conduct research for an upcoming film.

In the event that the goal is not met, each dollar will go towards ongoing printing costs and boxset preparation for the 2012 issues.

Thank you in advance for the support!

Learn more here- http://keephopingmachinerunning.tumblr.com

View press release here- Diamond Leaves: Artist Books from around the World

story:
Me

I am a 30 something enthusiast, working as a PR for the rock band "Hype!", a fitness instructor, lyric writer, writer, photographer and a supporter of everyone’s causes. I believe that there are still good people in this world, that want to help somebody with their fight to make their dreams come true.
So…I just want to try this out, maybe I get lucky. Who knows? I’m kind of counting on you…could you maybe…?

 

The Spare Change for Horror

Your spare change - my chance to get my book published.


The book is called "Darkness and Revenge – Puppetmaster’s game" and is a non-classical vampire story. Love-triangle. Passion. Hate. Revenge. 
I am working on a translation, so if I get a chance to publish it, I will give my best to send the translated version to all the people who helped me reach my goal. You know, as a bonus, in order to tell you how much I appreciate your help.

The importance of your support

Artists these days have a really hard time to get to their goals. It doesn’t take much if there are enough people willing to help. On my own? I’m not sure I can make it. So your support is invaluable and means very, very much.

 

How  I would use the money 


I will invest it in publishing my book.

Every penny means a lot to me. I am aware that I will never be able to repay you, but I gladly offer these perks for your efforts: 

 

1 € - Your name in the status of my FB page 

5 €  - Your name and picture in the album of donors on my FB profile

10 € - A short story of your choice, in PDF format

15 € - A short story of your choice printed out, signed personally, and sent per post to you

30 € - A story of your choice - where you can choose the ending, printed out, signed personally, and sent per post to you

50 € - A long story with you as a main character in it

more then 100 € - You will be one of the characters in the book I am writing at the moment (your name, how you look (appearance), some of your abilities and habits or other things you want me to use)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute directly, you can still help:

    Tell your horror-loving friends and family about the project
    Use the Indiegogo's share tools to spread the word.

 

THANK YOU <3!

story:
The Story

No one tells you what to do when your heart is ripped out.

As I walked through my own path of divorce, I came to realize how many hurting people there are who feel completely isolated. None of us know what we'll do when we lose someone close to us.

This isn't a "divorce only" book. It's for anyone who's lost a relationship: a college student going through their first break up, young parents who've lost a child, adults grieving the loss of an elderly father or mother.

For the men who feel unable to express what they're processing and the women who always wonder what's going on in guys' heads, here's your chance to climb inside of my mind and take a glimpse into my broken journey.

Where the funds will go

The funds being raised will go to cover the cost of:
- manuscript editing
- book trailer cinematography
- cover photo
- ISBN purchases
- cover layout and graphic design
- interior layout
- e-Book layout (Kindle .mobi file)

The Impact

This isn't about making money or selling a ton of books. This was a healing process for me, and if one person reads my story and realizes that they're not alone and that there is One relationship that will always be there, then I'll have succeeded.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can contribute $2 or $1200 or if you just take a moment to share this story with your friends or anyone you know who might be encouraged by it, I'll be so thankful.

story:
Short Summary

I'm looking to publish my second book, a comedic novel called The Hack, in spring. And while E-publication is free, I belive the most people, like myself, prefer the feel of a physical book in their hand and to get it from a brick and mortar neighborhood book store. That is the kind of publication I wish to be a part of because it is the world that I want to live in and that I believe others do as well.

However, rather than take part in the toxic atmosphere of the corporate publishing world, I'd prefer to publish The Hack independently like I did with my debut book, Secrets & Lies. That way the book is funded by the people that will appreciate it most: its own audience.

This campaign will pre-sell the book and offer supplementary materials to fund The Hack's independent publication.

The Book

Hamilton Brownstone’s father died when he was six. At the funeral he met a strange, angry boy named Gardner: the brother from another family that neither he nor his mother had known about.

In the years since that meeting, Gardner won the lottery and has used the money on a campaign of self-destruction, largely through his hobby of applying for minimum wage jobs. His goal is rock-bottom, something he can't ever seem to pull off. Hamilton’s bigggest  accomplishment since their meeting is a job at a disco-themed hot dog counter.

Faced with no accomplishements of note, Hamilton has decided to live out the lives of famour writers in order to channel them and write a book.

However between his mother’s neediness, his girlfriend’s acting ambitions and his boss’s constant attempts to make him manager, Hamilton bizarrely decides  the only way he’ll be able to finish his book is in prison.

And there’s only one person willing to help Hamilton end up there: his brother Gardner.

Critical Praise for my first book Secrets & Lies

“Josh has a talent for creating an instant connection with a character and his or her story that, unfortunately seems to be rare in the world of writing today.”

-The Idaho Statesman

“The originality in his approach and his grip of humor writing knock the wind out of me.”

-Boulder Weekly

“[His] are the kind of soul-molesting stories that are difficult to forget, and would be a shame to miss out on.”

-LauraReviewsBooks.com

What This Campaign Needs & What You Get

To effectively and legitmately publish The Hack independently, I need the money to print and promote the book in a professional fashion.

The costs to do so are itemized below

Design fees: $250 

UPC cost:$19.99

Printing costs: $1,400.

Prices quoted from Boise Metro Printing for 180 4x7 pages perfect bound are below.

  • 500 @ $2.80=$1,400,
  • 300 @$2.99=$897
  • 100 @$3.42=$342.

Postage to send out perks:$2.41 per copy. Assuming 100 copies pre-sold, that's $241.

P.R. costs:$300 advertising and marketing materials budget.

NW Book Tour costs:$400 in assorted travel and promotional costs.

Sub-Total: 2,860.99.

IndieGoGo fees: $177.66.

Total: $3,038.65.

The Impact

A book can come out two ways: in a well-orchestrated manner that is likely to make it successful, or in an unfocused trickle that ensures its obscurity. The success of this campaign will ensure The Hack comes out in the former, rather than the latter.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Post this campaign to social media feeds.
  • Write about the campaign or the book on your blog.
  • Share my first book Secrets & Lies with your friends and social networks.
  • Rate Secrets & Lies on Amazon.

story:
Give the Gift That Can Save a Life...

The goal is to make both books available in print and ready to ship for the holidays.

We encourage everyone to share the knowledge that you really CAN heal yourself with one plant grown in your back yard and processed into an extract on your back porch.


Everyone knows someone affected by cancer.

Today's conventional cancer treatment regimen is about making money. It is a 120 billion dollar a year industry in the United States alone, and estimated to be a 600 billion dollar a year industry worldwide.

People facing cancer will continue to lose their savings, homes and health to standardized medicine and big pharma unless we, the people, inform one another that a better, safer, more effective alternative DOES exist.

I ask you to join me, and be a part of the solution. - Rick Simpson



PHOENIX TEARS- The Rick Simpson Story


Rick Simpson takes you on a journey that is likely to change your life and the way you look at the cannabis plant, your Government & big pharma.

Relive one man’s journey of rediscovering the cannabis plant’s natural healing ability in cancer and other diseases. And what happened when he tried to alert the world that he just might have found the cure for cancer.

Having healed over 5,000 people using only cannabis extract medicine from plants grown in his yard, and processed on his back porch, Rick Simpson outlines his experience with both the patients he healed and the institutions which he attempted to educate.

NOTE: Bonus material: includes FAQ’s in this edition


PHOENIX TEARS- Nature's Answer For Cancer

Phoenix Tears, Rick Simpson Oil, Nature’s Answer For Cancer is a summary of information that is currently available about the use of cannabis/hemp oil as medicine. It includes detailed information about how to produce and use the Rick Simpson Oil in the treatment of practically all illnesses.

story:
Short Summary

So here is the deal in short:

  • I am a paranormal researcher with over 13 years in the field and have been to some of the most exciting locations.
  • I want to write a second book sharing my experiences, but the fact is, writing a book takes time and ordering copies of the book even for myself costs money.
  • This campaign will free up my time to be able to go in depth with a second book, talk about the locations not written about in the first one, and also to explain some of the new findings, techniques, and include a chapter on misidentification of every day happenings that people confuse with paranormal activity.

Why should you contribute??

What We Need & What You Get

Let me break it down:

  • $800 is a small goal, but it's a good starting point. The minimum. After IndieGoGo fees, paypal fees, etc, it will leave me with just enough to cover my time for writing without going into debt.
  • Going over $800 will activate stretch goals, and with stretch goals come bigger and better perks. We're already offering some pretty nice perks, so this will just add to the experience.
  • Think of it as pre-ordering the next book. Some of the perks include copies of the original book, as well as copies of the new book as soon as it's available. The perks will be cheaper than anything you will be able to buy via Amazon, Barnes & Noble, Books a Million, etc once the book is released.

STRETCH GOALS:

The Impact

Here is what your contribution will do for the project:

  • It will allow me to focus on writing the book and putting out the best possible product.
  • The last book "I Am a Ghost Hunter" got RAVE reviews on Amazon, and has sold over 1500 copies JUST at the events I have personally sold them at. Amazon has recorded over 6,500 sales of the book alone. Not bad for a first book, eh?
  • With so many ways of picking up a book these days, this is the easiest way to get a physical book IN YOUR HANDS. Digital copies are available as well, but really, is there ANYTHING else like sitting in your room, in the dark, with a flashlight while reading about experiencing real life hauntings?

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • We understand not everyone can help with funds. That's why we make it easy for you, if you decide you cannot spare even a single dollar, just do us a huge favor and tell a friend. Share it on your Facebook, Twitters, Reddits, Instagrams, etc and help us get the word out.
  • You can use built in share tools via IndieGoGo or you can just copy and paste the link. If you would like to join our campaign team and help spread the word that way, just let us know!

We'll add stretch goals as we get closer to reaching the actual goal. Some of the perks to look forward to will be, signed PROOF copies, signed original cover art, exclusive photo sets, access to web only content that will accompany the stories you are reading in the book just to name a few. Thank you in advance and I look forward to your support!

story:
Who is Ranger Rom?

Welcome to the world of Ranger Rom. I am extremely passionate about wildlife and conserving our precious resources on our planet. It is my vision to educate young children and adults about our wildlife, by leveraging the latest technologies such as phone apps and children picture books.  

This project is about publishing the very first Ranger Rom's children's picture book.

I have already developed and publish the first Ranger Rom quiz game, which helps children's and adults learn about wildlife, it can be found on the Apple Store and Google Play. 

 

Please have a look at the Ranger Rom Website for more details.
There is also an awesome blog to get a taste of Ranger Rom and his friends.

I have also spent over 4 months in the african bush, learning about wildlife and have earned my certification as a Professional Field Guide, so that I can draw from a vast reservoir of wildlife knowledge for future Ranger Rom adventure stories.

This project is all about publishing a printed children's picture book as well as a Kindle digital picture book version.  This is extremely important, as it will allow Ranger Rom to interact with children and educate them on current wildlife conservation challenges, in a fun and engaging way.

Without your help, I feel it will be a huge loss to the next generation of children, who will lose out on being aware of how wildlife plays a very important ecological role, here on planet earth, and, have fun at the same time.

Ranger Rom will show our next generation:

  • How elephants contribute to recycling nutrients by pulling down trees.
  • Why poachers are killing Rhino's.
  • How the Dinosaurs died out.
  • Why animals are endangered and much more.

It is my vision to produce more education games and books for Ranger Rom, and eventually have a cartoon produced in the future; to get there, I need to make little steps forward, and this first step into the children picture book world, will get us closer to realising the vision and reaching for the skies.


What We Need & What You Get

Where will funds be allocated?

  • Publishing the children's picture book for print (Softcover)
  • High quality paper due to the vibrant colours used
  • Amazon kindle direct publishing (Kindle Edition)
  • Copywriting
  • Legal Fees
  • 30 Illustrations
  • Marketing
  • Distribution

Publishing is a very expensive channel, however, the benefits will allow me to keep total control on the writing and look and feel of the books.

Where will extra funds be allocated towards?

  • The ongoing hosting costs for the Ranger Rom game, media content and website
  • Publishing subsequent children picture books
  • Updates to the Ranger Rom mobile game app

What about the perks, if I contribute?

There are some awesome perks, ranging from a free digital copy of the book, stickers to a full copy of the book, and even a guided tour by Ranger Rom in a South African Game Reserve.

The Impact

With your contribution and my proven track record in the successful development of the Ranger Rom Phone/Tablet app, it is only a matter of time before Ranger Rom takes over the world! Imagine the day, when children are walking to school with their Ranger Rom backpack, and watching Ranger Rom cartoons on television.

I believe this is all possible, the only obstacle is $$$, and with your contribution, we will be making Ranger Rom an awesome experience for our next generation. Let's make this project a success together, and then join forces in the future for the next big challenge and race ahead!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you have not got any $$$ to contribute, but really want to help, then please share Ranger Rom with your friends and family and even use the indiegogo social sharing tools. I encourage you to share the links of the game app as well, at the Apple Store and Google Play. 

Thank You

Ranger Rom

story:
Short Summary

See www.slowboatsailing.com
I am writing a funny memoir about my misadventures on sailboats and the big trip from New Orleans to the Bahamas on a 31' sailboat from December 2014 to May 2015.  I sail with my 4 pound toy poodle, my 4 year old daughter, and my wife.

New Street Communications is the publisher of sailing books and audiobooks by authors such as Steve Callahan and Lin and Larry Pardey.  New Street Communications has accepted this book for publication. 

 I have earned a doctor of philosophy from Oxford University and an the author of dozens of technical articles.  I am also an unpaid contributor to major news outlets.  My work has been mentioned in major news publications such as the New York Times and Wall Street Journal.

The Impact

These funds will defray some of the costs of the trip and the researching of this book.

Other Ways You Can Help

Buy the book or audiobook when it is published!  Give the book a good review on Amazon.com or other Audible.com.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Que?

Don Pepe é unha obra pendurada no aire, referente puro diso que veñen a chamar a narración abismada, onde cada conto garda un novo no seu interior; de xeito que a estructura flúe sinuosa coma un río de camiño ao seu fin, que non e outro que o mar...

Unha novela que, ademais, foi finalista no Certame de Novela Do Peirao.

Pepe, mexicano por máis de sesenta anos, era un lector voraz de poesía galega. Atopábaa pueril, ignorante, aburrida e, por riba de todo, artificial. Con todo, non era quen de se deitar sen recitar algún verso deses poemas que non xulgaba separados dos seus poetas: xente nova de mans grandes e pel ennegrecida, mulleres abandonadas polas ocupacións dos maridos e a miseria da terra, nenos de escola, libre pensadores fracasados, ou pervertidos con sorte. Estaba seguro de que endexamais serían bos escritores e negábase a envexalos, malia lelos e estudalos dun xeito enfermizo.

Esta é a trama da novela, na que o seu personaxe principal, Pepiño, describe as lembranzas da súa Boborás natal, e a súa querenza pola súa lingua e a súa cultura, que levan a que queira ser escritor e novelar, versar e contar.

Quen?

Do Peirao é unha editorial con vontade de cambio, de dar a alternativa a autores que non a atopan noutro lugar, con novas e refrescantes ideas como é o empregar unha campaña preventa para valorar a aceptación e viabilidade de cada título.

Deste xeito es ti, agora que te estás expondo como colaborar, o que decide se a obra que che presentamos verá a luz pasando a formar parte do noso catálogo... porque consideramos ao lector parte fundamental do proceso.

Hoxe presentámoste a Moncho Iglesias Míguez.

Nacido en 1974 en Vigo malia ser de Boborás, viviu en Irlanda, México, India, Palestina e China, onde exerceu como mestre e mantivo viva a súa creación literaria. Neses camiños escribiu ensaios como Os contos de animais na tradición oral palestina; poemarios como pedras de Plastilina, novelas como Tres cores: azul e traduciu tamén, entre outros a Mahmud Darwix, dende o árabe, a Etgar Keret, dende o hebreo, e a Randa Jarrar dende o inglés. Amais, colabora en Praza pública, Tempos Novos e Dorna, e na actualidade vive en Bangladesh dende onde fixo os seus últimos traballos literarios: a tradución dos poemas de Martín Códax ao hebreo e ao árabe.

Por que?

Por aquí un fragmento do texto como mostra:

«Pouco se sabe da súa adolescencia. Os poucos datos fiables que aínda se conservan apuntan que foi un neno espelido e controvertido, amante dos animais tallados, e con espírito viaxeiro. Foi quizais esa fame de aventuras a que provocou que perdese o brazo esquerdo e que á vez alimentase a obsesión, que máis tarde se faría evidente, polos champiñóns e froitos do bosque.
     Como no caso de calquera outro artista, a raíz das exposicións, de renome mundial, comezaron a estenderse biografías e datos persoais que moitas das veces non casan entre si. No caso da perda do brazo, hai dúas historias que repiten diversos historiadores refutados e que, polo tanto, cómpre ter en conta»

Como?

Para arrincar o proxecto fixámonos como obxectivo 840€; esta é a cantidade que recadariamos se ao redor de cincuenta mecenas se fixesen, cada cal, cun exemplar desta primeira edición.

  • Tendo acceso ás galeradas de edición.
  • Recibindo un exemplar semanas antes da saída ao mercado da obra.
  • Aínda que, tamén poderías ver o teu nome nos agradecementos achegando un pouco máis.

Os fondos recadados utilizaranse como axuda para sacar adiante esta primeira edición de Don Pepe, que sairía despois á venda.

Ademais...

Sabemos que son tempos difíciles, tamén nós os sufrimos, e é posible que non esteas en disposición de apoiarnos co teu mecenado nestes momentos... pero agardamos que se isto te chegou á alma, mesmo se talvez coñeces en persoa ao autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-orella... ) para que academos a nosa meta e Moncho Iglesias vexa publicada a súa obra.

Grazas polo voso tempo.

story:
About Manfred and Julia

Julia and Manfred are senior Arts Management majors. Both extremely passionate about self-confidence, diversity, and loving yourself, creating a magazine to promote self-love was the obvious choice for these artists.

While Julia uses fashion to express that one can be in love with themselves inside and out, Manfred is taking his love for diversity, social justice, and his passion for all aspects of art, to bring a unique twist to the traditional lifestyle magazine. 

What We Need & What You Get

Daily Moda will cost $1,500 to get up and running. 

  • At just under $9.00 per month, we'll be purchasing our domain for a year for a total cost of $100.
  • Writing is a lot of work, and takes a special skill set, interest, and can be time-consuming. We'd love to pay all of our writers, and will set aside $900 at about 3 articles per week to get the best content out there to our readers.
  • Another $500 will be allotted towards online ads, such as Facebook and Instagram ads, as well as ads on other websites and popular blogs with high traffic. This will help drive traffic to our site, and help get our message of diversity and self-love out there.    
  • If we are not able to reach our goal, the money will still be put to good use, hosting our site being our main goal, and compensating writers being the next. 

The Impact

Confidence is something so many of us struggle with, or have struggled with, and Daily Moda wants people to feel that they are indeed beautiful in their own skin. Daily Moda wants its readers to know that there is beauty in being different, in being an artist, and in being exactly who you are.

Daily Moda also provides a creative outlet for people to be heard and appreciated, especially for those whose voices have not been heard as loudly as others. In a world filled with injustice, Daily Moda serves as a safe space and sanctuary for YOU. 

Risks & Challenges

Marketing a new fashion and lifestyle magazine is a great challenge. There is a lot of effort and time that goes into social media marketing, which will be our main form of communication for this online publication. Being a two-man band, our biggest challenge will be splitting up creating the magazine, running a business, and being marketers all at the same time. However, we are extremely confident that with your help, Daily Moda will succeed, and YOUR voices will be heard far and wide. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Manfred and Julia greatly appreciate all of your time and would be eternally thankful if you could share this page, follow us, and spread the word about Daily Moda and the campaign. The message we wish to send is not exclusive to us two; it's the same message of love and acceptance that we all want to spread. Please don't stress if you are unable to donate; there are other ways to contribute which are absolutely FREE! Simply staying engaged in our content by following us on our social media shows your support and gives your featured peers an audience. You can also contribute by letting your friends and family know what Daily Moda is all about!

And remember, we've only got one month so let's make this happen!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Keisha McDonald, the author of Not Like Me. I am a Limited Licensed Professional Counselor and a foster parent. I believe all children in care should feel and be represented in a positive way. My multicultural books pave the way for children in foster care to know they are not alone and see themselves in a positive light. 

During this campaign I am hoping to raise money to release the next book in the children’s Multicultural Foster care series. 

What We Need & What You Get

Funding raised will go toward the completion of illustrations and the cost to print all pre-ordered books.

The Impact

I would like to be able to provide children coming into foster care or those that are already in care with a book that will help them to process their feelings and emotions without feeling ashamed of those feelings.

    Risks & Challenges

    Self-publishing is a risk and a challenge. I funded Foster care Feelings by myself and now that I've stepped out on faith to write full-time, I'm hoping to publish Not Like Me with your help.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can help by sharing this campaign and by continuing to support The Multicultural Foster care Series. :)

story:
Short Summary

We are two sisters, aged 10 and 8, who founded the award winning social entrepreneurship www.twosistersonamission.com 

"We cannot wait for anyone else to make the difference, we must make the difference ourselves". This was the thought on our mind when we decided to jump, head first, into social entrepreneurship at the age of 9 and 7. Our first business was a gigantic failure  but we learned a lot. Now, at the age of 10 and 8 we have been on Dragons Den, are frequent keynote speakers at over 40 conferences including Microsoft DigiGirlz, Sick Kids and some of the biggest events in Canada. 

In this book we share our story but also a mindset and perspective. This book is not about our accomplishments as we truly believe we are two ordinary girls just like everyone else. This book reflects our most basic belief that anyone can do anything. That Anything is Possible if we believe in the impact it will have and are willing to fight for it. Through this book of over 50,000 words that we worked non-stop to write, we want to scale our impact and empower others to follow their dreams regardless of their age. We all have the power to make an impact. 

By supporting our book, you will help us drive change in the world (please see our website for details).

What We Need & What You Get

Our business is moving very fast and we are very capital efficient. We want to raise our own funds through this book to fund the growth of our business and scale our impact. In addition, we we want to drive real change in hearts and minds so more people can follow their dreams.

Our book contains over 50,000 words and numerous photographs that will bring the journey to life for you. It is an incredible story that will shake you down to your core and inspire you. You will see us this fall on Dragon's Den as we faced the biggest challenge of our life powered by the love of our mentors, our purpose and the power we get knowing that we represent those that need our help.

We are going to physically launch the book on 28th Sep at Experience Your Life Expo in Mississauga (www.experienceyourlife.ca register while tickets last) but are starting the crowdfunding campaign now. In a campaign launch special - you can choose from a combination of rewards:

1) E-Book only

2) Physical Book (9 by 5) in Black and White

3) Physical Book (9 by 5) in Color

4) Physical Book Color + 12 by 15 inch canvas print of your choice from our store

5) Physical Book Color + 18 by 24 inch canvas print of your choice from our store

6) Physical Book Color + an original painting from our artist in Cuba. You choose the painting from our store and we will have it repainted for you! 

The Impact

We are making a real difference in the world and your support will help us scale it. The world does not change with just conversations, it needs our actions. By joining our movement, you are joining a real tribe of change-makers. Please do see the campaign video as it contains our amazing mentors who are supporting us every step of the way. Moreover, please do visit our website to see our global impact

story:
The Polyamory Toolkit is now available! Find out more here! 

https://www.polyamorytoolkit.com/

For nearly two decades Dan and Dawn have navigated their journey in polyamory by being proactive, insightful and analytical. Early on, there was very little information or resources available, so the adventure required them to learn from their mistakes as well as their successes.

Each have multiple partners and have a history of polyamory relationships lasting multiple years. They have put the time and thought into creating a “toolkit” of knowledge others can implement to help their relationships survive and thrive.

Dan and Dawn have co-authored two books previous to this one, and write in an anecdotal, conversational style that is easy to absorb and use. They also co-produce the successful polyamory conference Beyond The Love with partner Karen, and co-host the 9+ year old podcast Erotic Awakening.

The book focuses on specific tools people can use to address the common issues and deeper aspects of a polyamorous relationship. This work includes topics such as: Jealousy, Compersion - finding joy in your partners' joy, Communication, Mitigating Triggers, Creating a Solid Foundation, and so much more.

Chapters Include:

  • And NOT Or  -  Learn to see others as adding to your life instead of replacing something 

  • Uncomfortable vs Wrong - Learn to distinguish between these two perspectives

  • Breaking Habitual Patterns -  You don't have to respond based on your past

  • Place of Assistance - How to help your partners while staying true to yourself 

 

The book is almost complete! There are details such as editing, cover photography and the big one: putting in a printing order since this will be self-published!

Having the support here and “pre-ordering” books through donation will let them launch this quickly and successfully. They can put that large order into the printing company. They can use hire a profesional graphics person for the cover. Dawn will hold back on her secular pursuits so there is more time to push through the last details.

Help Dan and Dawn convert their knowledge, experience and tools into something many can benefit from!

 

 

The Polyamory Toolkit is nearly done!  The only risk involved is a delay in the scheduled delivery of the book. Our timeline has the book in contributors hands by February 1, 2019!

 

 

You'll receive a book (either digital or paperback or both) that is focused on solutions and actionable items to make your poly life better! 

Other great perks include: 

8x10 Limited Edition Prints

Numbered and signed by the artist - Andi Stern ( check out her other vibrant art)

 

A handy journal for your adventures and discoveries

Cover art by artist katie Casey

 

 And Not Or T-shirt

 

 And Not Or Bookmark

 

 

 

Can't contribute financially but want to help? Thank you! 

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

  • You can even use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
¿Qué?

Bruno, narrada en primera persona, se caracteriza por tener un tono directo y una prosa sencilla, llena de referencias al mundo clásico.

Una novela breve que se podría ubicar entre el dietario de ficción y el cuadro de costumbres. El protagonista, alter ego del escritor, es Bruno, un chaval que explica sus vivencias ―algunas cómicas, otras no tanto― que transcurren en el Carmelo, un barrio barcelonés que mira con cierto recelo la llegada de la antorcha olímpica.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy será el propio autor quien se presente.

Me llamo Benet Martín, nací en Barcelona (1978) y ejerzo profesor en el Instituto Màrius Torres de Lleida desde el año 2009. Hice mi primera incursión en el mundo editorial con el relato «Koré» (La fuente de Mimir, Ed. Faunos, 2008). Después recibí un premio ex aequo con el relato «El hombre que siempre leía» (X Premio la Miranda de Cuentos, 2011) y quedé finalista con los relatos «Calbolution» (I concurso de relatos cortos del Segrià, 2011) y «Caminos» (IX Premios literarios Homilías de Organyà, Ediciones Salòria, 2012).

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Le llamábamos el Tocha por el narizón que tenía. Al Matutano su boca le ocupaba media cara cuando reía. El Rana tenía ojos de anfibio. El Maikel vestía como Michael Jackson. Las piernas del Lobo eran todo pelo. El Fraggle se parecía a los muñecos de la conocida serie de televisión. El Muñeco Diabólico tenía la misma cara y altura que el protagonista de la película de miedo. A mí me llamaban el Ojos Tristes porque tenía unas ojeras muy marcadas. Al Monchi solo le faltaba tener enganchada en el culo la mano de un ventrílocuo para ser la copia exacta del famoso muñeco. El Huesitos era un saco de huesos, no tenía ni un gramo de grasa. También estaban el Rufus, el Napis, el Zruspa, el Foofur, el Gordo, el Sevillano, el Seto, el Chechu… La lista era interminable. Todo aquel que ponía los pies en el pasaje tenía un mote, era el documento que validaba tu presencia. Había niños de los que podías conocer su mote y, en cambio, ignorar por completo su nombre de pila. Y es que allí tu nombre cristiano no servía de nada, el pasaje era apto solo para paganos. El hecho de no tener mote en el pasaje significaba que: o bien eras persona non grata, o bien no existías»    

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Bruno que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Benet Martín vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
UPDATE: Due to a mistake on the actual ending of the campaign, I have launched a second one with the correct end date and new goal amount (reduced from the amount I was able to raise in the first campaign)! With the funds I raised from the first campaign I was able to purchase the round trip ticket!!  Now there's just the funds I need to raise for logging, left! There's still time to share and donate to this project, which officially ends May 28th, 2015.  Thanks so much for believing in me and this work!! Send Sojari to Callaloo REDUX!!

Hi. My name is Jari "Sojari" Bradley and I am a queer woman of color, broke college student, and spoken word artist. Out of a great number of applicants,I have recently been accepted to Callaloo's Creative Writing Workshop. I am now trying to get to Callaloo's Creative Writing Workshop which takes place May 31st- June 13th at Brown University in Providence, Rhode Island. You can find out more about Callaloo and its distinguished creative writing program here: http://callaloo.tamu.edu/2015-CCWW-USA

I need to reach my goal by May 28th, which is a very short amount of time. And while this is an incredible honor and a huge opportunity, I am not currently able to afford what it costs to make the trip as a broke college student. I've been spread pretty thin with the work of finishing my senior year as a Sociology major at San Francisco State University, getting things ready for graduation,  preparing myself for Graduate School, and other community-oriented projects (like coaching the Mills College CUPSI Slam Team). This is where I need your help and the help of my community, as it is important to invest in the lives and voices of working poor writers of color so that they may have access to spaces such as these. What you are able to contribute is not only about me realizing my own personal goals, but it is also a contribution to black voice in a time where violence committed against bodies that resemble my own are prevalent nationwide. I seek to utilize my voice in collaboration with other writers of color as a means of resistance, and my participation in Callaloo would greatly assist in that endeavor. 

What I Need

1 Round Trip Flight: $521.20 (PURCHASED!!) 

Room & Board: $1700 

What You Get

A $1 donation gets you a publicly listed thank you as a supporter!

A $5 donation gets you a publicly listed thank you as a supporter + a pdf version of a poem you select!

A $10 donation gets you all of the above + a pdf of my chapbook!

A $25 donation gets you all of the above + a signed and printed copy of my chapbook!

A $50 donation gets you all of the above + a handwritten thank you from Callaloo!

A $75 donation gets you all of the above + a digital download of my mixtape of original songs and poems entitled: Ascension

Risks & Challenges

As a queer woman of color writer, it is also not common for a voice like mine to be celebrated and upheld in mainstream discourse around socioeconomic inequity and police violence against black and brown bodies. My work as a writer, academic, and community leader is centered on making the conversation around black bodies and queer bodies of color more accessible and transparent despite the various obstacles set in place via oppression, racism, sexism, and homophobia. 

Coming from meager means, it is hard to come up with enough money on my own to take this opportunity that has been afforded to me. So without community support, I won't be able to attend Callaloo. But with your help, I can guarantee this opportunity will help me grow in my work immensely.
story_txt:
UPDATE: Due to a mistake on the actual ending of the campaign, I have launched a second one with the correct end date and new goal amount (reduced from the amount I was able to raise in the first campaign)! With the funds I raised from the first campaign I was able to purchase the round trip ticket!!  Now there's just the funds I need to raise for logging, left! There's still time to share and donate to this project, which officially ends May 28th, 2015.  Thanks so much for believing in me and this work!! Send Sojari to Callaloo REDUX!!Hi. My name is Jari "Sojari" Bradley and I am a queer woman of color, broke college student, and spoken word artist. Out of a great number of applicants,I have recently been accepted to Callaloo's Creative Writing Workshop. I am now trying to get to Callaloo's Creative Writing Workshop which takes place May 31st- June 13th at Brown University in Providence, Rhode Island. You can find out more about Callaloo and its distinguished creative writing program here: http://callaloo.tamu.edu/2015-CCWW-USA
I need to reach my goal by May 28th, which is a very short amount of time. And while this is an incredible honor and a huge opportunity, I am not currently able to afford what it costs to make the trip as a broke college student. I've been spread pretty thin with the work of finishing my senior year as a Sociology major at San Francisco State University, getting things ready for graduation,  preparing myself for Graduate School, and other community-oriented projects (like coaching the Mills College CUPSI Slam Team). This is where I need your help and the help of my community, as it is important to invest in the lives and voices of working poor writers of color so that they may have access to spaces such as these. What you are able to contribute is not only about me realizing my own personal goals, but it is also a contribution to black voice in a time where violence committed against bodies that resemble my own are prevalent nationwide. I seek to utilize my voice in collaboration with other writers of color as a means of resistance, and my participation in Callaloo would greatly assist in that endeavor. 

What I Need
1 Round Trip Flight: $521.20 (PURCHASED!!) 
Room & Board: $1700 


What You Get
A $1 donation gets you a publicly listed thank you as a supporter!
A $5 donation gets you a publicly listed thank you as a supporter + a pdf version of a poem you select!
A $10 donation gets you all of the above + a pdf of my chapbook!
A $25 donation gets you all of the above + a signed and printed copy of my chapbook!
A $50 donation gets you all of the above + a handwritten thank you from Callaloo!
A $75 donation gets you all of the above + a digital download of my mixtape of original songs and poems entitled: Ascension

story:
The tour.
 


 

My approach considers sustained impact.

To bring these workshops and readings to facilities around the country, I am partnering with, or in conversation with, vibrant organizations who do this work in a long term capacity in the following areas: New York City area / Adirondacks, NY / Austin, TX / Western MA / Pittsburgh, PH / Bay Area, CA / Los Angeles, LA / Fort Collins, CO / Fayetteville, AR / Portland & Eugene, OR / Chicago, IL / Santa Fe, NM. (Want to know which specific org's? Drop me a line! I'll also reveal them as the campaign kicks into action!)

And let's be honest. $10,000 is a significant amount of money. This amount offers greater reach and access, but the goal is flexible for a reason: what I raise will dictate the amount of work engaged. 
 

But what impact does a workshop make?

We know the arts have been proven to support reduced recidivism and enhance both hard skills and socioemotional development. We know arts programs create a sense of community in a setting where the spectrum of trust is scant to nonexistent. We know arts have the capacity to transform, as a rule, wherever they are employed.

When thinking about this outreach tour, I came up against my own ethics in considering the very idea of what a tour implies. I wondered what it would mean to simply drop into a community once and leave. And then I remembered the words of Samantha, a brilliant participant in my class for two years, who said in a generous testimonial of my facilitation work (and a statement echoed in many prison arts classrooms):
 

"In our mere hours with her, we did not feel like inmates. When we were with her, we felt like the human beings that we are."
 

Mere hours count.
 


 

When outside visitors come into the prison setting, even for a one-off experience, it brings a taste of home into the walls: a boost of vibrancy, humanization, a sense of normalcy, creativity, hope and joy.

Together, we begin the process. Further the process. Infuse a spirit. Crack open space to imagine. Be the little spark that sets off the fireworks.
 



(These sketches are by the incredible artist/facilitator Mensen, visual notes she took when visiting my classroom at Rikers Island. Cameras are not allowed in jail. View other photos and videos that visualize my other work in facilities in the gallery beneath the campaign video.)
 

The context.

If I know why the participants in my classes are incarcerated, it is not because I have asked. When we’ve built enough trust, deeply personal stories open up within their writing. But far more intriguing than their singular crime is what else there is to unlock — so much else that comprises their spirits and identities.

This room is where I have fully grasped the transformative power of imagination. We are often, suddenly, written onto a river or a beach or a moment of gripping passion. The place we most often travel is inward, reemerging more open, tender, carefully vulnerable, transcending titles of perpetrator, facilitator, inmate, student — sharing, collaborating and valuing each unique contribution. We exercise compassion for self and others, we exorcise guilt and shame.

I am challenged to question and complicate what we name as good and bad in humanity, to examine the impact of incarceration as a ripple effect, to grapple with the concepts of justice and rehabilitation, and to commune powerfully with members of our society frames as throwaways, who often feel forgotten and discarded.



 

Over the past fifteen years I have been a cultural worker and community educator in NYC and beyond.

In this role I have facilitated, visioned programming, written poems, and even debuted my stage acting (yes, as Evilene in The Wiz!) in youth and adult prisons.

Some of the facilities I've worked in short and long term include: Crossroads juvenile detention center, Rikers Island, Manhattan Detention Center, Otisville medium security and Bedford Hills maximum security prisons - through the incredible organizations Tribeca Film Institute, Voices Unbroken and Rehabilitation Through the Arts. To say the work has changed the direction of my life would be too light a phrase.

"When Caits facilitated a poetry workshop with women, ages 16-24, in a New York correctional facility, I was in awe of the way she quickly built strong, authentic relationships with participants and was able to transform an often chaotic environment into a space ripe with emotional safety."

— Karla Robinson, MS.ED, Arts Admin, Educator and Poet




I am a poet and poly-creative artist.

I've published poems and books, created albums and engaged many creative endeavors over the years. You can read about what I've done in that realm here.
 

Equally important to me is my work in community.

With a significant history in community arts, I was an integral team member in developing programs for organizations such as Tribeca Film Institute, Urban Arts Partnership, The Facing History School and The Lower Eastside Girls Club. I have taught extensively for the past 18 years across a wide spectrum of organizations and community spaces including social justice programs, spaces of incarceration, camps, public schools, youth programs and needle exchanges — and I’ve consulted in professional development to help inspire and elevate the practice of others in the field. Read more about my titles and roles here on LinkedIn.

I currently serve as Writer-in-Residence at Bronx Academy of Letters, where I’m visioning a creative writing exchange between free and incarcerated youth, and I am part-time faculty at CUNY and The New School University, where I teach the ethics and practice of co-creating with community groups. This season I am also facilitating creative writing at Manhattan Detention Center's transgender unit. I am excited to be co-writing with ReEmergent Theatre’s first production, a company in collaboration with people emerging from prison.
 


 

"I had the extreme joy of meeting Caits Meissner while serving a Life Sentence at Bedford Hills Correctional Facility. Right away, Caits projected a bright light to our poetry class! She reminded us that we were still alive, that we had desires and hopes worth writing about. She witnessed our struggles and listened  without judgement. Behind razor wire, gates, locks, and cells, our poetry class was something that we could look forward to every week. For those moments we were able to feel truly free! In our mere hours with her, we did not feel like inmates. When we were with her, we felt like the human beings that we are."

— Samantha Stone, former student 
 

So... what about the book?

It would be a disservice to myself, and also the people I will be communing with on the inside, to not touch the communities that surround these facilities. Thus, I also am seeking, where possible, to engage a correlating public reading in each area I visit a prison. In the sharing of my own work, I also commit to reading the work of incarcarted writers, and to discussing the tour's philosophy, ethics and power.

“Caits Meissner's Let it Die Hungry is a stunningly potent archive of surviving. In poems, drawings, notes, and workbook style experiments, Meissner generously shares her tools of becoming while simultaneously reinventing what a book of poems might be. In each of these modes it is clear: Meissner believes in the powers of seeing, testifying, and saying what is most difficult. Running through the blood of this book I hear Audre Lorde's charge: ‘Your silence will not protect you.’”

— Aracelis Girmay, author of The Black Maria
 


Your generous contribution will propel the very wings of this experience! 

Literally. Most funding will be funneled directly into tickets that lead me to each engagement. Where I can't stay with friends and family, your donation will afford me a bed for the night, a modest food stipend and the ability to pay a substitute teacher, if needed, for my classes in New York City. We will thank you for the workbook materials we bring into the space and the rental car that chugged out to far-away facilities! If we hit well over our funding mark, I can begin to think about providing class sets of my book for the writers I work with. Essentially, you are investing in me, my experience and my skill set to deliver incredible programming to hundreds of incarcerated people around the country.

And your contribution to this project is tax deductible! The Humans That We Are Tour is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization, Contributions for the charitable purposes of The Humans That We Are Tour must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law. (By donating to this campaign, you are making payments to Fractured Atlas, so you're all set. If you want to write a check instead? Now you know the deal.)

Special thanks to my partner organizations. I honor and tremendously value your dedication, innovation and perseverance. And thanks to YOU for considering funding this work.

With warmth,
Caits

story:
"Set impossible goals for yourself, then by all means achieve them, this is my idea of success" -Krist Miller..

             As far as my major goals and what I want to produce from my trip: 1. A travel memoir/how to book with a printed version of my adventure coupled with some great advice and notes on what it took to do it and I plan on taking a custom built Cleveland Cyclewerks Ace! 2. Find a way to put everything above the bare minimum of what I need to get this done to be donated to a charity as well as "ride for charity" 3. Hopefully this will be a long hard and amazing way to shift occupational gears. I grew up blue collar and it's paid the bills and I consider the working man the true builders of our world but I think I have another purpose out there and let this be the way I get there.

                                                                                                                                With your help I can get the transportation I need and cover travel/Legal expenses, afford more time to put into this ever growing project, get a few go pro cameras to capture the moments and everything else that may pop up! There is a lot involved with riding a motorcycle through South America as I have started my conversation with the Mexican consulate here in North Carolina, contacted fellow writers and travelers, read forums until my eyes melted. I am indeed funding myself at the moment for everything I need as best I can for things like my new domain name and hosting so I can build a site for everyone with common interests to use. It's under construction now. Www.mototripper.org. I need time to put towards building the site,  planning this trip, and getting insurance and supplies together though I will be traveling on the light side and camping for as much as possible. The time that I'm spending now at my job could be time spent preparing and getting on with it. I plan to ride through south America by motorcycle and write a travel memoir about my experience one way or another. I have a friend in Oaxaca and a friend in Peru so many things can and will happen in between. I am saving and planning as hard as I can on my own but I feel like I may be 50 years old before it happens. I need help. I need to write and TEACH but I need to live it first but before living it I need to be able to afford it. And I am ready to go through this radical paradigm shift and deliver an end product to the world that I can be proud of. I will update this whenever possible. Thank you for reading.

A little bit about me

               I have a spent a few years behind the chair as a hairstyIist, a network admin, an electrician, hell I have even climbed cell towers and driven an ice cream truck. I have never felt as fulfilled or happy (except when devouring chaco tacos) and like I have accomplished something good doing any of those things like I do when I am able to get out into the world and see it through my own  eyes and translate it back to others for them to enjoy.      

                                                       I do have a bit more of a positive attitude than it sounds about my past experiences and I would not trade them but I have decided to dedicate the next few years to chasing down a dream. My dream of using my talent as a writer and my lust for life, particularly in traveling, and my soul enveloping interest in the well being of the indigenous peoples of Latin America and a way of life that is the polar opposite of what I've seen growing up to create a travel memoir that encompasses the complete true story of one North American from Charlotte, North Carolina that decided to drop the blue collar life, and hit the road, on a Cleveland Cyclewerks Ace AND explain in full detail what I had to go through to get everything prepared and ready and legit for my trip so anyone else can just read the book and have the knowledge they need to take the same kind of trip all in one concise and entertaining place.               

                     I want to experience first hand what is going on in a place that at the moment seems so so far away and share that experience (the trip as well as the how-to all together) including this indiegogo crowdfunding beginning. A story is in waiting to begin from the moment of conception here to the final days reaching the destination as the person and writer I've become. From the lung evacuating need to get a bike and get affairs in order to my dealings with the Mexican consulate here in North Carolina to the friends I have made online that await my arrival with memories and who knows what else ready to be made. Whether I'm bouncing from hostel to hostel or camping under the wide open sky or spending a night with a newly made friend that spurs the type of relationship that can only entwine between traveler and hospitable host.                                                                                                                                                                           

 The Be Excellent To Each Other/Brick Wall Notebook

Designed by Me for You. Listed under Perks for a $20 contribution. A place to put your own notes from your adventures. (the white brick=back cover and it will include a thank you note from me)

American Apparel T-Shirts available too ! The "La Shirt" pictured here... More Designs to be added.


Rise From the Ashes and let them Season the Words the Naysayers Eat.
Keep checking the up and coming site www.mototripper.org for more content and updates. Thanks!
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        

To sum it up, I am planning a trip by motorcycle from Charlotte, NC to Peru. There is A LOT of prep involved concerning all the things you need to even be able to do what I am aiming to do, so this will also afford me some time to spend learning. I need to acquire the bike, travel expenses, and pre pay some of my own bills prior to leaving. My goal is to write a a travel memoir about my experience and publish it and begin a career as a professional writer by crashing in head first with the help of an Indiegogo crowdfund. I do possess the proven talent to write and interpret life as I see it as well as the spirit to take myself to the places that will best fill the pages. I also have a knack for finding myself right in the middle of "it"...Don't get me wrong I am very grateful for the life I have and all that has come with it but it is time to step it up. Thank you Again.

A few photos of me...



The Cleveland Cyclewerks Ace
