Whether I'm bouncing from hostel to hostel or camping under the wide open sky or spending a night with a newly made friend that spurs the type of relationship that can only entwine between traveler and hospitable host.                                                                                                                                                                            The Be Excellent To Each Other/Brick Wall NotebookDesigned by Me for You. Listed under Perks for a $20 contribution. A place to put your own notes from your adventures. (the white brick=back cover and it will include a thank you note from me)American Apparel T-Shirts available too ! The "La Shirt" pictured here... More Designs to be added.Rise From the Ashes and let them Season the Words the Naysayers Eat.Keep checking the up and coming site www.mototripper.org for more content and updates. Thanks!                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        To sum it up, I am planning a trip by motorcycle from Charlotte, NC to Peru. There is A LOT of prep involved concerning all the things you need to even be able to do what I am aiming to do, so this will also afford me some time to spend learning. I need to acquire the bike, travel expenses, and pre pay some of my own bills prior to leaving. My goal is to write a a travel memoir about my experience and publish it and begin a career as a professional writer by crashing in head first with the help of an Indiegogo crowdfund. I do possess the proven talent to write and interpret life as I see it as well as the spirit to take myself to the places that will best fill the pages. I also have a knack for finding myself right in the middle of "it"...Don't get me wrong I am very grateful for the life I have and all that has come with it but it is time to step it up. Thank you Again.A few photos of me...The Cleveland Cyclewerks Ace

story:
Your contributions will be all important in this campaign.  We have running costs for the campaign rooms to cover as well as buying materials such as leaflets, posters and banners.  Every penny will be used to maximum effect and should we be lucky enough to exceed the target any excess will be held over for the Scottish Parliament elections in 2016.

John’s commitment to the people of Falkirk:

  •  Help restore the reputation of Falkirk by putting local people and issues first.
  •  Being a good local MP as well as an active member of the SNP Group in Parliament.
  •  Leading the Falkirk based campaign for Independence, not Devo Max or home rule, but Independence.

The people of Falkirk deserve an MP who will work hard for the area and is committed to represent the people.

John McNally stood against Major Eric Joyce in 2010 and increased the SNP vote by 8.9% to 30%.

Labour have always considered Falkirk a safe seat, let’s prove otherwise and

ELECT JOHN MCNALLY TO WESTMINSTER!

The small print: Thank you very much for your support. If your donation is over £50 in value, we need your name and address and email address for regulatory purposes. Indiegogo will ask you for this information when donating, so please complete these fields in full. Nonetheless, your donation can still appear on our page as anonymous if you want.

story:
¿Qué?

Aventuras y Desventuras de un Diablo Cojo es una revisión de las novelas burlescas, llena de sátira y con un poso cargado de mensaje.

Novela burlesca del siglo XXI. Las Aventuras y Desventuras de un Diablo Cojo es una sátira contemporánea de un mundo anclado en viejos moldes. Un recorrido por los siete pecados capitales, y algunos provincianos, que merecen ser tratados con irreverencia. De la mano de un diablo peculiar, nuestro protagonista recorrerá la España de los privilegios, las prebendas, la prostitución enmascarada, la mafia insertada en las entretelas del despotismo poco o nada ilustrado.

Un diablo y su pícaro aprendiz que quieren vivir a cuerpo, no de rey, sino de político o banquero, que por algo ganan más dinero. En su afán por trepar pasarán por infinidad de aventuras con el maestro de la lujuria, la música y la mentira. Una historia con una variada gama de brujos cantamañanas, demonios nauseabundos y seres angelicales que arrinconan en los burladeros de una inmensa plaza con forma de piel de toro.

Una divertida historia para aparcar la mediocridad de la vida cotidiana.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Miguel Navarro.

Natural de Chiva (Valencia), es autor de numerosos relatos, autodidacta y políticamente incorrecto. Ha sido finalista del V concurso de cuento original e inédito en lengua castellana organizado por la asociación cultural Encuentro de Dos Mundos, de Ferney-Voltaire (Francia) con su relato El puente de la aparición. Ha publicado la novela de género La corona de Uganda (DBT, 2011), y ha sido presentador y director del programa El hidalgo de las palabras en RwRadioDigital durante las temporadas de 2015 y 2016.

http://elhidalgodelaspalabras.blogspot.com.es/

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta personas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como una ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Aventuras y Desventuras de un Diablo Cojo que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Miguel Navarro vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Pre-Orders have now closed

 

Shipping commencing December 1st, 2016.

This was an exclusive crowdfund campaign. This replica will no longer be offered for sale!

 

The Apollo missions were an amazing achievement of ingenuity, passion, bravery and commitment to achieving the seemingly impossible dream, of landing a man on the moon and returning him safely to Earth.     

Looking back 47 years to 1969 I’m in awe of the Men and Women at NASA and supporting sites around the world who were able to achieve this incredible feat with the technology available.  

In honor of this achievement we have set out to produce the highest quality reproduction of the Apollo 11 Final Flight Manual that was used by Mission Control, Flight Controllers, Astronauts and supporting personnel around the globe throughout the Apollo 11 mission.

 

As Seen On: 

We set out with one goal. To recreate the 1969 Apollo 11 Final Flight Manual in the most accurate way possible.  

We are starting from the beginning and reproducing every single page, using accurate fonts, colors, spacing and paper, as well as reproducing all vector graphics based on very high resolution scans of the original Apollo 11 Final Flight Plan.

We have been disappointed with the quality of current reproductions available. They are only available as eBooks, use incorrect fonts and have used automated tools to convert graphics to vector illustrations, this is a hit and miss approach and results in an inaccurate document that doesn't stay faithful to the original design and layout.

 

All text has been reproduced using the same fonts as the original Flight Manual. We are using the same line spacing and each letter appears in the exact same position on the page as the original Apollo 11 Flight Manual.

All tables and diagrams have been recreated using vector artwork, this allows us to infinitely scale and create the highest quality printed document. 

Everything will be reproduced in minute detail including fold out charts as per the original document.

Each page will also be printed on reinforced paper to eliminate stretching or tearing.

All artwork has been redrawn using high resolution scans to ensure perfect accuracy.

Each 362 page document will be shipped in your choice of binder. Each binder will be cloth wrapped for a soft touch and all artwork and text will be foil printed to produce the highest quality document.

We have a finished prototype, confirmed a manufacturer for the binders as well as a printer who is able to produce the document to our exact specifications.

We need your help to fund an exclusive production run, so please back us today and secure your copy of the most accurate reproduction of the Apollo 11 Flight Manual ever created.

 

All NASA logos and works are owned by NASA. 

 We maintain NASA as the source of the Apollo 11 Flight Manual.

story:
Perchè aiutarci?

Mangiatori di Cervello è un magazine on line nato ad agosto 2014. In questi mesi di durissimo lavoro ci siamo fatti conoscere e ci siamo creati una fetta consistente di lettori affezionati. L'alta qualità dei contenuti è la nostra forza. Arte, cultura, diritti, politica, attualità: il tutto con uno sguardo originale e una precisa visione.

Adesso però abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto per andare avanti, abbiamo bisogno di un nuovo sito... un "vero" sito. Con una nuova grafica, funzionale, leggero e ottimizzato per mobile.

Noi ci mettiamo l'impegno e la dedizione, ogni giorno, voi aiutateci con un contributo. Supporta Mangiatori di Cervello: supporta la cultura!

story:
Wanda Magazine

Female writers and artists are often overlooked, and men are rarely taken seriously when referring themselves as feminists. We want to combat both of these problems by publishing and distributing the work of talented, passionate feminists.

  • We are two Creative Writing graduates from Sheffield Hallam.
  • We want to continue sharing Wanda in print and online. 
     
  • We need help towards printing costs.
  • All donators will be thanked in our contributors section and given a copy of the magazine.

The Impact

We believe we are more approachable and varied than lots of other local and national publications:

  • Many magazines charge submission fees. We do not as we want to make sure anyone and everyone can share their work.
  • Our first issue was a success and has been picked up right across Sheffield. The work of our contributors (who are mainly students) has been seen/read by potentially hundreds of people.


Risks & Challenges

 There is of course the risk that something could go wrong during print. However:

  • We do all our own design, lay out and organisation, and have learned how to do so to a professional standard.
  • We have a strong understanding of the process after creating both a miniature, one-page zine, and a full size, colour magazine.

Other Ways You Can Help

Word of mouth is our strongest tool:

  • You can follow us on Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr and Facebook where we regularly share pieces from our contributors.
  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word even further!

story:
Queridos amigos,

 

Diego cumplirá 40 años este 18 de febrero (y sigue igual de guapo que a sus 18 años!)

 

Llegar a los 40 es un momento especial en la vida por lo que creo merece un regalo que le devuelva la juventud y mucha energía.

 

Como muchos saben, en estos últimos tiempos, Diego se ha vuelto un gran entusiasta de las bicicletas eléctricas, por lo que se me ocurrió ¡¡regalarle una!! :D

Su familia va a participar de este regalo colectivo, yo lo haré, mi familia lo hará y quizás haya algunos amigos, que también son parte de su familia, a los que les gustaría hacerlo. Si quieren hacerlo pueden escribirme y arreglamos como hacerlo.

 

Cualquier aporte, por más pequeño que sea, será muy bienvenido. Estoy segura de que le dará mucho placer y agradecimiento a Diego.

Les mando un abrazo grande. Con cariño.

Nuria

story:
Scroll down for English 

Samira Motazedi hotas av dödsstraff i Iran. Sedan fyra år söker hon asyl i Sverige. Sedan två år skriver hon om det. Stöd hennes blogg.

För att ge Samira möjlighet att skriva i sex månader, och för att översätta hennes texter, behöver vi 70 000 kr. Det är målet, men varje krona är värdefull och kommer användas för att fortsätta publicera Samiras texter.

Bloggen kommer under nästa år att bli en bok – alla som bidrar med minst 400 kr får ett signerat ex när den kommer från tryck.

Mer om Samira Motazedis asylärende

Efter att ha dömts till döden för äktenskapsbrott kom Samira Motazedi till Sverige och sökte asyl 2012, en ansökan som avslogs i maj 2013. Sedan dess har hon stridit för att Migrationsverket ska ompröva hennes ärende och samtidigt skrivit om den svenska asylprocessen och om den islamska regimen i Iran, på sin blogg och i andra medier.

2014 prövade Migrationsverket ärendet igen, denna gång baserat på Samiras verksamhet som skribent. I maj 2015 fick hon återigen avslag och hotades av utvisning. Men efter ett beslut i Migrationsdomstolen är Migrationsverket nu ålagda att ompröva Samiras ärende. Något beslut har ännu inte fattats. 

Läs det upprop som bl a Glänta, Sveriges Författarförbund och Svenska PEN gick ut med i samband med Migrationsverkets senaste avslag här. Samtidigt gjordes också en namninsamling.

Elise Karlsson skriver om Samiras ärende i Upsala Nya Tidning under rubriken Skamligt, Sverige! och Patricia Lorenzoni skriver bl a att "Samiras blogg är sanningen om Sverige idag" på patricia-lorenzoni.com. Feministiskt Perspektiv rapporterar om ärendet här, och Samira skriver själv i samma tidning under rubriken Migrationsverket förvaltar en kvinnofientlig kultur. Felicia Mulinari skriver om Samiras ärende i ETC och i samma tidning finns en intervju med bl a Samira och Ola Larsmo, en annan i GP och ett längre utdrag ur bloggen är publicerat i Svenska Dagbladet. 

Mer av Samira Motazedi

Lyssna på poden Europa Europa av och med Samira Motazedi här.

ETC "Sluta blunda för Irans människorättsbrott"

Aftonbladet "Sverige har gjort mig till politisk flykting" 

Läs mer om Samiras asylärende och följ hennes blogg på glanta.org/motazedi

Samira Motazedi left Iran four years ago. Two years ago she started blogging, about her struggle with the Swedish Migration Board, and about how she misses the smell of food in the Kermanshah alleys. She is writing about a moment of waiting, a moment that has stretched out to four years. And about how she is dreaming, once a week, that she is in Iran. Support her blog!

Felicia Mulinari skriver om Samiras ärende i ETC och i samma tidning finns en intervju med bl a Samira och Ola Larsmo, en annan i GP och ett längre utdrag ur bloggen är publicerat i Svenska Dagbladet. Mer av Samira MotazediLyssna på poden Europa Europa av och med Samira Motazedi här.ETC "Sluta blunda för Irans människorättsbrott"Aftonbladet "Sverige har gjort mig till politisk flykting" Läs mer om Samiras asylärende och följ hennes blogg på glanta.org/motazediSamira Motazedi left Iran four years ago. Two years ago she started blogging, about her struggle with the Swedish Migration Board, and about how she misses the smell of food in the Kermanshah alleys. She is writing about a moment of waiting, a moment that has stretched out to four years. And about how she is dreaming, once a week, that she is in Iran. Support her blog!

story:
Short Summary

 

Hi folks. My name's Al, and I'm a comedian, storyteller, touring artist, and haiku enthusiast. My solo theatre work has won some awards and garnered some pretty reviews, and none of it has anything to do with this project. This project is about my love of haikus. Well, technically, zappai, since they don't always follow traditional haiku rules.

Anyhow, here's the deal:


For years, I've suffered from insomnia, and I've tried a lot of different pre-bedtime routines to try to get to sleep. None of them worked, but one of them became something that I do on the regular - writing haikus. Dumb haikus, mostly, but some more serious ones, and all of them straight from my black black heart. For this book, I have hand-picked over 120 of my favourite haiku creations, and recruited the amazing Jacob Trillo to illustrate a few of them. Samples of his works-in-progress are the featured images on this page.

With your help, I'd like to put forth this beautiful little book, and set it off into the world, to be ignored and forgotten by the masses - but not by you! (Potentially) (If you buy one) 

What I Need & What You Get

Making a book come into existence costs a bunch of money, did you know that? That's why this campaign exists. I'm trying to raise funds to help cover actual printing, illustrating, and editing costs. Simple as that. 

So what do you get for helping me out? Let's take a trip.

PERK CITY:

For 12$, you can have a book, with a shiny new handwritten haiku in it, just for you. I'll be selling them for 15$ a piece upon release, so that's 3$ of savings for you as a thank you for helping out. Delivery in person is available if you're in Montreal, Ottawa, Toronto, Winnipeg, Saskatoon, Edmonton, or Vancouver.

For 20$, you get the book & custom haiku + I'll mail you a postcard this summer. Same delivery rules apply for the book.

For 30$, you get the book & custom haiku & postcard + Shane Adamczak will make a "Something's Not Right in the Playground" cartoon featuring YOU! Limited quantity available.

For 40$, you can get the book & custom haiku & postcard + I'll buy you a book I think you'll like, and write a haiku about it in the inside cover for you. Limited quantity available.

For 40$, you can get the book & custom haiku & postcard + a pair of tickets to any of my shows during my 2018 tour (Montreal, Ottawa, Toronto, Winnipeg, Saskatoon, Edmonton, or Vancouver).

For 50$, you can get 2 copies of the book & one custom haiku & one postcard + a pair of tickets to any of my shows during my 2018 tour (Montreal, Ottawa, Toronto, Winnipeg, Saskatoon, Edmonton, or Vancouver).

For 100$, you get 2 copies of the book, postcards every month for a year, 4 tickets to any of my shows during my 2018 tour, and the biggest of social media shoutouts.

If you donate 150$, you'll get all those perks + I'm writing a brand new haiku on the topic of your choice, and it's gonna be in the book. Only 4 available!

If you have another idea for a perk you'd like, email me and maybe we can work something out! I can be reached at apl.lafrance@gmail.com :)

--

I can't wait to get this book made, finally. This project has been in the works for ages. Thanks for helping me put it out into the world. Hopefully it puts joy in someone's heart. That's all I really want from this.

THANK YOU!

P.S.: Can't donate? Sharing this campaign is also helpful. Feel free to do that! :)

story:
Behind the book

Last year, sat on the El Cap’s East Ledges descent, someone asked me how many days I’d spent up on big walls in my life. I did a quick count, my brain a bit fried after nineteen days soloing South Seas, thinking about the walls and faces, totting up the numbers on battered fingers. The rough answer was about three hundred days, maybe over a year if I included bivys and camps at the bases of walls. If I threw in just ‘being in the mountains’ then it would be twice as long. “You must understand rock at the granular level?” they said. I thought back to the last two weeks, where placing a cam or hook one millimetre either way would see me fall, taking a whip that may yank out piece after carefully placed piece, my body free-falling down the wall. “Yes - you’re probably right”.

I’ve climbed walls fast, sped up El Cap in a day, but really I’m a man who likes to take his time, believing in the Karma Sutra’s dictum that, “Whatever you’re doing, do it at half the speed”. When you take your time you have time to consider things, to get things right, to think of better ways rather than simply ‘the way’. Learning all the techniques necessary to climb big walls has become as much the kick of climbing as the climbing itself, to be able to scale not only clean and sunny walls, but cold and chossy ones too, any new wall just an excuse to learn new skills.

This obsession with climbing big walls has seen me spending many months living the high life, from thirty+ ascents of El Cap (including 5 solos, 2 one day ascents, 1 winter ascent), routes on the Troll Wall, Dru, Eiger, places like Patagonia, Zion, Alaska and Antarctica, five failures for every summit.

My solo climbs led to a lot of questions from climbers about that black art, and so led to the writing of Me, Myself and I, one of the few big wall soloing manuals around (maybe the only one?). When I wrote Me, Myself and I, I imagined it so niche that few would buy it, and gave it a heavy price tag to match. In the end I found there were many climbers who wanted this book, a good percentage who went on to solo walls with its help, but also many who just liked to know more stuff about the sport they love. Since then the number of questions about big walls has steadily increased, with at least one person a day asking me how to do something wall related, from small technical details to more expansive questions about motivation and getting it done.

At the moment there are a small number of dedicated big wall books, all excellent, but most were written over twenty years ago, and so tend to feature outdated ideas, advice, or are missing new cutting edge techniques. Another issue is that they tend to be limited in their detail due to the need to keep the book within reasonable cost, meaning the real nitty gritty, the granular stuff, tends to be missing, as books like this need to be sold for about £20, meaning much of the good stuff is left out (a war is won on details!). But climbers love the nitty gritty, like how to remove a beak without breaking it, drilling a rivet or bat hook, how to rig a portaledge in a storm or rig a parachute for a wildness retreat (on that last one, don’t buy a €19 parachute off eBay!). It’s often these little details that make or break a climb, not the big things.

Based on a lifetime of numpties  

Higher Education is not only based on my personal learning on many walls, but also from teaching hundreds of climbers how to climb big walls, from 5.14 climbers wanting to free El Cap, to 5.6 climbers who want to frig it all. Being able to take a highly complex set of skills and pass it on helps to create an approach to teaching that makes learning easy(ish), mainly by keeping it simple, and not overloading the pupil. Beyond this I’ve also taken many novice climbers up walls, people who were not even climbers, and taught them the skills to haul, clean and even lead. When you climb with novices, or people who are disabled, children, blind or ginger, you soon learn what’s important and what’s not.

Beyond the basics 

This book gives the climber access to all the skills needed to climb anything from alpine peg ladders to trade route walls, as well as jumaring and hauling and all the stuff you need to stay alive, but unlike other books it also goes into the more technical aspects of climbing, the extreme stuff of hooking, pegging, heading and loose and expanding rock.

Beyond the sunny walls 

Higher Education is not simply a book looking at sun-drenched Californian walls (the best place to learn), but also colder, more stormy walls, where you may be dealing with ice and snow, killer storms and frigid bivys, where at the end your sleeping bag is more ice than insulation. These aspects of extreme big walling may seem beyond the realms of most end users of this book, but are ‘shitty fan’ concepts that could well prove valuable even on sunny walls!

Just another instruction book? 

Higher Education, like Me,Myself & I, is as much a story about big wall climbing as an instruction manual, full of personal stories and stories by others (I’m a big fan of learning by story).

Subjects covered

  • Forward by Doug Scott A brief history of big wall climbing
  • Psychology of the wall climber 
  • Psychology of the wall 
  • Psychology of the team 
  • Setting goals 
  • Free climbing 
  • French Free 
  • Gorilla Aid 
  • Basic Aid 
  • Hard Aid 
  • Advanced Aid 
  • Belays 
  • Haul bags 
  • Basic Hauling 
  • Heavy Hauling 
  • Jumaring 
  • Cleaning 
  • Fixed Ropes 
  • Cams and Nuts 
  • Pegging 
  • Hooking 
  • Heading 
  • Bolting 
  • Training 
  • Fitness and preparation 
  • Climbing as a two 
  • Climbing as a three 
  • Climbing as a four 
  • Food & Drink 
  • Toilet stuff 
  • Alpine bivying 
  • Wall bivying 
  • Expedition bivying 
  • Descent 
  • Getting to the wall 
  • Soloing* 
  • Speed climbing 
  • Capsule climbing 
  • Siege climbing 
  • Rescue Equipment 
  • List of climbs

* Me, Myself & I is the most complete book on roped soloing around, and trying to cover soloing in this book would create a monster book, so I’ll only cover the very basics which can be employed by teams on a wall (short fixing, self rescue etc).

Who’s this book for - only aid climbers? 

I’d buy this book for a start, but then I would, as I always try and write the types of books I’d like. Beyond that the book is written for both the experienced climber and novice, as well as the armchair big wall climber, who just wants to know about new and strange and exotic climbing techniques. The issues covered will be of great interest to free climbers looking to do new routes in alpine environments, alpinists who want to tackle routes that feature aid climbing, expeditionists who employ fixed ropes, and anyone who needs a bit of motivation for their own seemingly insurmountable objectives.

The book 

The book itself will be printed by the same people who printed Me, Myself and I, and be a black and white soft back. This is not a coffee table book, but a cutting edge manual for big wall climbers. It’s hard to judge the overall size of the book but I expect it will be running to around 700 pages (brick thick).

Price 

How much should such a book be? The most complete big wall book I ever bought was Chongo’s ground manual back in the 90’s, a telephone directory sized big wall guide that only dealt with the pre climb! This cost me $60 back in 1995, a price I was happy to pay, both eager for knowledge but also eager to help out the legendary Chongo. This book was simply photocopied pages with a green card cover yet every penny was well worth it, and in many ways, beyond big wall climbing, set me on a course to write my own books. The amount of work involved is considerable but the market itself is limited, and looking around at what else we buy every day, when compared to the value of this book, makes me think that a fair price is €45 (FREE P&P for most customers ).  Sorry that prices are in Euros but I live in Ireland, so can't offer a dollar or sterling price.

FREE shipping to Europe, US and Canada 

For European & North American customers postage is FREE, but if you live outside this area there will be a small shipping cost when you pledge, as detailed in the boxes on the right (sorry).

About the Author 

I’ve been climbing since the age of five, so that’s over forty years of scaring the shit out of myself! I’ve climbed around the world, both as a free climber (I don’t just aid climb!), mixed and ice climber, mountaineer and alpinist (one sleeps in a tent, the other on his mate’s knee) and explorer type (that means an expedition without any summits… which is also most mountaineering expeditions). Writing wise I’ve written quite a few books (Psychovertical, Cold Wars, 1000 Climbing Tips), which you can get in loads of funny languages and have also somehow won lots of prizes. No one ever told me the right way to write, or spell, so my style can be a little non-corporate, but people seem to like it. I also have one of the most popular indie climbing websites (andy-kirkpatrick.com), loved by climbers looking for tips and instruction on the climbing game.

story:
The Story of My Book

RX: Earth, How a Healthy You Requires a Healthy Planet is about the connections between climate change and human health. It examines how these connections form and what social institutions keep them in place.

RX: Earth is a non-fiction book that speaks to environmentally-curious people and anyone interested in health who are looking at climate change and personal health for the first time.

I wrote this book because I want to show people how climate change directly relates to their personal lives. My hope is that this book will provide knowledge on the hidden effects of climate change on our overall health and motivate people to take stronger actions to improve their lives by supporting our planet.

You will discover that climate change affects more than just the natural world, but also our health as human beings. In this book, my intention is to instill the same sort of passion and excitement in you that I have for climate change and its connection to our health. Ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you use your rights as a citizen and individual to make choices supporting environmental stability and security.

In this book, you'll learn about the many ways climate change is harming human health and how our social institutions are allowing it to continue this way such as:

How the contamination of our air and water is prolonging chronic disease

The dangers unpredictable weather poses to our food system and high-risk areas (think hurricanes and wildfires)

The effects climate change has on different sectors of society and social movements such as women's and minority rights

You will love this book if you are interested in climate change, personal or public health, environmental activism, or the social institutions and movements that shape our society.

The Book - RX: Earth, How a Healthy You Requires a Healthy Planet

The book is written in 3 Parts...

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 2 and 3. These chapters will focus on how the story of humanity has been shaped by changes in climate, from our cities to our diverse cultures to our very human evolution. For instance, did you know that all known periods of major species evolution have coincided with significant shifts in global climate?

Part 2 contains Chapters 4-7. In these chapters, you’ll learn about how climate change is transforming our food, water, air, and weather patterns, and how these changing are threatening our health and wellness. They include stories about the hottest places on earth getting hotter by the year and the dangerous measures people are willing to take in order to protect their family and property in the face of extreme weather. Along with biological effects, there are sections on how climate change is impacting certain populations more than others such as women and the poor.

Part 3 contains Chapters 8 and 9. These final chapters dive into the specific effects climate change is having on our social institutions along with how these very institutions are allowing climate change to continue. They examine the role of the media, corporations, and the government at all levels of society. However, it’s not all doom and gloom in these chapters. The ending highlights ways in that each level of society can reduce its carbon footprint
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this July
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

About the Author

Claire Hubley is a public health and digital media student at Tulane University. She’s been passionate about creating for as long as she can remember. Throughout her life, this passion has manifested herself in art, music, and now writing. Her goal is to use her creative skills to advance the movements she’s passionate about, such as environmentalism and climate change. 

I wrote this book because I am passionate about stopping climate change and about helping people live their best lives using preventative health measures. If more people know about the health effects of climate change, they might put more weight on the importance of finding solutions. I began to wonder if how the news reported on climate change had any effect on how seriously it was taken. Thus, my journey to writing Rx: Earth was born!

Outside of writing and environmentalism, Claire is an avid runner and podcast-listener. When she’s not writing, she’s probably eating delicious vegan food, walking her dogs, or hiking with her friends.

For more information, you can connect with Claire at clairehby@att.net, @clairehubley on Twitter and at https://www.facebook.com/clairehubleyauthor/.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #RX:Earth and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Claire Hubley

The Story of My Book
RX: Earth, How a Healthy You Requires a Healthy Planet is about the connections between climate change and human health. It examines how these connections form and what social institutions keep them in place.RX: Earth is a non-fiction book that speaks to environmentally-curious people and anyone interested in health who are looking at climate change and personal health for the first time.I wrote this book because I want to show people how climate change directly relates to their personal lives. My hope is that this book will provide knowledge on the hidden effects of climate change on our overall health and motivate people to take stronger actions to improve their lives by supporting our planet.You will discover that climate change affects more than just the natural world, but also our health as human beings. In this book, my intention is to instill the same sort of passion and excitement in you that I have for climate change and its connection to our health. Ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you use your rights as a citizen and individual to make choices supporting environmental stability and security.In this book, you'll learn about the many ways climate change is harming human health and how our social institutions are allowing it to continue this way such as:How the contamination of our air and water is prolonging chronic disease
The dangers unpredictable weather poses to our food system and high-risk areas (think hurricanes and wildfires)
The effects climate change has on different sectors of society and social movements such as women's and minority rights
You will love this book if you are interested in climate change, personal or public health, environmental activism, or the social institutions and movements that shape our society.

The Book - RX: Earth, How a Healthy You Requires a Healthy PlanetThe book is written in 3 Parts...Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 2 and 3. These chapters will focus on how the story of humanity has been shaped by changes in climate, from our cities to our diverse cultures to our very human evolution. For instance, did you know that all known periods of major species evolution have coincided with significant shifts in global climate?Part 2 contains Chapters 4-7. In these chapters, you’ll learn about how climate change is transforming our food, water, air, and weather patterns, and how these changing are threatening our health and wellness. They include stories about the hottest places on earth getting hotter by the year and the dangerous measures people are willing to take in order to protect their family and property in the face of extreme weather. Along with biological effects, there are sections on how climate change is impacting certain populations more than others such as women and the poor.Part 3 contains Chapters 8 and 9. These final chapters dive into the specific effects climate change is having on our social institutions along with how these very institutions are allowing climate change to continue. They examine the role of the media, corporations, and the government at all levels of society. However, it’s not all doom and gloom in these chapters. The ending highlights ways in that each level of society can reduce its carbon footprint What I Need & What You'll Get

story:
Hi!

Thanks for stopping by! You taking the time to read this, is already appreciated. 

My name is Ronen Divon and I am a writer, a healer, a dreamer, a guide, and a parent. Occasionally I am also a child. That depends on the weather. But regardless of the role I play, I love writing. I write blogs, short stories, poems, you name it. This story is my first full-length novel. 

Writing a novel is no small feat… Abby, Virtually was no different. It started as a short story five years ago (to the month!) At the time, I didn’t know how much it will grow. Yet, like flowers, children, and ideas, grew it did!

Much work was put into this book by a host of people who helped with editing, feedback and art. I was also fortunate enough to have a publisher, Morgan James of NY, that believed in the story and is getting it out to bookstores this coming November. It will be available nationwide, and likely also in Canada and the UK, as well as via various online venues.

But the work is not done. A critical element in any venture’s success is marketing, and promoting this book requires time and money. This is where you come in. Your early purchase of this book will help fund those efforts and make the story of Abby, Virtually, a success.

A bit about Abby. She is a teenager residing in New Delhi, India. Abby was born to an underprivileged family but she is spirited and smart. She has her dreams and hopes like teenagers anywhere. Life put a bunch of obstacles on her way to fulfill her wishes. The way she will tackle these challenges will ultimately define her as she passes from childhood to Adulthood. 

Why is Abby's story important? While Abby is struggling with issues similar to many other teens coming-of-age, now as well as in past generations, the tensions are accentuated by a deeper generation gap brought about by culture and technology. Those are addressed in the story. Additionally, Abby, Virtually addresses head on the discrimination against women in India. Written some years before the #MeToo movement came into being, a subplot yet critical part of the story touches upon abuse at the workplace. I am hoping to call more awareness to these issues so they can be fully tackled.

Is this story only for teens? Not really. 

What else can you do? Spread the word! That would be wonderful. Let your friends know about this story. Make some noise - you know - social media, emails, the whole shebang, enchilada, nine yards... It's easy with the Indiegogo share tools! Even if they don't purchase the book here, at least they now know it's coming. 

I am grateful for your interest and generosity! 
Ronen

Cary, NC, July 2018

p.s. I am enclosing below a segment from the novel's first chapter.

 

Abby, Virtually

 

CHAPTER 1

NEW DELHI

“Dear Abhaya,”
     Abhaya’s eyes skimmed the rest of the email.
     “Thank you for submitting a bid. Unfortunately, we have...”
     Unfortunately. That was the word she dreaded. Staring at those ill-fated letters for a prolonged moment, Abhaya felt spasms of anger bub-bling inside. The anger morphed into thunderous rage. She raised her arms and slammed her fists onto the heavy oak table, rattling her key-board and mouse. With her mouth contorted in fury and large almond-shaped eyes opened wide, Abhaya’s face echoed the fearless Goddess Kali bent on destruction.
     “Abhaya dear, are you okay?” Her mother’s melodious voice rang out from a neighboring room.
     Abhaya collected herself, plucked a lock of stray hair off her forehead and placed it behind her ear. “Yes, Mom,” she called back, struggling to keep her voice from wavering. “Just a difficult math problem,” she added.
     She disliked deceiving her mom, but Abhaya had lied to her none-theless. No equation was too challenging for her since she was at the top of her class. But she knew her reply would appease her mother. And more importantly, it would keep her from entering her fourteen-year-old daughter’s room.
     Making sure to log off her computer desktop, Abhaya grabbed her red Nike backpack and a matching iPhone. “I’m headed over to Janaki’s,” she called as she rushed out of the apartment.
     “Don’t be late for dinner!” came her mother’s hurried reply. “Not again. Your father will punish you this time!”
     Abhaya, her long black hair rippling behind her like a speedboat’s wake, barely heard her as she shut the door.

story:
WHAT'S THE STORY?

I am a writer, editor, survivor and sexual assault advocate recently (less than a week ago!) awarded a scholarship to the Vermont College of Fine Arts Novel Retreat in May to work on my second memoir chronically the double rape of two friends by a serial rapist. This book could not be more timely or necessary in the wake of the #metoo and #timesup movements. Unfortunately, the award only covers a fraction of the cost and does not include travel and finances to cover my living expenses. During my stay, I will be working on the second draft after which I will turn the pages over to my agent eager to submit my manuscript for publication. The retreat affords me 24-hour access to a private writing studio, have my work read and workshopped by distinguished faculty-in-residence and attend clinics, discussions, and readings to strengthen and support this memoir. 

WHAT'S VCFA?

The Vermont College of Fine Arts Novel Retreat was founded by the bestselling author of Before Women Had Wings Connie May Fowler. It is specifically for established and emerging writers working on full-length books. Acceptance is highly competitive with limited space available. 

Connie’s note to me:

“I was riveted by your pages and admit to shedding tears (those wounds recede, in my experience, but never fully heal). I think this book will resonate among many women who are, sadly, our own silent majority.” – Connie May Fowler

THE GIRLS OF WAVERLY PLACE

I’ve never applied to a program that wasn’t fully funded, but this opportunity was too important for me to pass up. When I say important, I don’t just mean for me and my writing career. The urgency to complete this memoir is prompted by the silence that has befallen on the #metoo and #timesup movements. In 1996, my roommate and I were raped at knifepoint in our apartment in the West Village. We lost our home, friends, jobs, our innocence and independence and then each other. Almost a decade later, the perpetrator was caught from a cold case DNA hit. We were not his only victims. He was a serial rapist the media named the “Top Gun Rapist.” as one of his other victims was actress Kelly McGillis who rose to stardom for her role in the movie Top Gun. A year later we went to trial, and a decade after my rape, he was sentenced to two 25 year consecutive sentences.

Those are the facts. This is my story.

My memoir, Chewing Gravel, is about rape in the in-betweens, its aftermath (and how it looks different for everyone), losing someone you love as you are losing yourself, and re-emerging, as Hemingway wrote, strong at the broken places. It is also a love letter to Manhattan and the mid 90s local music scene, inanimate objects as witnesses to societal issues such as victim blaming, the concept (and pressure) of survivorhood, body dysmorphia, addiction, and recovery. Unlike most rape memoirs, it is not a true crime telling, but a lyrical story about friendship, loss, and love.

SUPPORT #METOO, #TIMESUP AND SEXUAL ASSAULT SURVIVORS

This month is sexual assault awareness month; the silence has been deafening.

Last month, I attended a three-week residency at Virginia Creative Center for the Arts where I completed a first draft. I wrote it in just 18 days (20 years in the making) because it feels like an emergency. Conversations about rape in the last year reveal how little is understood and how much needs to be done. Sexual assault is not news or a movement or a hashtag, it is crime. As we are searching for answers in this unchartered territory, what’s next? Is it harder for rape victims to come forward because it is perceived as just another story? We cannot let this happen.

MY ADVOCACY WORK

Since 1996, I’ve been public as a rape victim and survivor as a speaker for RAINN (Rape, Abuse, and Incest National Network) and NYC Mount Sinai’s SAVI (Sexual Assault Violence Intervention) program. I have lobbied for bills such as the SAFER Act on Capitol Hill and have educated law enforcement officers on police sensitivity, addressed Planned Parenthood’s board of directors, and shared my story at high schools, colleges, organizations, and at public events across the country. I have coached actors like KaDee Strickland for ABC’s Private Practice’s multi-episode rape storyline, which won a PRISM award, and co-produced PSA’s with Christina Ricci, Kevin Bacon and Dylan McDermott. I’ve basically gone wherever I was needed without hesitation because sexual assault numbers are staggering, the crime is largely misunderstood and framed a women’s issue, and victim blaming is so widespread that many do not come forward. Even after #1is2many, #metoo and #timesup only 7% of all rapists will ever spend a day in jail. How did my story end with a 50 year sentence? Please let me share the how and why with others.

MY WRITING BACKGROUND

 

For those of you who do not know me as a writer, while I always dreamed of writing as a career, I did not take a single class in my adulthood until 2014. In 2015, I was selected as a 2016 PEN America Emerging Voices fellow, was mentored by author Claire Bidwell Smith (Rules of Inheritance), completed a second draft, which caught the attention of Bad Feminist  Roxane Gay’s agent and several others agencies including ICM. I secured representation, continued taking writing classes and became the creative nonfiction editor for Angels Flight • literary west. In December 2017, I was awarded the Jane Guerting Camp scholarship for a residency at Virginia Center for the Creative Arts. My writing has appeared in The Rumpus, Ravishly, Greatist, and LA Weekly among others. As a sexual assault activist, I have been featured in Variety, Glamour, Cosmopolitan UK, and Jezebel, to name a few.

I love writing and can’t imagine doing anything else. In so many ways and so many times, it has supported and healed me, but most of all, it allows me to write things with the intention of changing a narrative that silences those who suffer from the aftershocks of trauma every single day.

THE LOW DOWN 

The VCFA retreat offers one week of uninterrupted writing time, private studios, mentorship, workshops, readings, food and lodging and an additional week to work on my memoir. Tuition for two weeks is $820 (including my scholarship), $580 for room and board, $500 for travel including airfare and transportation to and from airports, $800 to have an advisor read and give notes on my manuscript (this typically runs between $3-6K), and $3000 for rent and other expenses as I won't be able to work my other jobs while writing in Vermont. Any additional money will go to line editing, writing time and getting the memoir published.  The campaign is only running for 20 days as I was just accepted last Friday and the retreat begins May 15th. 

SHARING HEARTS CARING 

Please help me write my memoir while attending the VCFA Novel Retreat by making a donation and/or sharing this campaign by using the Indiegogo buttons or sending an email to your friends. (I'll even write it for you!) I am deeply humbled by those who have supported my writing. I couldn't have done any of this without you. Thank you for reading, sharing, and contributing whatever you can.  

With love and gratitude,

Marnie

story:
LA SAGA - RINNAEH VART

Anni '70 del ventunesimo secolo.
In un'America immaginaria in bilico tra la tecnologia e il degrado, gli esseri umani vivono a loro insaputa fianco a fianco col "mondo invisibile", un mondo popolato da creature non-umane appartenenti a differenti razze e culture.
Per centinaia di anni la convivenza è proseguita pacifica e silenziosa... almeno fino a che una serie di brutali omicidi non ha improvvisamente iniziato a colpire la società dei non-umani, mettendo pericolosamente a rischio il suo equilibrio con gli umani.

Rinnaeh Vart è una saga urban-fantasy condita con tanto thriller e un pizzico di horror qua e là; il primo volume, Evil Heaven, ha visto la luce nel 2017 grazie a un crowdfounding supportato da molte meravigliose persone, senza le quali tutto questo non sarebbe stato altrimenti possibile.
Adesso, a distanza di tre anni, il tanto atteso secondo volume della storia è finalmente pronto per la pubblicazione!
Ritroverete personaggi già conosciuti come Art, Yurah e Ocean, ora costretti a fare i conti con le conseguenze di quanto accaduto a causa del Deus Ex Machina, e ne incontrerete di nuovi, arrivati per unirsi chi al fianco dei protagonisti, chi al fianco del nemico.
Così come il primo volume, anche Chimera è sconsigliato a un pubblico minore di 16 anni per via delle molteplici scene esplicite di violenza e/o erotismo.

 

• Le copertine dei due volumi sono state realizzate dalla bravissima artista K I K I •
Seguitela e supportatela su: INSTAGRAM, FACEBOOK e TWITTER.
 


Rinnaeh Vart, com'è nata la saga?

Questa storia, la storia di Art e del mondo in cui vive, è nata nel lontano 2010 quando, dopo uno strano sogno che vedeva un anonimo ragazzino starsene in silenzio contro il muro di una discoteca, decisi di aprire Word e cominciare a scrivere.
Misi in fila qualche frase, descrissi l'ambiente della discoteca così come lo ricordavo dal sogno, diedi a quell'anonimo ragazzino un nome e dei pensieri.
Ben presto, arrivarono nuovi personaggi.
Arrivarono Yurah Evans e Ocean Morgensen che, insieme ad Art, divennero il fulcro della storia. E con loro, in un attimo arrivarono anche i primi sviluppi.
Creature dai poteri sovrannaturali.
Uno spietato e misterioso assassino.
Una scritta incomprensibile sul muro di casa di Art.
Senza quasi rendermene conto, mi ritrovai fra le mani un mondo intero fatto di umani e non-umani, città fantastiche, creature sovrannaturali, corse contro il tempo e indagini disperate alla ricerca di un mostro che fa a pezzi le proprie vittime e ne ruba gli organi.
Col passare degli anni ho raffinato il mio stile di scrittura, lavorato sul trattamento della storia e steso una sceneggiatura completa, sceneggiatura che si svilupperà in una saga composta da non meno di 7 volumi (e io che avevo iniziato a scrivere pensando a un volume unico).
Tra i temi centrali della saga spiccano il sovrannaturale e la fantascienza, accompagnati da argomenti più profondi e delicati come la crescita emotiva dei personaggi e il loro relazionarsi a una società proiettata cinquant'anni circa nel futuro, negli anni '70 del ventunesimo secolo.

 

L'AUTORE

 

Chi sono?

CrazyKinoko (per gli amici semplicemente "Kino") è lo pseudonimo che uso come artista da ormai quasi dieci anni, è l'unione di una parola inglese (crazy) e una giapponese (kinoko) e letteralmente significa "fungo pazzo".
Nasco nel '93 in provincia di Treviso. Dopo un'infanzia divisa fra il Veneto e l'Emilia Romagna, sbarco finalmente in Toscana dove completo i miei studi specializzandomi in fumetto manga e sceneggiatura. Qui mi stabilisco in pianta stabile trovando a Firenze la mia nuova casa.
Lavoro come scrittore, fumettista e digital artist; sono co-autore del webcomic “Looks Like Me” insieme all’artista e grande amica KIKI, occasionalmente collaboro anche con collettivi e piccole realtà italiane e nel corso dell'ultimo anno ho iniziato un ulteriore percorso di studi come tatuatore.

Perché iniziare a scrivere Rinnaeh Vart?

Ho sempre amato leggere e ho sempre amato in particolare le storie che avessero del sovrannaturale nella trama. Fantasy, fantascenza, urban-fatasy... Mi sono nutrito di questo genere di storie fin da piccolo, trovando fra le loro pagine rifugio e ispirazione, nonché un modo totalmente differente ed elettrizzante di vivere la realtà che mi circondava. Ogni libro era (ed è tutt'ora) per me una sorta di temporanea vita parallela, un'avventura, la possibilità di vivere esperienze che altrimenti non incontrerei mai nella vita di tutti i giorni.
Col tempo ho iniziato poi a maturare il desiderio di scrivere qualcosa che potesse emozionare le persone come i libri che leggevo emozionavano me. Un desiderio un po' ambizioso, forse, ma trovavo che il benessere datomi dalla letteratura fosse così prezioso da voler a tutti i costi provare a donare a mia volta quel benessere agli altri.
E così la scrittura entrò nella mia vita.
Divenne ben presto un tassello fondamentale del mio essere: non è solo il mio lavoro, non è solo una fortissima passione, ma anche un modo per esprimere me stesso e le mie emozioni attraverso i personaggi di cui racconto. Credo di poter affermare che la scrittura abbia su di me sono solo un effetto di sfogo, ma anche terapeutico.
Dunque perché ho iniziato a scrivere Rinnaeh Vart?
Per donare alle persone un luogo in più in cui rifugiarsi dalla realtà e per esplorare me stesso.
Molti altri "motori" si sono attivati nel corso degli anni, fra cui il voler creare una saga che contenesse una rappresentazione della comunità LGBT+ che andasse oltre quegli stereotipi che purtroppo ancora molto spesso portano nella letteratura young adult un'immagine distorta di tutte quelle persone al di fuori dell'eterosessualità e della cisessualità.
Essendo io stesso parte della comunità come non-binary, desidero scrivere una storia che abbia al suo interno più varietà possibile di orientamenti sessuali e di genere, in modo da poter dare agli altri giovani della comunità la possibilità di immedesimarsi in una saga in cui i contenuti LGBT+ siano integrati alle tematiche principali della trama.
 

I PERKS


• tutti i barcker che ordineranno un perk con oggetti fisici riceveranno in regalo questa stampa fotografica in edizione limitata •

Tratta da una scena del secondo volume di Rinnaeh Vart, l'illustrazione sarà stampata su carta fotografica in formato A5 e sarà aggiunta in omaggio a tutti i perk fisici (no NETHIA, no IBRIDO).
La stampa è limitata al crowdfunding: non sarà possibile acquistarla altrove.

 

  • NETHIA (5€)

Una copia di CHIMERA versione ebook (formato EPUB o MOBI).

 

  • IBRIDO (10€)

Una copia di CHIMERA versione ebook + una copia di EVIL HEAVEN versione ebook (formato EPUB o MOBI).

 

  • NINFA (15€) + spedizione / NINFA ritiro CARTOOMICS

Una copia cartacea di CHIMERA.
[Possibilità di selezionare il perk con ritiro a CARTOOMICS 2020]

 

  • BARGHEST (25€) + spedizione

Una copia cartacea di CHIMERA + le 3 stampe fotografiche della serie "Pianeti", in formato A5.

 

  • LAKIA - la dea dell'aria (25€) + spedizione

Una copia cartacea di CHIMERA + i 2 portachiavi acrilici Ocean/Art e Yurah/Art.

 

  • DELTASSIHA - il dio della terra (35€) + spedizione

Una copia cartacea di CHIMERA + i 2 portachiavi acrilici Ocean/Art e Yurah/Art + le 3 stampe fotografiche della serie "Pianeti", in formato A5.

 

  • AKLETH - la dea dell'acqua (45€) + spedizione

Una copia cartacea CHIMERA + i 2 portachiavi acrilici Ocean/Art e Yurah/Art + le 3 stampe fotografiche della serie "Pianeti", in formato A5 + un disegno originale in formato A5 (tradizionale, pezzo unico).

 

  • SANTJE - il dio del fuoco (30€) + spedizione / SANTJE ritiro CARTOOMICS

Una copia cartacea di CHIMERA + una copia cartacea di EVIL HEAVEN.
[Possibilità di selezionare il perk con ritiro a CARTOOMICS 2020]

 

  • LERIANA - la dea della luce (40€) + spedizione

Una copia cartacea di CHIMERA + una copia cartacea di EVIL HEAVEN + le 3 stampe fotografiche della serie "Pianeti", in formato A5.

 

  • ASTROS - il dio dell'ombra (60€) + spedizione

Una copia cartacea di CHIMERA + una copia cartacea di EVIL HEAVEN + + i 2 portachiavi acrilici Ocean/Art e Yurah/Art + le 3 stampe fotografiche della serie "Pianeti", in formato A5 + un disegno originale in formato A5 (tradizionale, pezzo unico).


STRETCH GOALS

  • 1100€

Per quelli che hanno scelto i perk NETHIA, IBRIDO, NINFA o BARGHEST, il primo stretch goal sbloccherà:

- wallpaper a tema Rinnaeh Vart in alta risoluzione (.jpg)

Per quelli che hanno scelto i perk LAKIA, DELTASSIHA, AKLETH, SANTJE, LERIANA o ASTROS, il primo stretch goal sbloccherà:

- un set di 3 segnalibri a tema Rinnaeh Vart

 

A COSA SERVIRANNO I FONDI

  • 60% --> costi di stampa di Chimera e ristampa di Evil Heaven
  • 20% --> costi di produzione dei gadget
  • 20% --> costi di spedizione e costi di gestione del crowdfounding

 

I RISCHI

Trattandosi di un progetto indipendente, il rischio di non raggiungere il goal rimane comunque reale. Nello sfortunato caso in cui non dovessi raccogliere tutti i fondi di cui ho bisogno, sarò costretto a fare delle rifilature sulla quantità di copie stampate e/o sulla produzione di gadget, ma in ogni caso farò quanto più mi è possibile perché ognuno di voi riceva un perk dello stesso valore della cifra donata.

 

IN QUALI ALTRI MODI PUOI AIUTARE IL PROGETTO?

Oltre a partecipare al crowdfunding? Spargi la voce più che puoi!
Parla del libro ai tuoi amici, coinvolgili nel progetto e indirizzali alle mie pagine social cosicché possano conoscermi e interessarsi a Rinnaeh Vart.
Sia tu che i tuoi amici potete seguirmi e supportarmi attraverso i seguenti social:

- INSTAGRAM
- FACEBOOK

Se hai già letto Evil Heaven puoi inoltre lasciare una recensione sia su Amazon che su Goodreads, ciò aiuterebbe tantissimo il libro a guadagnare visibilità!

- AMAZON
- GOODREADS

story:
Tony Robert Cochran

  • Prison abolitionist, philosopher and social critic / former union organizer
  • Not breaking even, I am raising funds to cover the costs of working as an independent journalist and social critic, which I mostly do without payment.
  • Funding will assist me in continuing to collect data, research, conduct interviews via Skype (often to places where it is difficult to connect), and to bring high quality social, political and aesthetic critique to readers.
  • Funding will assist me to continue to work, often with discrete sources, to publish information from inside the prison-industrial complex.
  • $800 covers the projected costs of all of this work for the next six months. Work done so far can be found @ www.tonyrobertcochran.com and www.prisonaspower.com

story:
Who Are We?

Mjølner is a Viking inspired restaurant and bar created in Thor’s image. Thor, the Viking God of thunder, has moved to earth to protect the world from evil. He misses the camaraderie of home and the feasts of Valhalla so he builds his own feasting hall inspired by the Asgardian feasts and names it Mjølner, after his famous hammer.

The Mjølner experience offers guests a sense of escapism with the enjoyment of fine food and world class drinks in Viking luxe surrounds. 

Alongside the modern interpretation of a Viking feast, Norse iconography is carved into shields, drinking horns, axes and ornate handmade knives – presented to each guest in a leather knife roll (choose your weapon!). The dining rooms, moody and majestic are filled with museum grade artefacts, hand carved timber tables, animal hide wall hangings and seats, antique swords, leather booths and cast iron cages home to top shelf whiskies.

The inspiration behind Mjølner came from The Speakeasy Group’s owner and director, Norwegian born Sven Almenning. Growing up surrounded by Norse mythology, Sven and business partner Greg Sanderson set out to create an earthly nod to the feasting halls of Valhalla, transported in time to the 21st century.

Why a recipe book?

The intention of this recipe book is to immerse the magic of Mjølner's food, beverage and experience into your homes and allow you to create a Valhalla style feast of your own. It's the perfect gift for anyone who enjoys dining at Mjølner, or who have an interest and passion for Vikings and Norse Mythology

Why crowdfund? 

In order to avoid traditional avenues of publication where our precious, albeit slightly crazy creative content and stories may be watered down, Mjølner will be raising funds in order to self-publish – and ensure Owner and Directors Sven Almenning and Greg Sanderson can sneak in their signature swearing in somewhere....

What is actually going in the book? 

Recipes from the kitchens and bars – some of which have been as well guarded as the Bifrost Bridge since Mjølner’s respective openings in Sydney in 2017 and Melbourne in 2018, The Viking Feast will be jam packed with all the ingredients needed to recreate a Viking Feast at home.

Carefully curated by Mjølner Head Chefs; the talented Joachim Borenius (Sydney) and Andrew Wright (Melbourne), The Viking Feast will guide you through mains dishes of bird, beast, fish and veg as well as shared feasts including roasted bone marrow, gravlax and our signature Trenchers complemented by impressive sides and desserts.

In addition, our award winning bartenders Alissa Gabriel (Sydney) and Alex Boon (Melbourne) will be sharing the secrets behind Mjølner's most creative and tasty libations. 

The book will also heavily feature Norse Mythology, symbology and story telling through original artworks and writing. 

What's our goal?

Self publishing is a costly business - especially with all the unbelievably talented artists, photographers, illustrators and story tellers we hope to get on board without the financial backing of a mainstream publishing house. Our dream is to create a truly unique combination of art and recipes without compromise and to do so need as much support as possible. 

The funds raised here will go to paying for the books creation up to the point of first run printing. 

Relinquish your inner Viking on family and friends with a Valhalla feast at home fit for Thor himself. May Odin give you knowledge on your path. May Thor grant you strength & courage on your way. And may Loki give you laughter as you go....." – Skål

Who Are We?
Mjølner is a Viking inspired restaurant and bar created in Thor’s image. Thor, the Viking God of thunder, has moved to earth to protect the world from evil. He misses the camaraderie of home and the feasts of Valhalla so he builds his own feasting hall inspired by the Asgardian feasts and names it Mjølner, after his famous hammer.
The Mjølner experience offers guests a sense of escapism with the enjoyment of fine food and world class drinks in Viking luxe surrounds. 
Alongside the modern interpretation of a Viking feast, Norse iconography is carved into shields, drinking horns, axes and ornate handmade knives – presented to each guest in a leather knife roll (choose your weapon!). The dining rooms, moody and majestic are filled with museum grade artefacts, hand carved timber tables, animal hide wall hangings and seats, antique swords, leather booths and cast iron cages home to top shelf whiskies.
The inspiration behind Mjølner came from The Speakeasy Group’s owner and director, Norwegian born Sven Almenning. Growing up surrounded by Norse mythology, Sven and business partner Greg Sanderson set out to create an earthly nod to the feasting halls of Valhalla, transported in time to the 21st century.
Why a recipe book?
The intention of this recipe book is to immerse the magic of Mjølner's food, beverage and experience into your homes and allow you to create a Valhalla style feast of your own. It's the perfect gift for anyone who enjoys dining at Mjølner, or who have an interest and passion for Vikings and Norse Mythology
Why crowdfund? 
In order to avoid traditional avenues of publication where our precious, albeit slightly crazy creative content and stories may be watered down, Mjølner will be raising funds in order to self-publish – and ensure Owner and Directors Sven Almenning and Greg Sanderson can sneak in their signature swearing in somewhere....
What is actually going in the book? 
Recipes from the kitchens and bars – some of which have been as well guarded as the Bifrost Bridge since Mjølner’s respective openings in Sydney in 2017 and Melbourne in 2018, The Viking Feast will be jam packed with all the ingredients needed to recreate a Viking Feast at home.
Carefully curated by Mjølner Head Chefs; the talented Joachim Borenius (Sydney) and Andrew Wright (Melbourne), The Viking Feast will guide you through mains dishes of bird, beast, fish and veg as well as shared feasts including roasted bone marrow, gravlax and our signature Trenchers complemented by impressive sides and desserts.
In addition, our award winning bartenders Alissa Gabriel (Sydney) and Alex Boon (Melbourne) will be sharing the secrets behind Mjølner's most creative and tasty libations. 
The book will also heavily feature Norse Mythology, symbology and story telling through original artworks and writing. 
What's our goal?
Self publishing is a costly business - especially with all the unbelievably talented artists, photographers, illustrators and story tellers we hope to get on board without the financial backing of a mainstream publishing house. Our dream is to create a truly unique combination of art and recipes without compromise and to do so need as much support as possible. 
The funds raised here will go to paying for the books creation up to the point of first run printing. 
Relinquish your inner Viking on family and friends with a Valhalla feast at home fit for Thor himself. May Odin give you knowledge on your path. May Thor grant you strength & courage on your way. And may Loki give you laughter as you go....." – Skål

Story of My Book

Be the Outlier is a comprehensive guide on how to ace data science job interviews. In this book, I break down the types of questions you can expect in an interview depending on the job role you are applying for, whether it be Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, Data Analyst, etc. Because there is a certain level of ambiguity around the “data science” and “analytics” job profile, I wrote this book to provide you with structure when you’re preparing for interviews.

As a Data Scientist, I know how nerve-wracking it can be to prepare for interviews, and it only gets worse when you aren’t sure what to expect. That’s exactly why I wrote this book, which covers all aspects of a data science interview in today’s industry and highlights how you can differentiate yourself from your peers and Be the Outlier.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how easily you can differentiate yourself from other candidates and land your dream job by applying some structure and rigor to the application process. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for data science. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you ace your data science interviews.

If you are an aspiring data scientist looking to break into the field, a data scientist looking for a job change, or someone who just wants to learn more about the data science field, then this book is for you.
 

The Book - Be the Outlier

The book is written in 5 Parts.

Part 1 contains the Introduction and Chapters 1-3. In this section, we discuss what exactly constitutes data science and what the market is currently looking for in data scientists. Drawing from interviews with experienced data science professionals working with companies like Google, Amazon, Facebook, MBB, Big 4 consulting firms, and large industry-specific organizations, I will provide you with insight into the current market expectations. From there, we will dive into what you want to do and what your course of action should be when it comes to interview prep.

Part 2 contains Chapters 4-7. This section of the book focuses on the types of questions you can expect in the areas of Machine Learning, Predictive Modeling, Programming, Statistics, and Case Interviews for Data Science. Each chapter highlights the structure to follow that will enable you to ace these interviews. We will also look at sample questions and answers, which have been curated based on real questions that candidates were asked within the last year.

Part 3 contains Chapters 8-11. This section looks at the finer aspects of a data science interview. Chapter 8 will enable you to master the often-asked “Tell me about a project you worked on” interview question. From there, Chapter 9-11 will give you the tips and tricks you need to crack the take-home exam, presentation interview, and behavioral interview.

Part 4 contains Chapters 12-13. Here, we will gain insight as to what should be covered in a data scientist’s resume and the best approach to follow when building one. We will also look at how can you differentiate yourself when building a data science portfolio by answering questions such as, “What is a data science portfolio?”, “Who should build one?”, and “What should you include?”

Part 5 contains Chapters 14. Every interview process is a journey, and in this chapter, we talk about where you should go from here. We will identify additional resources so that you have everything you need to get the job you want!

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Shrilata Murthy is a practicing Data Scientist who loves to build machine-learning models in her day-to-day life. She has over 7 years of experience in statistical modeling, data mining, and data visualization, which she utilizes to create data-driven solutions for her clients. She is a programmer-turned-data scientist and now enjoys consulting to improve decision-making with the use of data.

Shrilata holds a Master’s degree in Analytics from Northwestern University and received her B.E. in Information Technology from Mumbai University.

Outside of work, Shrilata is a mom to a little tiny-tot and loves a good outdoor run when the weather is favorable.

For more information you can connect with Shrilata at shrilata13@gmail.com and https://www.linkedin.com/in/shrilata-murthy/

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BetheOutlier and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Shrilata Murthy
