story:
Purpose and Drive

In 2011, three Massachusetts artists, from different artistic backgrounds, were united by one passion: poetry. We (Evin, Tatiana, and Mark) originally met during a theatre production and have since become very good friends. 

We decided to create a multi media-dimensional project that would encompass as many of our artistic interests as possible: poetry, music, graphic design, and performing arts. The project, entitled Empty Room Poets, eventually took shape as a poetry book with an attached CD album.

Why Poetry? 

Check out our interviews with Photassium on why we write and the origin stories of ERP. 

Interview with Mark Jenkins via YouTube

Interview with Tatiana Ivan via YouTube

Interview with Evin Anderson (Coming Soon!) 

Our Next Step

Both the book and the CD will be designed, produced, and distributed completely by us. We will also have live events showcasing our poetry, music, and performance talents. This is where we need your help! All of your contributions will allow us to focus on and achieve the completion of our book, CD, and live performances. 

More information will be available as the project progresses. Check back often for updates, or subscribe to our posts at:  emptyroompoets.wordpress.com. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funds, that we need, will help cover our self-publishing costs for both the book as well as CD. For self-publishing, we are using CreateSpace while our CDs are through HomeMade Records (aka our computers and the local electronics store).

They will also contribute towards our live events and marketing (ex. space costs, original ERP inspired food/drinks, flyers, videos etc.).

All and any contribution amounts are appreciated! Besides helping us with our goal, your contributions also benefit YOU!  

Perks Packages (titles straight from our poems!):

$10 - Two Little Words
- Personal "Thank You!" on our website, Facebook, and Twitter

$25 - The Hearing Aid Song
- Free Music CD from DJ Umbrage (Mark Jenkins of ERP)
- Personal "Thank You!" on our website, Facebook, and Twitter

$50 - Shades of Grey
- Your business, artistic, or personal site listed under our "Neighbors" section of the ERP website
- Free Music CD from DJ Umbrage (Mark Jenkins of ERP)
- Personal "Thank You!" on our website, Facebook, and Twitter

$75 - Hands
- Acknowledgement in the Empty Room Poets book
- Your business, artistic, or personal site listed under our "Neighbors" section of the ERP website
- Free Music CD from DJ Umbrage (Mark Jenkins of ERP)
- Personal "Thank You!" on our website, Facebook, and Twitter

$100 - A Painted Muse
- An autographed copy of the Empty Room Poets book
- Acknowledgement in the Empty Room Poets book
- Your business, artistic, or personal site listed under our "Neighbors" section of the ERP website
- Free Music CD from DJ Umbrage (Mark Jenkins of ERP)
- Personal "Thank You!" on our website, Facebook, and Twitter

$150 - Looking Back
- Your business, artistic, or personal site listed under our "Neighbors" section of the ERP website, and promoted on our Facebook and to our Twitter followers, monthly
- An autographed copy of the Empty Room Poets book
- Acknowledgement in the Empty Room Poets book
- Free Music CD from DJ Umbrage (Mark Jenkins of ERP)
- Personal "Thank You!" on our website, Facebook, and Twitter

$175 - Untethered
- VIP Package: invitation to the Empty Room Poets book and album release party, which includes a live performance from all three poets; an autographed Empty Room Poets book and music album
- Acknowledgement in the Empty Room Poets book
- Your business, artistic, or personal site listed under our "Neighbors" section of the ERP website, and promoted on our Facebook and to our Twitter followers, monthly
- Free Music CD from DJ Umbrage (Mark Jenkins of ERP)
- Personal "Thank You!" on our website, Facebook, and Twitter

$225 - His and Hers
- Three custom poems written just for YOU! by Empty Room Poets
- VIP Package: invitation to the Empty Room Poets book and album release party, which includes a live performance from all three poets; an autographed Empty Room Poets book and music album
- Acknowledgement in the Empty Room Poets book
- Your business, artistic, or personal site listed under our "Neighbors" section of the ERP website, and promoted on our Facebook and to our Twitter followers, monthly
- Free Music CD from DJ Umbrage (Mark Jenkins of ERP)
- Personal "Thank You!" on our website, Facebook, and Twitter

Please note that perks will be fulfilled as soon as possible once the campaign ends.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to contribute monetarily, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

Here are some more ways that you can still help:

  • "Like" us on Facebook and "Follow" us on Twitter
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this page with your network
  • Do the "write" thing and get the word out about Empty Room Poets 
  • Promote and come to our live events with guests (those you like and those you can tolerate!) 
  • Check in with your local distribution channels (aka stores, shops, venues) that would be interested in carrying our books and CDs or hosting one of our live events (if there is interest, contact us at: emptyroompoets@gmail.com)

story:
The Significant 13

This Indiegogo project will fund the production, publication and distribution of an eBook and paperback book autobiography and documentary DVD of Werner Münzer’s life story, but primarily concerns itself with the thirteen significant factors and events that helped him to survive 757 days captivity in ten Nazi concentration camps, without having compromised his humanity.

About the Author

Werner Münzer was born in Berlin, Germany in 1920. Most of his family perished in the Holocaust, including his first wife, son and brother. In fact most of his extended family was robbed of all their belongings and murdered by the Nazis and their collaborators. Research into what became of his family indicates that over 400 people with his family name are officially listed as having been murdered by the Nazis. The fact that he managed to survive is nothing short of a miracle, or shall we say at least 13 of them. After living underground for two years, he was captured by the Gestapo in Amsterdam, Holland on March 20, 1943. His liberation came at the Bergen-Belsen concentration camp on April 15, 1945, where after several days of lying buried in a pile of dead bodies he managed to get an allied soldiers attention and be rescued. He spent over 18 months in hospitals recovering from severe malnutrition (weighing in at 77 lbs), and having Tuberculosis, Diphtheria, Typhoid Fever and numerous broken bones. At one point he was close to being declared dead.

What Else is Significant about this Project?

The Crowdfunding and self publishing format allow for a unique twist in writing an autobiography. They allow us to have certain sponsors ask the author questions and even follow-up questions based on their pre-publication reading of the book's manuscript. This form of interactive publishing provides readers the opportunity to engage the author to respond to matters that they find of particular interests. These questions will be the basis for a documentary interview DVD which will cover the questions and answers. The text of which will then also be included in the published book.

Since sponsors of Crowdfunding projects often pledge more than the value of the Perks being offered, and it is the Münzer family's wish that this story find the broadest possible distribution, all contributions in excess of the price of a book or DVD will be put towards the purchase of additional copies of the book and DVD. These will be donated to schools, libraries or other institutions interested in having the book available to their readers. This also applies to any pledge received that is below the price of a book or DVD. Thus, a dollar pledged will go towards the purchase of a book that will be donated. Large sponsors will have the opportunity to take delivery of the "Perk" books and themselves donate these to the institutions of their liking, thus enjoy whatever benefits such donations may entail.

If you can’t pledge money and still would like to help

Crowdfunding is all about getting the word out. Even if you can’t make a monetary contribution, and find this project worthy of your assistance, please help us to spread the word to as many people as possible. Every dollar goes towards a book being donated, so please help us get attention to our project by telling friends, family and any organization you think might be interested.

How funds will be used

Please be aware that this project is a “Flexible Funding Campaign” meaning we will receive whatever is pledged, no matter what. What this means, is that The Significant 13 will be published, no matter what. If our funding goal is not met, we will have to reduce or eliminate the professional help we require funding for. Budgeted elements such as for quality editing, formatting, artwork, promotion, quality camera equipment and other things that will make this publication a better quality book and DVD will be reduced or eliminated. The content however, will be the same. In the event we exceed our funding goal by more than 75%, a hardcopy book will be printed and distributed to those who pledge for a paperback book, at no extra charge to our sponsors. The Perk related books, which are intended to be donated, will still be printed and delivered in paperback form.

Final note

The Holocaust was not only the greatest genocide in human history, it was also the biggest heist; all assets and belongings of those murdered, displaced and of the survivors were stolen. Most were never returned! Most of the beneficiaries, who stole all these belongings, were ignored in the swift prosecution of the few of the worst murderers who were brought to justice.

We live in a time that holds great promise for the future of the human race. Our prospects to evolve in a positive manner have never been greater, yet the elements that allowed, ignored, contributed to and promoted the Holocaust still exist. This is why survivors always stress that their stories must be told, so that the Holocaust never occurs again. There are no guarantees in life, no matter where you live! And if we don’t examine our history we will not be able to timely recognize or prevent similar events.

This book is intended to raise awareness, and provide a spiritual strength that at our darkest hour, there is always still hope.

He spent over 18 months in hospitals recovering from severe malnutrition (weighing in at 77 lbs), and having Tuberculosis, Diphtheria, Typhoid Fever and numerous broken bones. At one point he was close to being declared dead.
What Else is Significant about this Project?
The Crowdfunding and self publishing format allow for a unique twist in writing an autobiography. They allow us to have certain sponsors ask the author questions and even follow-up questions based on their pre-publication reading of the book's manuscript. This form of interactive publishing provides readers the opportunity to engage the author to respond to matters that they find of particular interests. These questions will be the basis for a documentary interview DVD which will cover the questions and answers. The text of which will then also be included in the published book.
Since sponsors of Crowdfunding projects often pledge more than the value of the Perks being offered, and it is the Münzer family's wish that this story find the broadest possible distribution, all contributions in excess of the price of a book or DVD will be put towards the purchase of additional copies of the book and DVD. These will be donated to schools, libraries or other institutions interested in having the book available to their readers. This also applies to any pledge received that is below the price of a book or DVD. Thus, a dollar pledged will go towards the purchase of a book that will be donated. Large sponsors will have the opportunity to take delivery of the "Perk" books and themselves donate these to the institutions of their liking, thus enjoy whatever benefits such donations may entail.
If you can’t pledge money and still would like to help
Crowdfunding is all about getting the word out. Even if you can’t make a monetary contribution, and find this project worthy of your assistance, please help us to spread the word to as many people as possible. Every dollar goes towards a book being donated, so please help us get attention to our project by telling friends, family and any organization you think might be interested.
How funds will be used
Please be aware that this project is a “Flexible Funding Campaign” meaning we will receive whatever is pledged, no matter what. What this means, is that The Significant 13 will be published, no matter what. If our funding goal is not met, we will have to reduce or eliminate the professional help we require funding for. Budgeted elements such as for quality editing, formatting, artwork, promotion, quality camera equipment and other things that will make this publication a better quality book and DVD will be reduced or eliminated. The content however, will be the same. In the event we exceed our funding goal by more than 75%, a hardcopy book will be printed and distributed to those who pledge for a paperback book, at no extra charge to our sponsors. The Perk related books, which are intended to be donated, will still be printed and delivered in paperback form.
Final note
The Holocaust was not only the greatest genocide in human history, it was also the biggest heist; all assets and belongings of those murdered, displaced and of the survivors were stolen. Most were never returned! Most of the beneficiaries, who stole all these belongings, were ignored in the swift prosecution of the few of the worst murderers who were brought to justice.
We live in a time that holds great promise for the future of the human race. Our prospects to evolve in a positive manner have never been greater, yet the elements that allowed, ignored, contributed to and promoted the Holocaust still exist. This is why survivors always stress that their stories must be told, so that the Holocaust never occurs again. There are no guarantees in life, no matter where you live! And if we don’t examine our history we will not be able to timely recognize or prevent similar events.
This book is intended to raise awareness, and provide a spiritual strength that at our darkest hour, there is always still hope.

About Me

My name is Calvin Eaton and I am 26 years old. I was diagnosed with Fibromyalgia and Chronic Fatigue Syndrome. These chronic illnesses changed the course of my life.

Fundraising Objectives

My campaign is to help me raise funds to self publish my first book of poetry to inspire and give emotional strength to individuals who suffer with Fibromyalgia, Chronic Fatigue and other Chronic pain diseases.

  • Raise awareness and research funding to bring a cure to this debilitating and frustrating illness.
  • I plan to donate $1 from every sale once my book is published to the National Fibromyalgia and Chronic Pain Association (NFMCPA).
  • Donate what you can for this important cause.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I plan to self publish my book through AuthorHouse
  • The cost is approxmately $799
  • I plan to donate $1 from every sale once my book is published to the National Fibromyalgia and Chronic Pain Association (NFMCPA).

The Impact.

This book will recount my daily struggle through poetry encourage and inspire those with similar daily battles to persevere.

The daily emotional fatigue, depression and anxiety that Fibromyalgia brings out is often overlooked by family, friends, and the medical community who simply cannot understand the emotional and mental pain that we endure.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share my campaign to your friends
  • Follow me on my blog www.livingwithfibroblog.com

story:
Our Story


We both had the desire to work on the Balkans. 

Elisabetta, as social historian and cook, wanted to discover roots and similarities in a region (wide region, btw) that is geografically so close to Italy, but mentally far for many Italians (even though favorite touristical places as Greece or Croatian coast are Balkans). 

For many people in our country, Balkans are "something else", far, complicated, sinonimous of war, poorness, criminality... something too difficult to understand.

Nicola, as photojournalist and reporter, had the same attraction for the area, the same desire to know and show more.

And was aware about the social importance of food (and everything related with).

At the beginning of 2011 we decided to combine our abilities, start this project together, and concretize it in a book.

This work will be a great way to introduce the Balkan(s) culture(s), people, history (and stunning food)... to show the cultural richness and the great humanity that anybody can find there.

And it will be our contribution to break down many commonplaces.

We discussed it with our publisher and he gave his availability for editing and publishing the book; but, as he rules a small publishing house, he could not support financially our travels in the Balkan region.

Even if it was really hard, we self financied three trips, during spring and summer 2011.

Now, we have other two travels planned - one in Kosovo and Albania, another one in Macedonia and northern Greece - but we cannot afford them without a support.

The book should to be out by the end of 2012.

That means we must have the material completed before summer. And we cannot have all the material without the planned trips.

The text of the book will be in Italian and English.

We have a blog: www.lastradadelcibo.com, where you can have a look (it is only in Italian for the moment, soon it will be translated in English).


If you believe in the valency of what we're doing, support us.



As we said above, the aim of our campaign is collecting money for the last two trips in the Balkans.

If we don't reach the goal, we'll try to travel anyway using the money we'll get, but... finding other sources is really difficult: unfortunately, in Italy none seems to be interested in investing in culture.



Other Ways You Can Help

Talk about it with your friends, share it with your contacts.

story:
What:

Char Broiled  is the first installment of a hard-boiled trilogy that I began writing in early 2010, featuring Afghanistan war veteran and mixed martial artist Char Sadao.

My affinity to the hard-boiled genre stems from its capacity to deal realistically with society's ills.  Writing in the first person allows observations an omniscient narrator may have trouble communicating, and  I've  always gotten more emotional impact from fiction as opposed to non-fiction. Like a chef I have to do what I know and like, confident people will eat it up.

Why:

My first book, Endless Knot (Insomniac Press, 2001),  was an autobiographical look at my time living in a Zen temple while running fetish parties for a living. Overall it was a good experience, but meaning was lost in the editorial process for the simple reason that major publishers have their own agendas.

In 2009 my hard-boiled fiction won a grant  from the peer review board of the Canada Council for the Arts. Following that a blue-pencil meeting with a New York Times bestselling author, as well as meetings with several publishers, indicated to me Char Broiled is ready. Sensitive topics, such as society's acceptance of violence while it judges aspects of sexuality, critical timing and my past experiences with mainstream  publishing, have convinced me to keep control over the project.

Enter Indiegogo.

How:

Indiegogo funds will be used to pay for additional editorial and artistic design of Char Broiled,  for its sale on Amazon and other sites in 2011. Funds above the minimum requested will be put toward the trilogy, with the follow-ups to be released in 2012 and 2013.

Etcetera:

Ten percent of my royalties from Char Broiled will be donated to various funds benefiting fallen soldiers and their families. Whatever anyone thinks of war, these veterans and their families need our care and support.


The cover art was painted by Kelly Ulrich. See a cover tease on Char Broiled's facebook page -click on the burnt orange thumbnail.  http://www.facebook.com/pages/Char-Broiled-a-ha...

story:
The Politics of Pot - NJweedman Superhero of the Potheads

This combination road trip, documentary is about the last 6 weeks of freedom before trial of New Jersey marijuana activist Ed Forchion aka The New Jersey Weedman (http://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/NJWEEDMAN). Forchion is set to go to trial on April 10th in Burlington County New Jersey on charges stemming from a April 1st 2010 traffic stop in Mt Holly, New Jersey.
 
 

There Are Few People That Fight For Marijuana As Hard As NJWeedman. If you don’t know about NJWeedman, and you consume marijuana, where have you been smoking your marijuana, under a rock?  

 
This New Jersey native known as NJWEEDMAN has lived in Los Angeles since 2008 is planning to drive his Weedmobil (http://www.vimeo.com/19910141) beginning March 20th across the country to New Jersey filming all the way. He expects to be harassed by law enforcement because of his "free speech protected slogans" on his vehicle. Yet he plans on Meeting up with marijuana activist, jury rights groups, civil libertarians and media personell nationwide. (http://www.home.njweedman.com/node/17) Using  social media sites and the Internet to spread the message of his trial and more importantly his defense. 

When I left in 2008 I said I'd be back, If this is a "war" my analogy is I feel like General McAuthur returning to defeat the Japanese enemy In my case its "NJ Governor Christie".

Forchion is convinced that the way to end the Gov't war on potheads is to challenge the Gov't in courtrooms, to utilize jury nullification defenses, to openly question the law to jurors. He calls his defense a open advocation of Jury Nullification. The legal community considers this anarchy, while many believe it's the right of a citizen to present such a defense to stop the tyranny of Government. Forchion is risking a good portion of his freedom to prove it. 

For more details see - www.home.njweedman.com/node/182

 

National implications

Potheads, ganja smokers and many in the Cannabis Consuming Community of America are watching this trial. If Forchion can pull of this modern day David vs Golitah story not only will he solidify his position as a cult figure in the marijuana movement but in the history books of America. He and his case will enlighten many on how to end the current drug war on marijuana users.

Forchion says major social change happens thru courtrooms in this country pointing out ROE vs WADE,  and BROWN vs BOARD of EDUCATION to name a couple. Forchion knows more than half of the American public believe marijuana should be legal. With this fact he believes at least 6 of his jurors will think so as well, his goal at trial is to convince one of them to say "NOT GUILTY". He's openly looking for potheads to serve on his jury. He's gambling with his freedom that at least one of them endorses his Jury Nullification arguments and that's all he needs to convince ONE.


NJWEEDMAN believes that his case, his defense if given wide media coverage could open the eyes of the American people on a national level on how to end this failed drug war. 

Documentary Expenses 

While it can take as little as 3 days to go coast to coast NJWeedman plans to make it a 10 day trip stopping all across the country spreading his message of nullification. Once in New Jersey Forchion plans to gathering signatures for his entree into the congressional elections. Again filming this a must. Forchion plans on going to trial as a candidate for congress ( 3rd district) under The Legalize Marijuana Party. The end of the film will be the verdict of the jury.


A film crew has agreed to make this a professional project and will film it all at a very inexpense rate but not for free. The crew will be making a sizzle reel for a proposed show featuring NJWeedman if he prevails in his trial. Come on potheads if you ever wanted to support a pothead this is these.


1- the Weedmobil needs to have some minor repairs/ tuneup $500

2 - the Weedmobil needs to be outfitted with cameras est $2500

3 - chase vehicle for film crew needs tune up $300

4 - fuel expenses for both vehicles expected cost $3000

5 - salaries for film crew $3000

6 - food board, hotel $1000

7 - plane tickets for crew back to California $2000

8 -miscellaneous cash for unexpected costs - $1500

9 -  give always - books/tshirts/pipes $1000

10 - tolls $200

 

 

If your a pothead and can't contribute 

Please spend 4.20 minutes tweeting/facebooking and spreading the message of this case, NJWEEDMAN and his plight across the Internet. If you live near the proposed route please come out and join us.
 
The proposed route is I-15 out of Los Angeles, thur Las Vegas into Utah, route 50 to I-70. 70 all the way to Pennsylvania to I-76 into Philadelphia.
 
Stopping in Las Vegas, Denver, Kansas city, St Louis, Indianapolis, Cincinatti, Columbus, Carlisle Pa., and Philadelphia before crossing into new Jersey April fools day.

story:
What we do

Westminster Slam promotes literary arts and appreciation through workshops and monthly poetry slams at Botanica CoffeeHouse.

Erin Cavendar, Courtney Hammond, Willy Palomo, Megan Thomas and Melody Van De Graaff are students poets looking to travel to New York for the Collegiate Unions Poetry Slam Invitational 2013. Coached by Jesse Parent, we are the first Westminster team to go to CUPSI. Most of our poets are also part of the Westminster Honors Program.

Westminster Slam hosts traditional poetry slams along with novel events such as the dead poets poetry slams. We also have hosted workshops with poets such as Jamaal May and McPherson Time for the benefit of Westminster Slam and the community at large. We love what the Salt Lake Slam community has already done and we want to add to the momentum.

Your contributions will help us bring the power of slam to the wonderful people of New York City. We cannot do this without you and will forever remember your good will.

What We Need & What You Get

New York isn't cheap. We need funding for travel, lodging, transportation, food and event fees. Your contributions will help us pay for plane tickets and mostly make sure that we won't have to go dumpster diving for dinner.

Here are some of the perks we offer:

-Free passes to 2013 Botanica events
-Team and individual chapbooks
-Westminster Slam Feature

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute funds, we can always use your help for our montly slams. Spread the word, bring your friends to our events and pressure them into helping us get to New York. We wouldn't be here without you!

story:
Amazed: A Girl’s Infinite Pursuit to Grasp the Essence of Humanity in Writing 

Life is nothing as it seems.

And yet its simple but profound wonders are the core that makes human existence all worth it.

In this candid collection of essays and short stories, the girl with the infinite pursuit brings to light her insightful, heart-tugging, and seemingly ordinary moments in the chase to unravel the exquisite marvel that is our lives.


Why Do This?

Have you ever been so sure of one thing in your life?

For me, that’s writing. Even when I’m going crazy with whatever is happening in my life, I always go back to that still corner inside my heart where I can say everything without boundaries. And that’s writing to me.

Over the years, I have written personal experiences and observations that helped me get through. Made me understand why things happen or don’t happen. Brought me hope when life seems to feel unbearable. Writing has always done that for me. It has always taught me to be grateful.

It’s never been easy to reveal part of yourself to others, especially those thoughts most dear to your heart. But I know that it would be more of a disgrace not to. Since I owe it to myself and to the rest of this given life to make it count. These words, they will be eternal, and hopefully in some way bring meaning to the lives of those who will read them.

This collection reflects part of my life that I never imagined would be given a chance to be shared to the world. But now that my time has come, your contribution to publishing this book will forever be imprinted in my heart. A gratitude more than any words can ever try to express.

With your help, I can fulfill a dream. And that is, to share my deepest realizations of what life, for me and I know for many pursuers like me, is and should truly be all about.


Why we need your help

Amazed is self-published. With your support, we will be able to afford the costs associated in publishing this book.

Besides, they say life is richer, grander, and more meaningful when you share it with others.

And when you actually get to read someone else’s life and reflections from the pages of a book, life becomes more real, more resounding, and more deliberate.

You begin to ponder about your own life. On family, on work, on love, on hope, on pain, and on the real things that matter. It’s our personal learnings shared with others that make us better human beings because it teaches us not to become bystanders in our own lives.

That’s what this book sets out to do.

And with your help, this book can reach more readers, touch more lives. More than you think possible.

Production costs

For both print and eBook

• Editor fees
• Layout fees
• Cover illustration
• eBook conversions
• Marketing
• Print costs


Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us by:

  • Getting the word out about our campaign.
  • You can also blog, reblog, tweet, and share this campaign in Facebook.


About the Author

Joanne Crisner Alcayaga is a Journalism graduate from the University of the Philippines Diliman (UPD). She had previously worked as a writer for a Public Relations firm in Makati but is now working as a Supervisor at Tollways Management Corporation while doing freelance writing in her spare time.

Though she studied Journalism, Joanne is more passionate about creative writing, mainly doing personal essays, poems, and short stories on the essence and beautiful complexities of life.

Joanne Crisner co-authored Brightest, a children's book about a lost firefly catcher, trying to find his way home; and a broken firefly that had long lost himself. And how friendship and being there for each other had made a difference in their lives.

Autumn leaf in the cover from this site: http://www.pachd.com/free-images/nature-images/... was licensed free for personal and commercial use

to your heart. But I know that it would be more of a disgrace not to. Since I
owe it to myself and to the rest of this given life to make it count. These words, they will be eternal, and hopefully in some way bring meaning to the lives of those who will read them.

This collection
reflects part of my life that I never imagined would be given a chance to be
shared to the world. But now that my time has come, your contribution to
publishing this book will forever be imprinted in my heart. A gratitude more
than any words can ever try to express.

With your help, I
can fulfill a dream. And that is, to share my deepest realizations of what
life, for me and I know for many pursuers like me, is and should truly be all
about. 


Why we need your help
Amazed is self-published. With your support, we will be able to
afford the costs associated in publishing this book.
Besides, they say life is richer, grander, and more meaningful when you share it with others.
And when you actually get to read someone else’s life and reflections from the pages of a book, life becomes more real, more resounding, and more deliberate.
You begin to ponder about your own life. On family, on work, on love, on hope, on pain, and on the real things that matter. It’s our personal learnings shared with others that make us better human beings because it teaches us not to become bystanders in our own lives.
That’s what this book sets out to do.
And with your help, this book can reach more readers, touch more lives. More than you think possible.
Production
costs
For both print and eBook
• Editor fees• Layout fees• Cover illustration• eBook conversions• Marketing• Print costs 

Other Ways You Can Help
You can also help us by:

Getting the word out about our campaign.
You can also blog, reblog, tweet, and share this campaign in Facebook. 



 
About the Author
Joanne Crisner Alcayaga is a Journalism graduate from the University of the Philippines Diliman (UPD). She had previously worked as a writer for a Public Relations firm in Makati but is now working as a Supervisor at Tollways Management Corporation while doing freelance writing in her spare time.

Though she studied Journalism, Joanne is more passionate about creative writing, mainly doing personal essays, poems, and short stories on the essence and beautiful complexities of life.
Joanne Crisner co-authored Brightest, a children's book about a lost firefly catcher, trying to find his way home; and a broken firefly that had long lost himself. And how friendship and being there for each other had made a difference in their lives. story:
Important Update: We have a matching funds offer. A contributor has offered $4,000 to meet the original goal, if the campaign can fund to $3,500.

*************

Are you tired of reading misleading blog posts or news stories? Do rampant rumors, written as news, cause problems for your business, government agency, non-profit, or other organization? Then you should contribute to Be a Better Blogger. While the forthcoming book's audience of buyers is writers of every kind, the group of potential contributors is likely larger. That's you. 

Businesses or individuals in the news have the most to lose when rumors run amok and the most to gain from stories that are responsibly reported and factually written. My book will help writers of every kind, not just bloggers, do their jobs better. Your contribution to my crowdfunding campaign is an investment that benefits you, whether someone who reads the news or is subject of it. 

Joe Wilcox is my name. I bring two decades of editing and reporting skills to what I call online contextual journalism. My career started in print but moved to writing exclusively online when CNET News hired me to staff its Washington, DC, bureau in May 1999. I later worked as an analyst for Jupiter Research, then edited and managed the Apple Watch and Microsoft Watch blogs for Ziff Davis Enterprise. More recently, my title is BetaNews executive editor.

I am an authoritative writer who, with this book, plans to fundamentally correct egregious problems debilitating the news industry. That should matter to every organization about which bloggers, journalists, or anyone else writes online.

Your problem is this: Blogs and news organizations participating in the Google-free economy run like hamsters in a wheel. The majority chase revenue they can never catch. There is too much online content, and too much of it is alike, to sustain advertising for all.  There is too much space for advertising and, as such, ad rates are free-falling.

The consequence, as those hamsters fight for food: Reporting standards weaken in pursuit of pageviews and higher search ranking. Rampant rumormongering replaces factual reporting; so-called link-bating and news aggregation acerbate the practices. Tech coverage is glaring example of rumor too often masquerading as news. Stories about Apple is prime example. 

There is too much pressure on everyone to deliver more stories in less time. Post first, fix it later is too common practice. It’s a bloodbath; accuracy is the murder victim and readers are the wonted next of kin.

My original pitch for this crowdfunding campaign.

The Fourth Estate, as the news industry is often referred, has lost its way. Many bloggers don’t know any better, while too many professional journalists forego their training. Someone should show a better way, and one where everyone benefits.

Be a Better Blogger identifies problems with online news writing; sets realistic principles for reporting and writing well; and proposes sensible practices for the new era of contextual journalism.

Because of the Internet and widespread adoption of mobile devices in the so-called post-PC era, change in the news industry is inevitable. But it shouldn't be this. Rather than seek pageviews, news organizations need to return focus on building readership and, with that, trust. Producing original content and adopting proper sourcing standards are tantamount.

News organizations must adapt, too, to the post-PC era. Be a Better Blogger puts this adaptation into four categories of reporting: Advocacy Journalism, Contextual Journalism, Conversational Journalism, and Process Journalism. Behind them all are principles for responsible reporting.

Every rumor and inaccurate news report risks damaging your organization's reputation, or if a public company, share price. Be a Better Blogger creates a baseline standard for all online news writers. Everyone benefits from responsible reporting.

But for you to receive this benefit, I need to complete the book and market it. Be a Better Blogger cannot succeed without your financial assistance. Hence, my crowdfunding campaign, which so far focused too much on potential readers and not enough on the wider audience of contributors.

Please make a contribution or corporate sponsorship. If this book achieves the objectives promised, over the long-term the biggest beneficiary will be you.

Please don't hesitate to contact me with questions or suggestions. I can easily be reached by email: joe at bunnybows dot com.

About Some of the Perks

Comic-Con Heroes: The Fans Who Make the Greatest Show on Earth is a refreshing look inside the nation's largest pop culture event. More intriguing than Hollywood stars are the fans, the roles they play, and their aspirations. Meet a dozen San Diego Comic-Con 2013 attendees, including a toy archeologist, Medieval fighter, and classic Dr, Who imitator.

Chromebook Matters introduces readers to an up-and-coming new class of affordable, yet powerful, computers running Google's Chrome OS operating system. Chromebooks strip away the complexity of Windows, without giving up the benefits. The book is must-read for all laptop buyers.

Series 4 Android Collectibles, from Andrew Bell's Dead Zebra design shop, are highly-coveted by many Android smartphone and tablet users. The collectibles derive from the original Google mascot. They're blind boxes so your figure is a mystery until opened.


Anne Wilcox Original. My artist wife has designed beaded jewelry for more than 20 years. These handmade earrings are pewter and stone with sterling silver hooks (promise!); the beads in the photo are bone tone, but additional colors are available upon request.

story:
Who We Are

When Nigerian novelist, Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, addressed the TED Conference in 2009, she spoke of the danger of the single story, a distorted, one-dimensional view of Africa that sees the continent only through a prism of war, disease, poverty, starvation and corruption. Short Story Day Africa has established a day, 21st June – the shortest day of the year – on which to celebrate the diversity of Africa’s voices and tell you who we really are; what we love; love to eat, read, write about. We want to bring you the scents on our street corners, the gossip from our neighbours, let you listen to strains of the music we dance to.

Short Story Day Africa brings together writers, readers, booksellers, publishers, teachers and school children from all over the globe to write, submit, read, workshop and discuss stories - and foster the love of reading and writing African fiction. Because we have something to tell the world. About us. In our own voices.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

Short Story Day Africa is in its third year and the project has grown substantially since we began. This year, due to the volume of writers who ask us again and again to publish them, we'll be bringing out two collections of short stories selected from our competitions. Everyone -  established writers and emerging ones, young and old - will have the opportunity to be read.   Please help us reach our funding goal and in return, we'll send you an e-book of our 2013 collection. Fund us in excess of $100 and you'll become an official sponsor of Short Story Day Africa 2013.

Why do we need the funding?  We're bringing out an anthology and we want it to be slick and polished, sans spelling errors and bad grammar. We need an editor and a proofreader. We're very lucky to have a talented editor standing by, ready to do both, but we'd like to pay her. Please help feed our editor! Editors, like writers, need cheese sandwiches. (If you don't know why we need cheese sandwiches, google "Margaret Atwood, cheese sandwiches").

 

The Impact

Literacy! By running competitions and workshops in schools and beyond, we foster a love of writing that leads to a love of reading. Perhaps we inspire the next Chimamanda. Perhaps, ten years from now, a best-selling author will be asked why they started writing and they'll say they entered a competition for Short Story Day Africa, got published and discovered a passion for the written word. You could be reading that writer. In fact, what's to stop you being that writer?

In 2011, we had four Grade 5 classes take part in our workshops. Last year, our reach expanded and we were flooded with beautiful stories written by kids as young as five writing about their favourite animals; tweens, pretending to be scarves and jewelry; and teenagers writing about dancing. Our adult competition saw imaginative entries ranging from sci-fi insects to horror stories about lice.  They're out there, these wonderful talented people who write and want access to stories. You're out there. We want to give you the opportunity to do both. It's a wonderful plan, don't you think?

story:
Brief History

Back in the early 2011, we, an online community of photographers on social network Google+ thought it might be a fun idea to get together and publish a photography book containing some of our favorite photographs taken in the year just ended. As the idea of Plus One Collection book was born, it evolved into a project for a good cause, with all net proceeds from the sale of the book donated to charity. 

As a result, we published a beautiful photography book in print and ebook formats containing photographs from 500+ photographers from 50+ countries around the world. Book shipped to 60+ countries. More importantly, we raised over $10,000 which were donated to Kiva. 

Plus One Collection 2012

It felt great to publish this book last year, and we're doing the next volume this year. The rules are the same - anyone can contribute an image. We will then publish a print book, and an ebook which will contain all contributions.

To learn more about the book, and how you can contribute your photography, please visit our website. 

Charitable Cause We're Supporting

This year we're pretty excited to partner with The Kilgoris Project, and through the sales of the book and with your help we aim to raise enough money to supply children from the Kenyan Maasai Community with digital cameras and the skills to document their lives, photographing their families, their schools, their friends and their daily activities. In liaison with schools, orphanages and community leaders, our aim is to encourage and assist the children to create a visual documentary of their environment.

The images created will be collated in a book or content for an exhibition. This will then be launched with purpose of hopefully raising sufficient funds to feed back to the community, providing vital equipment such as clean water systems, medical supplies, food and clothing.

We hope this to be just the first step with this incredible project, a project that will not only gives us all a better insight and understanding into these children's lives. But also empower them to document their own story and to keep their traditions and culture alive.

What We Need 

We're doing the fundraising campaign because for this year's book we've teammed up with Oddi Printing, a professional publisher who will print the copies of the book. Here are the details - 

  • We will print 500 copies of the book
  • Each copy of the book will be hardcover 11x11.8" in size
  • Paper used is 150 gr UPM Finesse Silk 

Initial funds through this campaign will be used to pay the fees for fundraising, print the book, and ship it to early contributors. Any extra funds raised will go to our charitable cause. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Submitting your photographs for publication doesn't cost anything, and that's what will make our book beautiful!
  • We would love for you to get the word out and make some noise about our project
  • You can easily share the news about our project using social tools provided right here on Indiegogo.

What Others Said About Plus One Collection

Last year there was a lot of excitement about what we were doing. Here are some of our favorite quotes. 

"A huge group of very talented people decided to use their talents to help others, all with a big doze of a Silicon Valley technology" - NBC Bay Area

"While the collection includes work from some of the who’s who in professional photography, it has a definite democratic feel." - Forbes

"Within two months, working entirely through the online community - a book designer in London, a Web designer in Switzerland, an engineer in Germany, and a law office in Washington, D.C., all donated services - Makarov has self-published a visually stunning coffee-table book called "Plus One Collection," with 200 full-page photos." - San Francisco Chronicle

"I’ve loved seeing this project come together as photographers from all over the world have contributed (literally only 65% of the photographers are from the US/Canada, the rest are from all over the world including Europe, Asia and as far away as Oceania!). The book shares a love for photography and fine art along with a way that we have been able to give back to the world that we all find beauty in and photograph every day" - Thomas Hawk

Contact

Any questions about the project? Feel free to send Ivan an email (ivan[at]ivanmakarov.com) or ping him on Google+. 

Images of Last Year's Book

Here are some images of what last year's book looked like. 

Visual representation of last year's book cover and image layout.

Ebook poster and a mosaic of all images submitted last year. 

Peter Manis, one of the photographers featured in the book, with his copy. 

Copies of the book, during the "shipping party" that lasted 24 hours. 

 

Making of fine art prints that come with every Limited Edition of the book

story:
"Two Men Enter, One Man Leaves."

It's the only rule of ThunderDome. You remember that movie, right? Are we that old? It's the guiding philosophy of ThunderDome Press. (But less gendered, and really, instead of people entering an arena, it's just you and the story.)

ThunderDomeMag.com started with the philosophy that reading is for everyone. Everyone has time for it, everyone should do it. We don't believe in genre, we just believe in story. We bring them to you, and you face them down. The writing challenges you, moves you, changes you. Or maybe not. But in the reading, you learn something about yourself and the world around you.

At the end of 2011, we expanded beyond our online confines and released our first print collection, "...In Search of a City: Los Angeles in 1,000 Words". We featured stories by Craig Clevenger, Richard Thomas, Nik Korpon and many other great authors. That was just the beginning.

In 2013, ThunderDome Press will release two more print collections, with more on the way. But we're a small press, and this is a big ocean. That's where YOU come in!

We're starting this crowdfunding campaign because while authors love to see their work out there in the world, they love it even more when they can get paid for their work. We want ThunderDome Press to continue to attract quality work from renowned writers, and we want to pay professional rates to those writers for their work. 

THE BOOKS!

Our 2013 print collections showcase our dedication to the eclectic. We've got something for every reader! The artwork presented here is NOT the final cover for either book. We're finalizing those now and will post them as time permits. Our goal, in print, is to ALWAYS be beautiful. 

CIPHER SISTERS (Late July 2013)
Edited by Amanda Gowin & Michael Paul Gonzalez

Twin sisters, discovered dead in a house. No known relatives. No foul play. Who are they? Who were they? Inspired by the true story of the Miller Sisters, our story focuses on the lives of twin sisters Lucy and Darcy, piecing together their lives from true stories, legends, and pure conjecture. With these tales, we learn about them and their effect on the people who knew them, loved them, or maybe only met them once. Together, these stories present a life filled with love, dedication, anger, hatred, fighting, success, failure, and perseverance.  Featuring stories by Richard Thomas, DB Cox, edward j rathke, and Edward Morris.

The print edition of this book will be presented as a full-bleed black & white collection featuring photos and artwork not seen in the electronic edition!

 

BLOODY KNUCKLES (Fall 2013*)
edited by Michael Paul Gonzalez

15 hard-hitting stories surrounding the world of Mixed Martial Arts. What does it mean to be a fighter? Why do we fight and why do people love to watch? This collection contains stories from notable crime fiction writers and true accounts from athletes who've spilled their own blood on the canvas, men and women who love the struggle of unarmed combat.  

PLUS, we're in the process of reaching out to active professional fighters of every level and amateurs as well. We're going to include interviews and snippets with these fighters, getting a greater insight into why they do it, what they've sacrificed, and what the fight game means to them. We'll update the list of fighters on our website as they come in. 

Short, sharp, and spanning a variety of styles from Biography to Crime to Science Fiction, Bloody Knuckles promises to take you on a wild ride. The print edition of this book will be presented as a full-bleed black & white collection featuring photos and artwork not seen in the electronic edition!

Perks!

Our list of perks is there to help you save money while you invest in us! The prices you pay during this pre-order will be less than what you'll find on Amazon or Barnes & Noble. And here's a bonus! The video THANK YOU.

If you contribute to our campaign at ANY level, you will be thanked by name by our intrepid field reporter Adam. We've warned him ahead of time that he might need to read a LOT of names, but he assures us he's up for the challenge. The video of this adorable honor roll will live forever on our website. 

 

 

The Impact

Funding these books allows ThunderDome Press to become a professional-paying market while also maintaining our website to give up-and-coming writers a chance to share their voice with the world. The more successful this campaign, the more we will try to grow into new arenas. We want to create books that can't stay on a shelf, books that you want to leave lying around because of how amazing they look, books you have to keep picking up. 

You can be a part of that. You're our only hope!

Other Ways You Can Help

First of all, if you've read this far, congratulations! I will send you a photo of me giving you YOUR choice of a thumbs-up or gunfingers when you contribute to our campaign. Just mention that you read all the way down to THE SECRET. 

Even if you can't afford to donate, you can still help us out. 

  • Share this campaign on your social networks. You know people that read. You know people that complain that eReaders will be the death of the book. THIS is part of the solution. Let them know!
  • LIKE US ON FACEBOOK: Facebook.com/ThundaDome

story_txt:
"Two Men Enter, One Man Leaves."
It's the only rule of ThunderDome. You remember that movie, right? Are we that old? It's the guiding philosophy of ThunderDome Press. (But less gendered, and really, instead of people entering an arena, it's just you and the story.)
ThunderDomeMag.com started with the philosophy that reading is for everyone. Everyone has time for it, everyone should do it. We don't believe in genre, we just believe in story. We bring them to you, and you face them down. The writing challenges you, moves you, changes you. Or maybe not. But in the reading, you learn something about yourself and the world around you.
At the end of 2011, we expanded beyond our online confines and released our first print collection, "...In Search of a City: Los Angeles in 1,000 Words". We featured stories by Craig Clevenger, Richard Thomas, Nik Korpon and many other great authors. That was just the beginning.
In 2013, ThunderDome Press will release two more print collections, with more on the way. But we're a small press, and this is a big ocean. That's where YOU come in!
We're starting this crowdfunding campaign because while authors love to see their work out there in the world, they love it even more when they can get paid for their work. We want ThunderDome Press to continue to attract quality work from renowned writers, and we want to pay professional rates to those writers for their work. 


THE BOOKS!
Our 2013 print collections showcase our dedication to the eclectic. We've got something for every reader! The artwork presented here is NOT the final cover for either book. We're finalizing those now and will post them as time permits. Our goal, in print, is to ALWAYS be beautiful. 
CIPHER SISTERS (Late July 2013) Edited by Amanda Gowin & Michael Paul Gonzalez
Twin sisters, discovered dead in a house. No known relatives. No foul play. Who are they? Who were they? Inspired by the true story of the Miller Sisters, our story focuses on the lives of twin sisters Lucy and Darcy, piecing together their lives from true stories, legends, and pure conjecture. With these tales, we learn about them and their effect on the people who knew them, loved them, or maybe only met them once. Together, these stories present a life filled with love, dedication, anger, hatred, fighting, success, failure, and perseverance.  Featuring stories by Richard Thomas, DB Cox, edward j rathke, and Edward Morris. 
The print edition of this book will be presented as a full-bleed black & white collection featuring photos and artwork not seen in the electronic edition!
 
BLOODY KNUCKLES (Fall 2013*) edited by Michael Paul Gonzalez
15 hard-hitting stories surrounding the world of Mixed Martial Arts. What does it mean to be a fighter? Why do we fight and why do people love to watch? This collection contains stories from notable crime fiction writers and true accounts from athletes who've spilled their own blood on the canvas, men and women who love the struggle of unarmed combat.  
PLUS, we're in the process of reaching out to active professional fighters of every level and amateurs as well. We're going to include interviews and snippets with these fighters, getting a greater insight into why they do it, what they've sacrificed, and what the fight game means to them. We'll update the list of fighters on our website as they come in. 
Short, sharp, and spanning a variety of styles from Biography to Crime to Science Fiction, Bloody Knuckles promises to take you on a wild ride. The print edition of this book will be presented as a full-bleed black & white collection featuring photos and artwork not seen in the electronic edition!
Perks!
Our list of perks is there to help you save money while you invest in us! The prices you pay during this pre-order will be less than what you'll find on Amazon or Barnes & Noble. And here's a bonus! The video THANK YOU.
If you contribute to our campaign at ANY level, you will be thanked by name by our intrepid field reporter Adam. We've warned him ahead of time that he might need to read a LOT of names, but he assures us he's up for the challenge. The video of this adorable honor roll will live forever on our website. 
 
 


The Impact
Funding these books allows ThunderDome Press to become a professional-paying market while also maintaining our website to give up-and-coming writers a chance to share their voice with the world. The more successful this campaign, the more we will try to grow into new arenas. We want to create books that can't stay on a shelf, books that you want to leave lying around because of how amazing they look, books you have to keep picking up. 
You can be a part of that. You're our only hope!

story:
What is “A Tale of Two Sisters”?

Hi, my name is Heather Elisabeth, and I speak for myself and for my sister Tori in explaining what our funding project on Indiegogo is all about. It has taken a few months to put this all together and after reading this you might understand the difficult but healing process it has been. Although it is a dark subject, this book is for a very good cause, and many good causes out there are being funded, so we hope you might find it as such! Let me explain.

This is a story about two (out of four) sisters who, unbeknownst to the other, suffered at the hands of the same man. It is two perspectives of the wrath of that man, Tori’s husband at the time, and my ex-brother-in-law. The story begins much earlier in our lives and tells of how and why we lost our self-esteem along the way, rendering us vulnerable to a predator.




Tori has already written her rough draft, and recently asked me to write about what I went through as an adolescent, and beyond, in order to complete the picture. While I was making the decision to commit to writing it, a good friend of mine, the only person in whom I confided at the time this was going on, asked me why – why would Tori ask me to write about this? Well, there are several reasons, and as I have begun the process, I would say it is because deep down, we both knew it would be a cautionary tale for the millions of children, women, and men who have suffered abuse in some way. Yes, I knew it would be difficult, going into that dark part of my life, but worse for me to keep it inside when I am a writer, and want to start somewhere with publishing my stories. And starting here, with Tori, means that she and I can support one another through the completion of this somewhat difficult task.  A much better plan indeed!


Hi, my name is Tori Pratt, and this is the story of how I got into an abusive marriage, what I went through there, and of my sister Heather's abuse at the hands of my husband. Writing this story is one of the hardest things I've done - going back to relive the painful details, and getting back into the head of that frightened girl. By writing it, I am completing that chapter of my life, and moving on in healing and growing stronger. Finishing and publishing this book is a huge step in healing and empowerment. It will give us the feeling of accomplishment, boost our damaged self-esteem and confidence, and let us know we are helping the many other abuse victims out there make positive changes  in their lives, and know that they are not alone and can find support. 


The Money Bit!

By contributing to this project, you are allowing Heather to focus on the writing and get the book finished, published, and distributed. And know that by supporting this project, you are contributing to the healing of these two sisters and many others in the same situation. Here's how the money will be used:

·  Living expenses while writing

·  A computer (I currently borrow my daughter’s laptop every day. She is very      patient about it, but...yeah)

·  Researching for the book

·  Publishing the book

·  Paying the people who lovingly helped to create the project

Please note that I would be out in the working world to help pay for my living expenses, and hope to again, but I suffer from health issues which make it almost impossible to be in public where the ever-increasing issue of scents and harsh chemicals have landed me in the hospital more than once. Writing is something I can do easily in my safe home environment.

If we go over our goal, we will be able to do more research and go on to write our next book together! And perhaps I will get myself a really nice desk and chair.


Here are a couple of excerpts from A Tale of Two Sisters : 

*note - the following excerpts contain some alarming and somewhat graphic content.

Tori:


One day we were arguing, or rather, he was telling me what a slob I was, how if there were a pile of dogshit on the middle of the floor I would just walk around it. Well of course I wouldn’t have, but at the time, listening to him, I thought that maybe it was true. Even dogshit. “Yeah,” I thought, “I would probably just walk around it.” That seemed to make sense. I must have been really far gone to consider it as possibly true. Still, I didn’t want him to be right.

  “You don’t know anything about keeping house! Those ladies next door, they at least know how to keep a house clean and orderly. Look at this mess!”  He kicked a chair that had some clothes and books dumped on it. Some of them were his.  They all flew to the ground. Next he hit the table where the remnants of an old art project of mine still sat out, after a week; a sketch book, a glass of dried roses, a plate with dried water colors on it, a jar of blue-black water and paint brushes. “Why can’t you just put things away when you’re done with them!” he yelled. “This place is a pig sty! And you just sit there! You’re just a walking, talking piece of shit!”

  I guess I felt like I needed to respond to that in some way, or else it would surely be true. “Well, you’re the only one who thinks so,” I made myself say with all the defiance I could muster up.

  He steeled his eyes tight and, looking straight at me, he hissed into my face, “I’m the only one who really knows you.” He picked up a teapot from the table, hurled it to the floor, and stomped out of the apartment.

  I looked down in disbelief. The teapot crashed and broke and water splattered all over the floor. I stood still, unable to move. That last statement cut me deep in my soul, shredded some last remnants of who I thought I was. He was right--  he did know me best, I thought. I may actually be as worthless as he said, as worthless as I felt in my darkest moments.

I didn’t have any equipment to deal with this. I felt like a grenade had just been lobbed at me and exploded right about gut level. There I was, blown into small pieces and splattered on the floor with the broken kettle and spilled water.  I slowly turned away from the mess, and fell down on the bed sobbing. I didn’t know what those emotions were that thrashed my being, but I knew they hurt. I started to think that what he said was really true. I guess I was a piece of shit — he had proof! He knew me really well! I couldn’t argue with that. But did everyone else think so? I needed to know. I couldn’t calm myself down until I talked to someone about it.

We didn’t have a phone in the apartment, but there was a pay phone at the other end of the building, on the street. I desperately wanted to talk to someone, but I couldn’t control the convulsive crying; it took over my body. I was afraid to go out to the street, afraid maybe I wouldn’t make it to the phone, or worse, someone I called would say, “Well, yeah, I didn’t want to say it, but you’re pretty much a piece of shit. He’s right.” The heaves kept coming, bigger and louder waves crashing over me.

Heather:

Tori and I grew up together in three different countries, in an extremely dysfunctional family. Our parents were never on the same page, and argued very passively for years. The combination of all this had us girls rather mixed up, culturally and emotionally. We were all unhappy at different points in our lives, and experienced rather a lot of trauma while we were growing up, and even well into our adulthood. Three of us wrote about it intermittently through the years as a means of expression and release. As a musician, I also wrote songs for the same reason.  We all found our creative outlets, and unfortunately our not so creative vices, and I wrote about that in song and prose as well. Thank God for my journals...and even the vices I depended on, in moderation, of course. They saved me from slipping through the cracks of my bitterly lonely home life. Let me rewind a bit.

The first time our family moved to Japan was in the fifties, after the war and when Dad was working as a diplomat in the American Embassy in downtown Tokyo. He was also chief interpreter of the war crime trials being held in Manila, and was driven to moving up in rank as a marine. For that reason, he was not as present as many dads can be in the dynamic of the family. You could tell he always had more important things on his mind. As his daughters, we thought that no matter what was really going on in his head, that perhaps we had done something wrong, that we were to blame for his aloof, uninterested, and quite often stern approach to interacting with us, or not interacting at all. 
 Mom had her own way of coping with his lack of interest in her or the family, and got involved with the Christian Science church community in Tokyo, while falling in love with the posh life of living high on the horse in a beautiful, safe city. She was rather a home body and liked her privacy, and in Japan, no one pestered her to come and socialize. She could attend church and maybe an after church event, take the kids to brunch at the Sanno Hotel, the downtown military hotel where we ate and swam at the pool after church, shopped at the PX, and watched matinees. She'd then spend the rest of the week in her quiet home in Azabu, a part of Tokyo that was as lovely as a country neighborhood, right there in the middle of the city. The streets were lined with trees, there were parks with blossoms that brought beautiful bright colors to the neighborhoods in spring and summer. Behind the huge skyscrapers and grand hotels, there were tiny little streets with little stores that had bread and candy, fresh fruits and vegetables, and little markets with friendly merchants who shouted out their welcoming invitations to buy their fresh meat and fish. Vendors  sang of hot sweet potatoes and delicious noodles  while toting their carts around the little streets, bringing sweet and tangy smells to our noses on cold winter days. There were of course, in other parts of the city, huge department stores much like the ones in Chicago that Mom loved as a child. In later years it would become my city, my beloved Tokyo, where there was this feeling of well-being that held me together, as my family life began to fall apart.
                                                                      * * *
I ask myself - how could I have let that man have his way with me? Why did he think it was perfectly ok to ask me if he could touch my breast when I was barely thirteen? Why did I not say, no!! You can't!!
 I can't find the answer. It is so deeply embedded in my troubled soul that I suppose in writing about it, those answers may surface. For now all I can do is tell you about it, dear reader, let the story unfold on its own. Perhaps you will know the answer before I even do.


Tori : Here are some statistics I found that are alarming, but true, and why we know there are so many who need help :

·  Every 9 seconds in the US a woman is assaulted or beaten.  –Domestic Violence Statistics

·  . Around the world, at least one in every three women has been beaten, coerced into sex or otherwise abused during her lifetime. Most often, the abuser is a member of her own family. - Domestic Violence Statistics

·  Nearly one-third of American women (31 percent) report being physically or sexually abused by a husband or boyfriend at some point in their lives. Source: Commonwealth Fund survey, 1998

·  Nearly 2 in 3 female victims of violence were related to or knew their attacker. Source: Commonwealth Fund survey, 1998

·  Based on the reports we have, it's conservatively believed that in today's society 1 in 4 girls and 1 in 6 boys WILL BE sexually molested before they are 18 years old -- which means 1 in 5 of America's youth, or fully 20% to 25% of the population !!  -National Association of Adult Survivors of Child Abuse

Heather : Which leads me to talk about something else that is really, really important. There are things that happened to me and things I did to myself, things I hadn’t really connected with having been abused. They are very difficult to talk or write about, but are crucial in getting through the healing process, and I want to tell you a bit about that now. Not long ago, I happened to come across a list of symptoms of sexual abuse. It was shocking to realize that these symptoms had or have been haunting me for decades. These are the kinds of things we don’t talk about at parties, things we don’t even want to admit to ourselves. Here is that list with a short introduction, which struck me like thunder.

Child sexual abuse (CSA) has lifelong effects.  Adults who are survivors of CSA often report a feeling of being “stuck”.  Their efforts to build and manage their lives often seem fruitless, hollow, or even hopeless.  There can be a persistent perception that they are somehow different from others. They commonly report feeling that they are on the outside looking in or believe that they just don’t belong. The adult symptoms of childhood abuse can take many forms.  Many adult survivors may:

  • Find it difficult to develop or maintain close personal relationships.
  • Have a strong desire to live in isolation or to “hide out” from life.
  • Endure physical ailments like neck, back, stomach and gynecological problems that persist despite efforts at good self-care.
  • Experience feelings of sadness, fear and anger that often seem unmanageable or overwhelming.
  • Undergo panics, rages, depressions, sleep disorders, or self-mutilation or have suicidal thoughts.
  • Find themselves depending on alcohol, other drugs, or may develop eating disorders to cover feelings of humiliation, shame and low self-esteem.
  • Experience problems like low self-esteem, avoidance of sex, promiscuity, or inability to experience sexual pleasure.
  • Exhibit signs of trauma like panic attacks, numbing of body areas, and feeling of being disconnected from their bodies.

Now, a person can read these symptoms and get some kind of statistical knowledge of what this is about, and even identify with it to a point. But until you get into how these things come about, how they are interwoven into our daily lives over the years, it really doesn’t compute. Not in any way that is clear. What I feel, and what I read here in these statistics, are indeed connected, but the only way I can communicate it to you in a way that brings clarity to myself and my readers (hopefully!) is to relate it to you in a creatively flowing way, in my story. Because this is something so deep within our souls that it rarely sees the light of day. But boy, does it ever need to be cleared from the cobwebs, and brought back into the light. This is my, and Tori's wish for this book.



Here are some photos of Tori's designs for the tote bags and t-shirts. She will also honor requests if they are reasonable and not too difficult!
