story:
Story of My Book

Eleftherios’ Journey To Success follows the incredible story of my grandfather, Eleftherios, in his journey of pursuing the American Dream. This book is a fictional account based on real-life events that took place in his life. 

My name is Charles Euripides and I am the author of Eleftherios’ Journey To Success. I wrote this book because I wanted to share my grandfather’s immigration journey and pathway to becoming a successful entrepreneur. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that anyone has the ability to become a successful entrepreneur. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with the intersection between immigration and entrepreneurship and learn alongside Eleftherios about the importance of working hard and staying true to one’s beliefs. 

This realistic fiction novel follows the story of Eleftherios as he grows up in Arachova, Greece. As he grows up in this small, quaint village surrounded by family and friends, he remains passionate about pursuing the American Dream. After living in the village for most of his young adult life, he decides to take an enormous risk - moving to America. This book follows his pathway to becoming a successful entrepreneur in America, learning to adapt to a new culture, and overcoming adversities. 

You will love this book if you want to learn about immigration, if you want to understand more about entrepreneurship, or if you would like to find out more about Greek-American culture.

Eleftherios’ Journey to Success speaks to immigrants and entrepreneurs who are grappling with adapting to new cultures and want to discover methods to becoming successful in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Eleftherios’ Journey to Success inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How do you define success?
  • How do you overcome cultural and financial barriers in entrepreneurship?
  • What is the future of immigration? 
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing immigration, success stories, and entrepreneurship will change us all for the better. 
 

Eleftherios’ Journey to Success

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the author’s note + chapters 1-6. These chapters describe Eleftherios’ life in Arachova and his experience as a Greek soldier. 

Part 2 contains chapters 7-11. These chapters describe Elefterios’ journey and first experiences in the United States. 

Part 3 contains chapters 12-16. These chapters describe Eleftherios’ initial experiences in the restaurant industry.

Part 4 contains chapters 17-21. These chapters describe how Eleftherios became a successful entrepreneur. 

Part 5 contains chapters 22-23. These chapters show how Eleftherios considers America his home. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.
  • When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.
  • When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.
  • When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author

Charles Euripides is a high school sophomore who is interested in the intersection between immigration and entrepreneurship. He is involved with several extracurriculars, including the Debate team, cross country, and soccer. 

Charles wants to share the successful account of an immigrant pursuing the American Dream, and he wants to highlight how any person is capable of reaching success. He is passionate about immigration policy and entrepreneurship. 

Charles is a an avid yoyo enthusiast and is passionate about fitness. He can be seen running on new trails or playing soccer with his friends. 

For more information, you can connect with Charles at geuripides@yahoo.com and on Instagram at @charlie.euripides. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #EleftheriosJourney and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Charles Euripides

story:
Short Summary

Meet Tricia and Stephen Preston

Thanks for stopping by!  We are so glad you have decided to have a look at our campaign!   We're a husband and wife team who create and write children's stories.  We've recently finished writing and illustrating our second children's book entitled "The Great Escape."  We love to create!  We love to inspire creativity and wonder in everyone we meet!  

Tricia is the illustrator.  After years of painting and drawing,  she discovered her unique artistic style through doodling and began on a new journey of whimsy.  Stephen is a musician who brings his crazy sense of whimsical rhymes into the mix.   Together, they bring a sense of whimsical fun and adventure into everything they do.

"The Great Escape" is a story packed full of adventure and fun.   Follow along with the Specks, a family of fish that find themselves in a tough spot.  As they figure a way out of their predicament, you will be inspired with courage and the determination to be free!  It's our desire that as children read and look through the pages, they will find their imaginations awoken to the fun and adventure that is also inside of them.

We also have a heart for children and a desire to help those that are less privileged or living in oppression.  So, as part of our campaign we will be donating 10% of all funds raised to International Justice Mission (www.ijm.ca), a non-profit organization that has a mandate to end slavery in our lifetime!  Slavery is unfortunately still a very real problem today.  It can come in many different forms such as child labor, sex trafficking, and poverty.  IJM is on the forefront in this battle to restore freedom, hope, and healing to those who are trapped in slavery.  

What We Need & What You Get

In order to see our book go from draft pages into print, we are hoping to raise $1500 through our Indiegogo campaign.  This will allow us to get 100 copies of our book printed and cover some of our costs in pre-production.  I'm sure you're asking "What do I get out of this?"  Well, not only do you get the incredible and fulfilling chance to help someone see a dream come to pass, and help those who are caught in slavery,  but you also get to choose from some amazing thank you gifts and packages.  

The Impact

We believe that life should be filled with fun and adventure and lived in freedom.  The Great Escape is about being courageous and not being afraid to live in freedom!  There are many, many people of all ages who are trapped in many different forms of oppression.  We are praying that as children (and the young at heart) read this story, they will be inspired to be who they are designed to be....living a life that allows them to live free and overcome oppression.   One of our personal dreams is to make a living through our creations (artistic, written, and musically).  We would be grateful if you would stop by our website and have a look around (www.funtasticalstudios.com).  There's also the added impact of supporting those in slavery around the world, as a portion of funds raised will be donated to International Justice Mission (www.ijm.ca)

Other Ways You Can Help

If for some reason you are unable to donate at this time, but love what we are doing,  there is still a way for you to help us out.  Help us get the word out by making some noise about our campaign on social media!  Share it with your friends.  Expand our reach.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools to post to your social media sites.  Any help you are able to give in this way is greatly appreciated!!  

Thanks again for checking us out.  May you be blessed with a life filled with fun and adventure as you partner with us in this journey!

Short Summary
Meet Tricia and Stephen Preston
Thanks for stopping by!  We are so glad you have decided to have a look at our campaign!   We're a husband and wife team who create and write children's stories.  We've recently finished writing and illustrating our second children's book entitled "The Great Escape."  We love to create!  We love to inspire creativity and wonder in everyone we meet!  
Tricia is the illustrator.  After years of painting and drawing,  she discovered her unique artistic style through doodling and began on a new journey of whimsy.  Stephen is a musician who brings his crazy sense of whimsical rhymes into the mix.   Together, they bring a sense of whimsical fun and adventure into everything they do.
"The Great Escape" is a story packed full of adventure and fun.   Follow along with the Specks, a family of fish that find themselves in a tough spot.  As they figure a way out of their predicament, you will be inspired with courage and the determination to be free!  It's our desire that as children read and look through the pages, they will find their imaginations awoken to the fun and adventure that is also inside of them.
We also have a heart for children and a desire to help those that are less privileged or living in oppression.  So, as part of our campaign we will be donating 10% of all funds raised to International Justice Mission (www.ijm.ca), a non-profit organization that has a mandate to end slavery in our lifetime!  Slavery is unfortunately still a very real problem today.  It can come in many different forms such as child labor, sex trafficking, and poverty.  IJM is on the forefront in this battle to restore freedom, hope, and healing to those who are trapped in slavery.

story:
A Fogaknak Csikorgatása dark fantasy antológia egy újabb novelláskötet 365 oldalon, mely a Shardhunters világán játszódik. Előző fantasy antológiánk, a Szilánkok dark fantasy antológia (257 oldal) is megvásárolható ezzel az újabb kötettel együtt nyomtatott, vagy digitális formában is.

 

A régi világ elpusztult, s romjain döghadak lejtettek haláltáncot."

1648-ban az ismert világ darabjaira hullik. Elszabadul a boszorkánypestis, a halottak pedig nem nyughatnak többé a sírjaikban. Az élőholtak mellett olyan szörnyek is felütik a fejüket, melyek korábban csak a rémtörténetekben léteztek. Az országokat átjárja a mindent elsöprő félelem. Egyesek teljesen elzárkóznak a világtól, mások a föld alá kényszerülnek, de akadnak olyan államok is, melyek létezéséről már csak mendemondákban hallani. A világba visszatér a mágia, a remény mégis szertefoszlóban… Ám akadnak olyanok, akik ezekben a sötét órákban is felülkerekednek a rettegésen, hogy túléljék az apokalipszist, és rendet teremtsenek a mindent átjáró káoszban.

A könyv minden novellájához tartozik egy teljes oldalas illusztráció, íme egy pár ízelítő ezekből:

Amennyiben elnyerte a tetszésedet a novelláskötet, kérjük, hogy válassz egy perk-et és rendelj magadnak egy példányt, ezzel is segítve a további munkásságunkat. Ha ezt nem teheted meg, akkor azzal is rengeteget tudsz segíteni, ha az oldal tetején található közösségi média gombok segítségével megosztod ezt a kampányt az ismerőseiddel. Kis csapat vagyunk, így minden megosztás számít és minden segítségnek örülünk :)

story:
¿Qué?

Las escamas del primigenio es la esperada continuación de Las reliquias de Dirce, ejerciendo a un tiempo de memorable cierre a la saga Secretos de Pompeya.

A principios del siglo XX la humanidad está condenada a su total y absoluta extinción. Chtulhu ha despertado de su letargo y sus huestes asolan el planeta sin piedad. Los Dholes han descendido desde los abismos del Cosmos y ahora campan a sus anchas por La Tierra, masacrando cuanto encuentran a su paso. Es el fin de los tiempos del hombre, la muerte reptante ha llegado... solamente un reducido grupo de personas, capitaneado por Christin Larsen, podría tener la llave de la esperanza, un nuevo comienzo… tal vez.

En la primavera del año 79 d.C. Bruno el ateniense y sus compañeros encuentran su merecido reposo en la próspera Pompeya, tras regresar de la que, hasta el momento, ha sido la travesía más peligrosa de sus vidas. Cayo Julio Phillippi les acoge en su morada, invitándoles a formar parte de una nueva secta que toma fuerzas en la ciudad, La orden de Dagon.

¿Sabrán discernir nuestros aventureros entre el bien y el mal? ¿Conseguirán desbaratar los planes de la Orden? ¿Regresarán los arqueólogos de su salto a la misteriosa luz del templo oculto?

Atrévete a descubrirlo con esta trepidante narración en la que la antigüedad y el mundo moderno se entremezclan para dar resolución a la saga.

Ven a descubrir Pompeya y sus secretos, adéntrate en el misterio.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a G.V. Estiballes.

Guillermo llegó a los montes valencianos dos años antes del comienzo de la crisis. Trabajador del ladrillo por inercia y vocación, tuvo que inventar otras formas de vida al reventar su cómoda e insignificante existencia, probando en mil y un oficios. En el de vender humo a domicilio encontró su lugar por un tiempo pero este último tampoco le colmaba con lo que, finalmente, escuchó el consejo de pareja y amigos para meterse de lleno en la escritura (actividad que tuvo como afición desde muy joven).

En diciembre de 2016, se produce la  publicación de la novela Imagina que eres Dios, obra ganadora del IV Premio de Novela Tandaia; en mayo de 2018, se publica la novela Las reliquias de Dirce (primera parte de la saga titulada Secretos de Pompeya), bajo el sello editorial Tandaia; en enero de 2019, se publica Almas en Kontra, encargo del grupo de Rock vizcaíno para su tercer álbum de inminente lanzamiento; y para mayo/junio de 2019, está prevista la publicación de  la segunda parte de la saga Secretos de Pompeya, Las escamas del primigenio, bajo el sello editorial Tandaia.

Colabora en espacios radiofónicos tales como La Puerta de la Noche (Óxido Jin Radio, Ágora Sol Radio y Emérita Rock) y Canal del Misterio con lecturas de relatos propios y ajenos. Participa con relatos breves en grupos literarios de La Red: Escritores y Lectores, Círculo de Lovecraft, Escritores, Lectores y una taza de café, así como en talleres de escritura de bibliotecas municipales y Bibliocafé Valencia.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«No alcanzaba a percibir qué se movía por entre los cascotes que colmaban las calles y avenidas, las plazas y los terrenos donde antes se erigían las nobles mansiones de las colinas. Pero sabía que era cierto que algo había allí ahora. Algo monstruoso salido del mar. Algo gigantesco y viscoso descendido de los cielos».

«Valentina pudo distinguir cómo la pequeña figura de la jefa se acercaba al asustado antropólogo y le obligaba a bajar el cañón de un manotazo, mientras con la otra le sujetaba del hombro con gesto tranquilizador.
          ―Relájese, doctor Carpaccio ―susurró Christin―. Pronto recuperará el control de los sentidos. ¿Estamos todos bien? ―dijo inspeccionando a su alrededor.
          Valentina pudo distinguir que los cinco se encontraban a su lado».

«El héroe griego permanecía en pie, triunfal tras decapitar a Medusa mientras sostenía en su mano derecha la espada que Hermes le había regalado y en su izquierda, en alto, la cabeza de la Gorgona.
          Los tres compañeros se quedaron atónitos al descubrir que, sobre el rostro de Medusa, estaba colocada la máscara de Tritón.
          La máscara de Cthulhu».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 960€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y G.V. Estiballes vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
Story of My Book

Almost American summarizes my first-hand experience as an American immigrant, as well as the stories of other successful entrepreneurial immigrants living in the United States. 

My name is Billie Tuvshinbayar and I am the author of Almost American. My book has two simple goals — to inspire readers to achieve their dreams, and to empower others by sharing stories of those who overcame great adversity. To do this, I have embarked on a journey to share my own story; one that is unfinished and not famous. Throughout these personal stories, I share the ups and downs of my life, and share with you the influential people I admire and who teach me how to embrace being an immigrant.

Coming to America and living in this country is not as simple and easy as one might think. In this book I will share my story of coming to the States for the first time, learning English, exploring American culture, making friends, joining a sorority, getting my first corporate job, getting engaged to an American man, and how I am still viewed as a foreigner by many. I hope to show the obstacles most immigrants face and the issues they must overcome in their everyday lives. Ultimately, I hope this book can somehow be used as a tool to help people understand that immigrants are not a threat to this country, but rather the creators, inventors, and entrepreneurs that have significantly contributed to this great country’s society, economy, and culture.
 

The Book - Almost American

The book is written in Three Parts:
Part One: WHO I AM AS A MONGOLIAN. In this section, readers will have the opportunity to learn more about my childhood in Mongolia and how it has shaped me to be the person I am today.

Part Two: WHO I AM AS AN IMMIGRANT. In this section, readers will learn more about my life in America as an immigrant. Readers will learn what it is like to come to America for the first time, how different American culture is from other parts of the world, and my experiences with American work culture and the world of online dating...

Part Three: WHO I WANT TO BE AS AN AMERICAN. In this section, readers will explore my observations of America, those who live in it, and what it means to be an American.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish in April 2020

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Billie Tuvshinbayar is a proud immigrant living in the United States. She immigrated from Mongolia to the U.S. when she was 19 years old. After 10 years of living in the States and earning 2 bachelor’s degrees and one masters degree from Georgetown University, she finally had an opportunity to work for an American corporation — her lifelong dream. She is a firm believer that anyone can achieve their dreams, and upon realizing her passion for entrepreneurship and story telling, she decided to write Almost American to inspire others.

As an immigrant herself, Billie has met some of the hardest working people living in the States, whether they work in the cleaning industry or Silicon Valley. Often put in the spotlight during political campaigns, immigrants have been getting hit with a lot of negative publicity. In an effort to give a voice to other immigrants, Billie wanted to share positive stories of immigrants in this country as a way of defending those who have contributed so much to America’s economy.

Billie loves dogs and has always wanted to have one. Despite her fiancé being a cat person, she is hoping and planning to have a dog of her own when the time is right.

For more information, you can connect with Billie at billie.tuvshin@gmail.com, on Facebook: Billie Tuvshinbayar, LinkedIn: Billie Tuvshinbayar, and Instagram: @billie.tuvshinbayar.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AlmostAmerican and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Billie Tuvshinbayar
story_txt:
Story of My Book
Almost American summarizes my first-hand experience as an American immigrant, as well as the stories of other successful entrepreneurial immigrants living in the United States. My name is Billie Tuvshinbayar and I am the author of Almost American. My book has two simple goals — to inspire readers to achieve their dreams, and to empower others by sharing stories of those who overcame great adversity. To do this, I have embarked on a journey to share my own story; one that is unfinished and not famous. Throughout these personal stories, I share the ups and downs of my life, and share with you the influential people I admire and who teach me how to embrace being an immigrant.Coming to America and living in this country is not as simple and easy as one might think. In this book I will share my story of coming to the States for the first time, learning English, exploring American culture, making friends, joining a sorority, getting my first corporate job, getting engaged to an American man, and how I am still viewed as a foreigner by many. I hope to show the obstacles most immigrants face and the issues they must overcome in their everyday lives. Ultimately, I hope this book can somehow be used as a tool to help people understand that immigrants are not a threat to this country, but rather the creators, inventors, and entrepreneurs that have significantly contributed to this great country’s society, economy, and culture. The Book - Almost American

The book is written in Three Parts:Part One: WHO I AM AS A MONGOLIAN. In this section, readers will have the opportunity to learn more about my childhood in Mongolia and how it has shaped me to be the person I am today.Part Two: WHO I AM AS AN IMMIGRANT. In this section, readers will learn more about my life in America as an immigrant. Readers will learn what it is like to come to America for the first time, how different American culture is from other parts of the world, and my experiences with American work culture and the world of online dating...Part Three: WHO I WANT TO BE AS AN AMERICAN. In this section, readers will explore my observations of America, those who live in it, and what it means to be an American. 
What I Need & What You'll Get This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following: 
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish in April 2020

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

 
About the Author
Billie Tuvshinbayar is a proud immigrant living in the United States. She immigrated from Mongolia to the U.S. when she was 19 years old. After 10 years of living in the States and earning 2 bachelor’s degrees and one masters degree from Georgetown University, she finally had an opportunity to work for an American corporation — her lifelong dream. She is a firm believer that anyone can achieve their dreams, and upon realizing her passion for entrepreneurship and story telling, she decided to write Almost American to inspire others.As an immigrant herself, Billie has met some of the hardest working people living in the States, whether they work in the cleaning industry or Silicon Valley. Often put in the spotlight during political campaigns, immigrants have been getting hit with a lot of negative publicity. In an effort to give a voice to other immigrants, Billie wanted to share positive stories of immigrants in this country as a way of defending those who have contributed so much to America’s economy.Billie loves dogs and has always wanted to have one. Despite her fiancé being a cat person, she is hoping and planning to have a dog of her own when the time is right.
For more information, you can connect with Billie at billie.tuvshin@gmail.com, on Facebook: Billie Tuvshinbayar, LinkedIn: Billie Tuvshinbayar, and Instagram: @billie.tuvshinbayar.
 
Risks & Challenges The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. 
Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AlmostAmerican and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Billie Tuvshinbayar

story:
My summer job is to bring spoken word from my home in NYC, all the way to my new adopted home of Los Angeles, where I will be getting my MFA in Public Practice at Otis College of Art and Design. I will be doing this through my webstie, where I will curate poetry, images, and short films. 

My subject matter: New York 

 

I already have some sponsors and some assignments, but I still need funds for food, transportation, and production expenses. And, for my cross-country move, I need resources as well. My goal of 15,000 will finance my writing and short film assignments and other content, and will also serve as seed money for my start in LA. 

I can't think of a more exciting way to spend my final months in New York than acting as roving reporter and poet in residence. I'm looking forward to sharing my stories, and those of others as well. 

 

Thanks in advance for your support. No amount is too large or too small. Every contribution adds another voice to my project. 

 

You can check out my work here: http://www.youtube.com/user/TonyaIngram

story:
Roll out the magic carpet: How to travel in India and other life lessons 

This book will be part adventurous travelogue, part inspirational memoir and part travel guide. It will give people tips, advice and encouragement for following their travel dreams, or any kind of dreams. And there will be some useful practical tips too. Like how to travel safely in India.

Roll out the magic carpet is not just for people who want to travel in India. It's for anyone who longs to follow their dreams. 

A combination of Eat, Pray, Love and Lonely Planet India, this is the book that Breathedreamgo founder Mariellen Ward has longed to write for many years.

About Mariellen Ward

Writer and travel blogger Mariellen Ward travelled to India in 2005 to recover from grief and depression and to her surprise, she discovered she has a special affinity for a country that is famously hard on travellers. She spent six months travelling, volunteering, studying yoga, falling in love, blogging -- and having the time of her life.

Mariellen learned the secret of how to travel safely and well in India, and she wants to share her story and tips with others. 

To travel well in India, Marellen had to learn many life lessons, and these she will share with you in Roll out the magic carpet such as:

  • cultivating an open, trusting and non-judgmental attitude
  • learning to go with the flow
  • seeing beauty in the essence of things
  • recognizing that everything is as it is meant to be
  • following safe travel practises

The everyday realities of buying a train ticket, negotiating with an autorickshaw driver, confronting scenes of poverty, dealing with sensory overload and immersing in a new culture gave Mariellen a whole new perspective on life and taught her a wonderful skill: how to think happy.

Mariellen likens that first trip to a magic carpet ride. Since then, she has been back to India five times, and has amassed a wealth of travel and life experiences.

Travel tips and much more

This book will be a how-to, full of tips, advice, and pointers on travelling in general and travelling in India in particular. And it will also be encouraging, full of stories about overcoming fear, sadness and resistance.

If you contribute to Roll out the magic carpet: How to travel in India and other life lessons you will be contributing to Mariellen's dream of writing an inspirational book. And you will be contributing to the dreams of anyone who reads it and feel inspired to roll out their own magic carpet ...

How contributions will be used

Mariellen will use the money to write, design and self-publish the book.

For people in India only

Unfortunately, due to PayPal restrictions, you cannot contribute using PayPal. But if you visit this mirror site, set up in US$, you can contribute using your credit card.

Listen ... I want to tell you a story

To me, those are magic words. I grew up reading tales of fantasy and wonder, especially the 1,001 Tales of the Arabian Nights. As a child I believed in magic, and loved the tales of talking birds, and caves filled with treasure, and genies coming out of bottles.

But as an adult, I was hit hard by loss, and lost my faith in life and belief in magic and the power of dreams.

Until I decided to travel. When I really need to recharge my life, I went to India for six months. By myself. Was I scared. Hell, yes! But I went anyway, and everything turned out well. In fact, I felt like I was on a magic carpet ride for most of the whole six months.

I learned a lot about life, myself and how to travel on that trip. I also regained my belief in the magic of the universe.

Now I want to share my discoveries with others -- people who may also feel stuck, or depressed or like they can't pursue their dreams.

And that's what this book is all about.

The book I want to write will be part adventurous travelogue, part inspirational memoir and part travel guide. It will give people tips, advice and encouragement for following their travel dreams, or any kind of dreams. And there will be some useful practical tips too. Like how to travel safely in India.

So please support my dream of writing an inspiring book and make a donation. There are lots of perks, like heavenly incense, magic rings, wish-granting mantras and a personal guided tour of India's golden triangle. And, best of all, you will be helping give others the encouragement they need to roll out their own magic carpet!

Mariellen

Visit Breathedreamgo

Mariellen Ward is a professional writer based in Toronto, Canada. She has a BA in Journalism and has worked as a writer and editor all her life. Her articles appear in leading magazines, newspapers and online sites. 

Since August 2009, Mariellen has been sharing her passion for travel in India on her blog, Breathedreamgo.com, and on an extensive social media network. In 2010, she published a book of travel tales called Song of India, which is for sale on Breathedreamgo.com. 

Breathedreamgo is now one of the world's leading independent travel blogs about India. Please visit to learn more at http://breathedreamgo.com

SPECIAL THANKS TO:

  • Mychael Danna for providing the music in the video.
  • Danielle Winter for designing the book cover.
  • Alicia Taggio, Mike Corey and Arienne Parzei for help with video.
  • My guardian angel in India, you know who you are.
  • My family and friends, especially Victoria, Andy, Renee, Shelly, Helen, Jennifer, Swami Brahmdev, my Indian family in Delhi ... and many more, too numerous to mention.

story:
Why the title? Come-on, literally or metaphorically speaking we are not wrong to say that gravity sucks. Think about: it's the only thing that hold us down and then because it is hard to fit it together with the other forces in nature into a united theory.

This is not another rigid compendium of physics, in a incomprehensible language and with elaborate mathematical demonstrations. This is a documentary reading in a human language, largely accessible, of the knowledge accumulated by humanity about our Universe and matter. You will argue that there are lots of such documentaries and there nothing more to learn. I have to argue here because there is no book or documentary that treats the full knowledge about the Universe in a unitary and accessible manner to give you the larger picture - the "big picture".

This book is intended for the reader from the age of 10 to 110 and from "Jersey Shore" to the scientific that (let's hope) has the open-mindedness to consider it worth reading, eager to discover alternative insights. The book will cover several disciplines from cosmology, astrophysics and  relativity to the quantum mechanics and chemistry into an attempt to fit it together so, do not expect elaborate mathematical demonstrations. For those interested in deeper analysis of the subject I will provide annexes and a structured bibliography. This book will provide the ignoring reader with "five minutes crash courses" into the mainstream theories like relativity and quantum mechanics, their historical evolution, with proof and criticisms and different perspectives done by alternative approaches, inviting the reader to pull his own conclusions rather than imposing them. I will try to be impartial, unbiased by my own convictions but I have to admit that I am no saint. This reading wants to be at a certain level "all you need to know" on a widespread field of knowledge but mostly an awakening of the reader's interest for some less circulating ideas in physics.

The most important thing I have learned from one of my physics teachers is that if you formulate a problem correctly, that problem is almost solved. This book does not provide definitive answers for the simple reason that nobody could provide definitive answers (yet) but exposes the problems with a multitude of proposed solutions and the reasoning standing behind them. It is up to the reader's latitude to judge which solution has more commonsense - you'll be the judge.

Did the "Big Bang" ever occurred or is just the work of some physicists and mathematicians who started by considering the wrong hypothesis and due to their big ego they prefer to blow our universe apart rather than to admit they should consider alternative hypothesis?

What is the mechanism that produces those invisible forces of gravitation, electrostatic and magnetic attraction that fascinates everybody?. Newton and Einstein found some ways to model the laws that govern those forces but they were not able to give an acceptable explication of the physical mechanism. It seems that the only intuitive explication of such mechanisms rest until today the one formulated by Fatio and Le Sage three centuries ago. We will see what it becomes today their theory.

Is there an "aether" that fills all the space in Universe and if there is what exactly is it and how it behaves? What is that "dark matter" and "dark energy" we hear about more and more often in an attempt of "Big Bang" adepts to save their dearest theory?

What exactly is the "mass" that gives weight to us and does not let us speed up as we would like?

What exactly is the light, the photon, the electron and other particles real or imaginary proposed in different theories?

What are the "Black Holes" that appear evident mostly at the center of large galaxies?  Are they "balls" of very dense matter that generates a humongous gravity or are they just real holes in the distribution of matter, the kernel of a vortex like the eye of a hurricane that swallow the matter around and ejects it along its axis of rotation?

Does really antimatter exist or is just matter that behaves differently?

Are there more dimensions of our space or parallel universes or they are only mathematical concepts only necessary to consider when solving some mathematical problems? Do necessarily all mathematical concepts translate into real things or phenomena?

What exactly is the "electric charge"? There is a strange correlation between charge, mass and spin momentum of elementary particles. What that means?

That's a lot to ask but I think that everybody hears staff and sooner or later asks some of these questions and more you try to get answers, more questions rise. I always wonder if those who do not ask questions know everything or are completely ignorant.

If you wonder where those invisible forces of gravitation, magnetism and electrostatics come from and you are not happy just blaming God for them, see different opinions formulated until today.

If you never heard about Le Sage's theory of gravitation or you are among the few who heard about it but you consider it obsolete only because "you were told so", you must absolutely read this book.

Visit www.whygravitysucks.com to read excerpts from the book and learn "How I've discovered gravity".

story:
Hi there!

     My name is Kim Jarman and over the past few years I have studied art and design and am currently studying photography.

     My project is a children's story/picture book for younger readers, entitled Baxter The Bear. I want to publish this in a hard wearing glossy board book format. 

     The idea came to me last year when I was in a book shop, looking for a book for my four year old nephew. I couldn't quite find what I was looking for, and then it suddenly dawned on me that I could illustrate and pen a story, with him in mind. 

     I have been an avid reader myself from a very early age. My mother reminds me of how I would sit at the breakfast table reading aloud from the daily paper at just four years old - doubtless with a little difficulty but enthusiastically none the less.

     When I was nine years old, overseas with free time on my hands, I wrote a very long manuscript recounting the adventures of a teddy bear. There were no pictures back then, just chapter after chapter of adventures. So incorporating my artistic skills of today and drawing from memories of these early stories I am now in the process of putting together this story book. 

     Baxter himself is a traditional sort of hero bear  - making good of his life after being thrown out by his owner for being a little shabby.

     Do you have a fond memory of a favourite book from your childhood? I do, vividly and I feel it's something to cherish throughout your life. I believe Baxter has what it takes to be the stuff of memories and compete amongst the monsters, aliens and naughty children who fill the bookshelves of today.

     If I reach my goal I will be able to publish 500 copies of Baxter. The money will also fund a new camera to achieve more professional standard of photography and a laptop for editing and everything else!  If I am lucky enough to exceed that goal I will be printing more copies for free distribution amongst needy children's organizations worldwide.

     With your donation I can make this happen. Such is my gratitude for this creative platform that every donation I receive will be rewarded, however small.

The money will also fund a new camera to achieve more professional standard of photography and a laptop for editing and everything else!  If I am lucky enough to exceed that goal I will be printing more copies for free distribution amongst needy children's organizations worldwide.
     With your donation I can make this happen. Such is my gratitude for this creative platform that every donation I receive will be rewarded, however small.

story:
Hi, I am crazy.  Less “Lindsey Lohan” crazy and more “Werner Herzog” crazy.

Three months ago I decided to quit my job and throw out everything I own to travel through South America and move to Buenos Aires.  I had been working for several years as a video editor, also putting a lot of time into performance art and improv comedy, but my main love was and is writing and making my own films, which my NYC lifestyle left me little time to do.  I told a friend that though everything was going well in my life, I still wasn't entirely happy - like I was missing out and not being who I wanted to be. He said he had struggled with the same problem for years and things started to change for him when he started relying more on other people and asking for help.  When he said that a lot of things came together.  My biggest regret in life was not traveling more, I was always waiting for the right moment, to have the right money, knowledge, and confidence to go, but maybe all I needed was to be more willing to rely on other people.

I decided I would not renew my lease and would not look for another apartment in NYC.  Three weeks later I left for Bogotá, Colombia, the rainiest and dreariest place I have ever been to, and the first stop on my overland journey to Argentina.  Since then I have been pickpocketed, witnessed a bus hijacking, hit on by prostitutes, been attacked (twice) by large groups of children, and spent several days tracking the movements of an enigmatic burnout in my hostel.  So far this is awesome!

My computer died in Colombia and I had it fixed, but in Colombia, “fixed” means “destroyed.”  My teeth started coming out of alignment in Ecuador and I had them “fixed”, and fortunately in Ecuador, “fixed” means “sort of fixed.”  Right now I’m still in Quito where my money has nearly run out, because as nuts as I am, I am addicted to having things like Twitter, Facebook, and teeth that don’t make me curl into a ball and cry every time I eat / breathe / exist.  Also with my computer basically held together by spit and tape, I’m unable to keep doing the video editing work I used to make my living for the past several years.

As soon as I can I will begin a two-plus week trip through the Amazon Rainforest.  I will go from Quito to Coca in bus, then take a couple small boats across the border to Pantoja, Peru, to wait for a cargo ship that comes roughly 3x/month with no fixed schedule, on which I will have to find a place to fit my 6’8” body in a hammock.  During this three and a half day journey, for which I have to provide my own drinking water and dishes, I’ll spend most of my day covered by a mosquito net, absolutely avoiding going to the bathroom in the river because there is a fish that can swim up into your pee hole and eat your body from the inside out.  After arriving in Iquitos, the largest city in the world not accessible by road, I will get another three day ship to Pucallpa, passing through more remote parts of the rainforest and continuing to avoid the pee-hole-fish.  From Pucallpa, I’ll take an 18 hour bus ride to Lima, then head south to Machu Picchu and Lake Titicaca.

From there I will cross into Bolivia, “South America’s Disney Land”, where there is a bar that serves cocaine on the menu, women who dress up in colorful frilly dresses to wrestle, and one of the “must-see” attractions is something called the “Death Road,” where a hundred people fall to their deaths each year.  I will spend a few days at 3,600 meters in La Paz, crippled by altitude sickness, then head further up to Potosi at 4,000 meters.  In Potosi I will check out the “totally awesome” effects of Spanish colonialism and exploitation in the still-operating silver mines.  From there I will pass through the epic salt flats, Salar de Uyuni, into Argentina, which is a country absolutely too boring to talk about in the same paragraph as Bolivia.

WHAT I WILL USE YOUR MONEY FOR:  Food ($2-5/meal), water ($.50-1/bottle), hostels ($4-10/night), malaria pills, bus and boat tickets ($5-35), Bolivian visa ($135), dental bills ($$$).

Of the ways to make money online, the best bet is writing articles like “10 Ways To Turn On Your Man Child” and “Hot New Fashions For The Arab Spring” for sites that make money off ad revenue from visitors, and doing this pays only $2-3/hr.  I have been writing as I go and I would love to spend my energy on things that other people will actually find valuable and informative, and not to drive traffic to shady websites.  Up to now I have been living on $15-20/day if not less, so it won’t take much.

If I make more than my goal I will use the money to fix my computer along the way.  I’ve been shooting video that I will use to make an ‘installation/mood’ (pretentious) documentary of my trip and right now I can’t do anything with the footage.

WHY SHOULD YOU GIVE TO ME?  If your decision is between me and a charity, then for the love of God, give to the charity.  Especially with everything going on now.  I have an American Passport which means ultimately I will be alright.  But if this is something you’ve always wanted to do, something you have done, have a few extra bucks, or enjoy my paranoid ramblings and bad jokes on social media sites, then I want you to live vicariously through me.

IF YOU CAN’T GIVE:  Check me out and follow my posts on the social network of your choosing:

Twitter: @evanleed
Instagram: @evanleed
Tumblr:  www.evanleed.co.uk

story:
Ever wanted to take over the world?

Sure you have – who hasn’t? But, what’s the plan? Armies of expendable minions? Secret nukes? Hallucinogens in the water? Space lasers? God forbid, winning an election? All good ideas, but also, kinda stupid.

 

You’re not the only jag-off who’s trying to take over the world. There is China, Goldman Sachs, Sarah Palin, any Senator who can reasonably imitate life, Ellen Degeneris - just to name a few. You must avoid rookie mistakes.  That's where the world domination manual comes in; we'll give you a fighting chance.  


Actually, we'll give you half a fighting chance, because the book is only half done, which is why we're on Indiegogo raising money.  

 

You will learn about the following basics:

Bribes, Lies, War, Oppression, Running Away, Protests, Riots, Coups, Revolution, Super-Villainy, How to Turn People Evil, How to Resist Becoming Evil, Debating, Stealing, Economic Prosperity, Economic Warfare, Hiring Mercenaries, Installing Puppet Governments, Game Theory, CIA Predictive Models, Patents, Peer Pressure, Education, Assassination, Poverty, Terrorism, Genetic Engineering, Strategic Laziness, Strikes, Civil War, Elections, Rigged Elections, Purging, Diplomacy, Peace, Transparency, Civil Rights and Freedom. 

 
Yeah, it's pretty bad ass.  And concise - only 30 pages (it will be 60 when it's done), which is good, because you’re going to be busy.
 

What I Need & What You Get:

$500 will let me take a week off work to edit and rewrite the last half of the book.  It will also let me know that there are people who are interested in reading it.  I think applying game theory to politics is super cool.  It explains why elected politicians will always lie, and why dictators will always oppress.  If you want real change, you must change the system, not just the people in it.  But most game theory books are way to boring to read, so most people never hear these ideas.

 

If I don't raise the $500 - Fear not!  I'll still send you the book.  The second half will just be slightly less eloquent.

 

Also, enjoy the excerpts:

  • Excerpt 1 - Challengers and Incumbants
  • Excerpt 2 - 4 Good Reasons to Take Over the World

story:
Our Story
I grew up as part of a mighty big family, with 13 aunts and uncles on my mom's side. Just a few miles away from where I was raised in Lisbon, New York, the LaBrake family farm existed for decades. "The Farm" was our sanctuary, and a place we enjoyed holidays, reunions and weekly Saturday evening visits. I also fondly remember summers as a teen there, putting in hay, a memory I know is shared by many of my relatives.

Thanks to many of my aunts and uncles remaining in the area, some operating their own farms, family gathering were often a monumental event. Dozens of people of all generations filled the farm house where the LaBrake 14 were raised. On some occasions, aunts and uncles (along with their children) made the day trip from another part of New York State or traveled from out of state just to be there.
 
As a very young child, I was there when the last sibling got married and left the house for good. It was where I spent time helping my grandmother in the yard just days before she passed when I was just 16. At 30, I went there for the last time after the funeral of my grandfather. Although the property no longer remains in the family, my memories of The Farm are endless.

As I get older, my sense of pride grows stronger and I realize the immense value in being part of such a large and wonderful family. The level of devotion that my mom and her siblings demonstrate towards each other is a quality I typically do not see in families a fraction of their size. I’m especially grateful that, as of 2011, my mother and her 13 brothers and sisters have passed the age of 55, and all are alive and well.
 
Agnes. Born in 1933, she lives in New Mexico.
Teresa. Born in 1934, she lives in New York.
George Junior. Born in 1936, he lives in New York.
Ella. Born in 1937, she lives in New York.
Neil. Born in 1938, she lives in New York.
Don. Born in 1939, he lives in New Mexico.
Jane. Born in 1941, she lives in New Jersey.
Sharon. Born in 1943, she lives in New York.
Bill. Born in 1945, he lives in New York.
Carl. Born in 1947, he lives in New York.
Harold. Born in 1948, he lives in New York.
Peg. Born in 1949, she lives in New York.
Patty Lou. Born in 1950, she lives in New York.
Kathy. Born in 1955, she lives in New York.
 
Their story is an extraordinary one. These eight girls and six boys, born to George LaBrake Sr. and Hilda LaBrake, have managed to beat the odds of mortality. As the eldest sibling approaches 80 years of age, I have structured a book project to document their family stories in specific segments, including childhood memories, reuniting as adults, and words of wisdom. While a family tree exists, there is no other place containing these family stories. As a professional writer and published author, I see the value of saving those stories in one easy-to-read collection. Readers will be fascinated by facts, such as only one of the 14 was born in a hospital and only one sibling is left handed. The stories about life in America during the 1930s, 1940s and 1950s will also serve to entertain and educate readers who are fascinated by biographical subject matter.
 
The personal stories will be accompanied by a chapter that will consist of statistical data and analysis, illustrating the rarity of siblings born before 1960 to experience this kind of longevity as a group. An expert in the field will contribute observations about what factors may have contributed to this phenomenon. The chapter will also reference the few other families in America with similar characteristics.
 
The project will begin with personal interviews with each member of the LaBrake 14. I will travel to the home of each of my aunts and uncles, as well as my mother's home, to conduct a 3-hour interview of each person. I have developed a questionnaire containing 75 essential questions. I also plan to record the audio of these interviews digitally so they may be transcribed, with specific quotes used as part of the book.

I originally planned to conduct the interview of all 14 of them at once. I wanted to schedule it around the time of the annual LaBrake family reunion, which takes place at Lisbon Beach in the summer. Yet not every sibling can make the trip every year. In fact, the ability for these 14 siblings to collectively come together has been challenging for their entire lives. In the last 30 years it's only happened three times: in April 1982 for their parents' 50th wedding anniversary, in August 2001 for the funeral of their father, and then in July 2008 as part of the annual LaBrake family reunion.
 
Since I live in Texas, my first trip will take me to New Mexico to interview an aunt and uncle there. My next trip will be to upstate New York where the majority of my aunts and uncles live. The 11 New York interviews can be conducted over the course of 4 days, including travel time between towns. The 14th and final interview will take place in New Jersey.
 
Photography will accompany the interviews. Each person will be photographed after the interview, both inside and outside his or her home. Most photos used in the book will come from family collections, although new photos of the farm buildings may be taken, if permitted by the property’s current owner.
 
Once the interviews are complete, the process of writing the book will be limited to six months. Rather than writing a novel, the book will be structured by broader topics, such as Family Meals and Memories of Dad, with short contributions drawn from the interviews. Family photos will accompany some stories with a photo insert section in the middle of the book. The plan is to provide a self-published book in 2012, a year marking 80 years since my grandmother and grandfather got married.
 
The Impact
Documenting the story of my mother and her 13 siblings is a unique and personal journey for me. I believe they offer a heartwarming and significant example of the impact of a strong family bond. The stories and expert commentary provided in the book will also serve as an important sociological study of survival by siblings in modern America.
 
Their perspective of life outside The Farm will also be a fascinating element, as they share views of some of the 20th Century’s most notable events. They’ll reveal how certain events touched their lives personally while life on The Farm insulated them from other events. The Great Depression, World War II, and the assassination of John F. Kennedy will be among the memories shared by the LaBrake siblings. They will also look back at their favorite movies and music from their teenage years, and share their thoughts on emerging technology of their childhood, including the family’s first television set.
 
Time is a factor. It's imperative that the interviews be conducted as soon as possible due to the health concerns that naturally accompany aging as well as any unexpected change in the mental and physical conditions of the people who will be participating.
 
What We Need & What You Get
The interviews are the top priority and traveling to each person is the optimum approach. In some cases, these are individuals I have seen infrequently as an adult and I haven't seen most of them more than a few times in the past decade. Conducting the interviews by phone would be far less of a personal interaction, and the time I spend with them in person will be a key part of establishing rapport as both a nephew and professional writer.
 
The trips will involve car rental or airfare, as necessary, and include inexpensive accommodations in locations where staying with a family member is not an option.
 
I plan to purchase a Marantz, or comparable digital audio recorder. The high quality recordings can be used in future podcasts and other online material marketing the book. I also plan to purchase a professional camera, such as a  Nikon COOLPIX P500, in order to take high quality photos for use in the book and in marketing materials.
 
A professional graphic designer will be contracted to provide a book cover design and any other design elements that will be necessary, and a book editor will be hired to prepare the book for publication.
 
In the event that I do not reach my goal, phone interviews for select individuals would be an alternative plan. Recording and camera equipment may also be borrowed, if possible.
 
Contributors to the project will receive the following gifts:
 
Under $100: project updates from the author
$100 and up: project updates and a signed copy of the book
$250 and up: project updates, two signed copies, and special thanks in the book
 
Anyone providing a donation of equipment necessary to complete the book project will also receive the same gifts as a $250 contributor. Gifts will be sent once the book is published.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Once you've made a donation, let your family, friends and followers know that you're supporting a wonderful family-oriented mission. You can also inform your local media contacts and other organizations to help us generate publicity. Long before writing commences in November, the project is already getting the attention of journalists and broadcasters. A press release is available for distribution as well.

book cover design and any other design elements that will be necessary, 
and a book editor will be hired to prepare the book for publication. 
 
In the event that I do not reach my goal, phone interviews for 
select individuals would be an alternative plan. Recording and camera
equipment may also be borrowed, if possible. 
 
Contributors to the project will receive the following gifts:
 
Under $100: project updates from the author

$100 and up: project updates and a signed copy of the book
$250 and up: project updates, two signed copies, and special thanks in the book
 
Anyone providing a donation of equipment necessary 
to complete the book project will also receive the same gifts as a $250 
contributor. Gifts will be sent once the book is published. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Once you've made a donation, let your family, friends and followers
 know that you're supporting a wonderful family-oriented mission. You can also inform your local media contacts and other organizations to help us generate publicity. Long before writing commences in November, the project is already getting the attention of journalists and broadcasters. A press release is available for distribution as well.

story:
Ron Whitehead--Outlaw Poet and Kentucky's Poet Ambassador to Estonia? You got it! And a new CD? Even better! And for $1 to $100, you can help make this happen.

"I have long admired Ron Whitehead.

He is crazy as nine loons and his poetry is a dazzling mix of folk wisdom and pure mathematics."

Dr. Hunter S. Thompson


Outlaw Poet Ron Whitehead has been tapped as Kentucky's Poet Ambassador to the "ZERO TOLERANCE" International Performance and Live Art Festival in Estonia in April 2012. The "ZERO TOLERANCE" festival is named after one of Ron's own pieces (see video for more information).


Your contribution to this campaign helps Ron produce a special, limited edition CD (his 33rd) "etching ourselves into being" with 23 tracks of ground-breaking work and sends our Poet Ambassador to Estonia to give the week-long KEYNOTE PERFORMANCES to artists and young people from around the world gathered in Tallinn, Estonia. 


The Impact

We all look forward to a new CD from Ron, and are proud he was picked to represent us at this international festival.


But it's not just about Ron. It's about taking Kentucky arts to the world. As our representative to this intercultural dialogue and exchange, Ron continues to form connections that bring world-class performers to Kentucky even as he opens doors for American poets, musicians and performers to bring their work to the world. For over 20 years, Ron has worked tirelessly, toured tirelessly and sparked a Literary Renaissance with global impact, bringing Kentucky artists to the world stage.


What We Need & What You Get

In 17 short days, we will raise $3600:

  • $300 for CD recording and sound design
  • $2000 to produce 1000 "etching ourselves into being" CDs--23 tracks of stunning poetry and performance
  • $1000 toward Ron's airfare to Estonia to be the featured, keynote performer and Kentucky Poet Ambassador to the ZERO TOLERANCE International Performance and Live Art Festival in Estonia (April 2012)
  • The rest will cover mandatory fees associated with this campaign on IndieGoGo.


And perks? Yeah, we've got fabulous perks! At $10, you'll receive special thanks credit on the new CD "etching ourselves into being." At $25, you also get a copy of Ron's cd/dvd/book set "THE STORM GENERATION MANIFESTO and on parting, the wilderness poems." At $50, you get all of the above, PLUS an autographed copy of the new CD "etching ourselves into being" hot off the presses! $100 brings all of the mentioned perks plus a handwritten poem by Ron on a special art card. Ron's limited edition poems bring thousands of dollars on the internet; this is your chance to own a piece of history while supporting a great cause.


TRACKS ON THE NEW CD: etching ourselves into being

1) etching ourselves into being
2) music saved my life and Bob Dylan saved my soul
3) Can Art Matter?
4) wine dust
5) i will lick your leprosy
6) Keep Louisville Gonzo
7) zero tolerance
8) greyhound into and outta tennessee
9) will o
10) Trance Mission
11) a thief
12) our broken clay cups
13) Oh Nameless
14) Rani and the crow
15) philologically pseudo-hieroglyphic
16) my beloved
17) purple orchid dawn
18) the moon my shadow and i drink...
19) Searching for Frank Messina
20) The Sound of Falling Snowflakes
21) Book of Shadows I
22) Book of Shadows II
23) Gimme Back My Wig, The Antinomian Fire This Time

Other Ways You Can Help

Make some noise! Share this link with friends! If one third of Ron's 5000+ Facebook friends support this campaign at any level, this project will not only be fully funded, but we can produce a book to accompany the new CD.

story:
Poetry speaks. Poetry sustains. Poetry transforms.  At Saturnalia Books, our mission is to publish poetry of high merit by new and established writers. We want to push boundaries, challenge language, and feature marginalized perspectives. And we can't do it alone.

Donations to this campaign go to a few exciting projects...

1. Our incredible Spring 2021 titles:
MOTHER BODY (Diamond Forde) (WINNER OF 2019 SB POETRY PRIZE)
A SLOW GREEN SLEEP (Jonathan Weinert) (WINNER of the 2019 EDITORS PRIZE)
THE KAPUTNIKS (Peter Jay Shippy)

2. Our incredible Fall 2021 titles:
WHITE LUNG (Kimberly O’Connor) 
FAT GIRL FORMS (Stephanie Rogers)

3. Not one, not two, but THREE annual prizes: 
THE SATURNALIA BOOKS POETRY PRIZE
THE SATURNALIA BOOKS EDITORS PRIZE 
THE MALINDA A. MARKHAM MEMORIAL PRIZE IN TRANSLATION 

From our 2020 poetry prize submissions, we are thrilled to publish the following titles:
GREYHOUND AMERICANS (Moncho Alvarado, winner of the 2020 Saturnalia Books Poetry Prize, chosen by Diane Seuss) 
SPOOKS (Stella Yin-Yin Wong, winner of the 2020 Saturnalia Books Editors Prize)

We want to keep publishing poetry in a world that sorely needs it. Will you partner with us?

story:
*Updates and Milestones*

 A massive thank you to everyone who preordered already for supporting my dream to publish this book— with your help, we reached the $5,000 goal, meaning we will publish The Foreign National in December!

MY NEXT GOAL:  After speaking to my publisher, I’m excited to announce I’ll be eligible to publish a hardcover upon reaching the $6,000 benchmark, and an audiobook at the $8,000 benchmark

I know it's an ambitious goal but I know it's achievable-- and I hope you do too! With my eyes now set on this new goal, I appreciate your continued support to get there.

 

The Story of The Foreign National

The Foreign National is a fiction book about Marco’s journey from his rise to popularity at the age of 11, to his inexplainable disappearance in Thailand at the age of 27. In the years in between, Marco goes through many ups and downs, including depression, giving speeches such as a TedTalk, getting in trouble with the law, being actively involved in great philanthropic causes, and becoming one of, if not the most, famous person in the world. Most importantly though, throughout his travels around the world he discovers the prevalence of what he calls the foreign national experience.

My name is Luca Mcleod and I am the author of The Foreign National. I wrote this book because I wanted to challenge myself to something I had never done before. Initially, I was going to write about my life growing up in four different countries and how I have always felt like a foreigner, despite being a citizen of that country. Furthermore, I also come from a multinational and multiracial background which has made me ask more questions about my identity. In the end, I decided to use these elements as inspiration to write a fiction book, creating a world of its own and allowing more liberties than I would have been able to in a nonfiction piece. This book is meant to relate to the many experiences people around the world endure.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will gain a new perspective of the foreign national experience that is very common for many individuals. I hope this book inspires you to learn more about different countries, cultures, and people. Every one of us has a story that includes struggles, and as members of society, we should help each other through each of them.

Marco is an elementary school student in Barcelona trying to come up with a great idea. What should it be? He brain storms with his dad and eventually, they come up with a brilliant plan. He’s decided he’s going to find a way to connect students from around the world by implementing features such as a social media component, collaborative homework services, and by providing education accessibility to the poor, while also incorporating them into this ecosystem. Bingo! Off to the races.

However, as Marco’s popularity grows, his mental health and his close relationship with his dad take a blow. He suffers from depression and is eventually hospitalized for attempted suicide. Throughout his ongoing struggles and fame, Marco travels the world and tries to understand what makes the “different” people of a society, different and finds it’s within these contrasts, they become the same.

In the mix of fighting for great causes, such as climate change through his triathlon charity events, Marco also end ups fighting for his freedom. Once more, this much beloved national figure spirals in a downward trajectory.

Struggling to find meaning in life, Marco heads to the East as a last resort. After years of separation from the Western world, his dad visits him in Thailand to share that he only has a few weeks left to live, but before he can tell this news, Marco is kidnapped in one of the busiest markets in the world. No one knows why, and no one knows by who.

You will love this book if you enjoy success stories, drama, and learning about different cultures.

The Foreign National speaks to various communities around the world who want to grapple with topics such identity and mental health in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that The Foreign National inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What does it mean to be a foreign national?
  • How do our thoughts and behaviors affect our relations with others?
  • Why do we think that we are so different from each other?

 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with you, my readers. Despite Marco’s fame and success, he is just as vulnerable and flawed as anyone else. In this fiction book, I write about important—and difficult—issues that we all face in our lives, but often feel isolated and alone in. I can’t wait for us to build this community together, through the world and characters of The Foreign National.

What I Need & What You Get

The Foreign National will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in Winter.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Luca Mcleod was born in Atlanta, Georgia, and grew up in London, England; Barcelona, Spain; and Koblenz, Germany. He is a senior at Barry University, majoring in computer information systems, with a specialization in cybersecurity and a minor in psychology. Mcleod is also a Barry Service Corps Fellow, a resident assistant, a FlexLearning supervisor, and a member of the Student Managed Investment Fund at Barry. Mcleod enjoys playing tennis with his brother and basketball with his friends. He also loves traveling the world and eating all kinds of different food.

In the last few years, Mcleod has increasingly been writing more and considers it to be one of his new hobbies. Having seen his friend Joseph Minani go through Eric Koester book writing program, Mcleod decided it was his turn to write a book. Through writing the story of Marco, the main character of The Foreign National, Mcleod has been able to ask important questions and delve into research. The story of Marco is the story of many people around the world and I hope you enjoy.

For more information, you can connect with Luca Mcleod at luca.mcleod@mymail.barry.edu and on his website, Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #theforeignnational and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Luca Mcleod
